The Army also started working on adapting a hangar to serve as a hospital for COVID-19 patients, but the expected capacity is 70 patients.

column3: Is there a censorship against the use of chloroquine as a treatment.
column8: French scientst promoting chloroquine and hydroxychloroquine have created not only enthusiasm for this "treatment", but also acusations that the French government or the Big Pharma, are hiding this cure.
column9: fb, yt, etc. after a didier raoult video

column3: Posting anything on coronavirus will be a punishable offence because Disaster Management Act has been implemented.
column8: As per the Disaster Management Act, there is no provision that mentions that apart from government departments, no other citizen can be allowed to talk, update or share any news related to a disaster.

column3: Chewing betel nut can prevent COVID-19 infection.
column8: WHO has iterated that while some traditional medicines, western medicines, and home remedies may provide comfort and alleviate symptoms of COVID-19, there is no evidence of a single medicine to prevent COVID-19 currently. WHO has confirmed that betel nut is carcinogenic.

column3: Image of herd of deer sitting on a street interpreted as different locations in Sri Lanka and India.
column8: Original image of the herd of deer on streets belong to an old incident in Nara, Japan.

column3: Video of Al-Aqsa mosque after Israel allows photography inside it.
column8: The video is not of Al-Aqsa in Jerusalem but Cave of the Patriarchs in Hebron.

column3: Video of kids from Italy yelling at stars assuming them to be their dead mother.
column8: It's an old video from El Salvador and has no connection with recent events in Italy.

column3: Indian Home ministry declares posting about COVID-19 on WhatsApp groups a punishable offence.
column8: Indian Home ministry have not issued any such message.

column3: Picture of Sao Paulo graveyard, being prepared secretly for COVID-19 victims by Brazil government.
column8: The image is an old image from Manaus in Brazil and is unrelated to recent events due to COVID-19.

column3: A viral video showcasing an emergency treatment of a COVID-19 patient in Maharasthra, an Indian State. The video is shared in the names of different cities of Maharashtra.
column8: Our investigation revealed that the video is of a mock-drill conducted at Jabhua city of Madhya Pradesh (different State). It was neither a real patient nor from Maharashtra.

column3: Trupti Desai, a well known social activist from India, was arrested for illegally buying liquor during the COVID-19 lockdown.
column8: The video shown with the above claim is 7-months-old. Trupti Desai was detained by the Pune police after she threatened to offer a garland of liquor bottles to then CM Devendra Fadnavis.

column3: 18 nations, including the US and the UK, want Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi to be the leader of the task force to combat the coronavirus pandemic.
column8: While India is actively participating in global efforts to mitigate the damage being caused by the coronavirus, the claim that Indian Prime Minister has been chosen to head a global task force on the same is absolutely false.

column3: A Facebook post in Australia claims sufferers of respiratory conditions can access a “rescue pack” of medication by asking a General Practitioner.
column8: AAP FactCheck found the Facebook post to be misleading. “Rescue packs” containing steroids and antibiotics are a UK scheme available only to certain people. The federal Department of Health confirmed that people in Australia with pre-existing COPD conditions can only access a “rescue pack” of medication if it has been previously prescribed.

column3: Video of empty hospitals is proof that the pandemic is not real.
column8: Hosiptal in Bologna confirms that the claim is false.

column3: Christine Lagarde admits that something must be done about old people living for too long.
column8: C. Lagarde has never made the statment that is being attributed to her.

column3: COVID-19 pandemic is being used as an excuse to put microchips into babies.
column8: It's an old false claim, in circulation since 2014.

column3: The Disaster Management Act 2005 is going to be implemented in India, according to which no citizen is allowed to post any update or share any forward related to COVID-19.
column8: There is no such restriction on citizens to share any news or updates about the COVID19 situation, as long as it is not false information.

column3: Alleged resignation of the ministry of health in Costa Rica.
column8: "It is absolutely false", confirmed the Minister of Communication, Nancy Marín, to La Nación.

column3: Costa Rica is at the peak stage of the virus.
column8: Health authorities and experts explain that it is impossible to determine exactly when the maximum point of infections of the novel coronavirus will appear.

column3: Someone asking people not to use airconditioning in hot weather as heat will kill coronavirus 2019.
column8: WHO debunked this claim and said that hot weather and exposing yourself to sun will not protect you against COVID 19. the true part in his claim is that he said isolation in home is good in fighting COVID19

column3: The United States are “recruiting” doctors to confront COVID-19.
column8: The U.S. Embassy in Havana wishes to clarify that the US it is not recruiting foreign medical professionals to assist in the response to COVID-19. The announcement only covers individuals already approved and notified by the Department of Homeland Security

column3: The video says that Italian elderly over 65 are taken into custody ; Spanish elderly are asked not to leave home, and violators will be sent to a concentration camp.
column8: The video documents the violent arresting action toward protesters, which was conducted by the police in Baku, Azerbaijan, on October 19, 2019.

column3: Sneezing spreads droplets as far as 8 meters, and these droplets can stay suspended in the air for up to 24 hours. The velocity of sneezing is up to 35 meters per second.
column8: How long the coronavirus survives in the air depends on temperature, humidity, and the level of ventilation of the environment. Although droplets can travel and suspend in the air for a long time, the virus doesn't.

column3: Guatemala Secretary of Economy shared a video where the NYT praises the management of Guatemalan Governement during this COVID-19 crisis.
column8: We talked with the NYT PR department and they denied any relation with that video. The video was completely false.

column3: “Queen Elizabeth tests positive for COVID-19.”
column8: No credible reports claim that Queen Elizabeth II tested positive for COVID-19. Buckingham Palace recently said she remains in good health.

column3: Says COVID-19 remains in the air for eight hours and that everyone is now required to wear masks “everywhere.”
column8: There are different definitions of what is considered “airborne,” and while COVID-19 is spread through the air via droplets, it isn’t believed to be as transmissible as typical airborne illnesses, such as measles. There is no evidence that the virus stays in the air for eight hours and there is no requirement for “everyone” to wear masks everywhere.

column3: “if your child gets this virus their going to hospital alone in a van with people they don’t know…to be with people they don’t know… you will be at home without them in their time of need.”
column8: It’s illegal to treat a minor without parental consent in the U.S. Even as hospitals are limiting visitors, minors will always be allowed to have one guardian present.

column3: “They’re furloughing nurses in hospitals in western New York state.”
column8: Hospitals in Buffalo and Rochester said they were preparing for a surge of patients, not furloughing nurses. Some health care workers have been furloughed elsewhere as elective surgeries have been canceled to stop the spread of the coronavirus.

column3: Favipiravir is a miracle cure for COVID-19.
column8: Favipiravir is among the drugs being tested to see if it can help in treating Covid-19 but there's no proof it can cure the disease.

column3: Arbido is a miracle cure for COVID-19.
column8: Arbidol is among the drugs being tested to see if it can help in treating Covid-19 but there's no proof it can cure the disease.

column3: Croatia to be put in “total quarantine” due to secret deal between authorities and Red Cross.
column8: Red Cross doesn't have anything to do with implementing quarantine rules, nor did they attend a secret meeting with the Croatian government.

column3: Antibiotic invented in Croatia cures coronavirus.
column8: There's no proof that the antibiotic in question has any effect against Covid-19.

column3: Putin had a press conference and gave people a choice between 15 days isolation and 5 years in prison.
column8: Putin never held a press conference where he made such a statement.

column3: Muammar Gaddafi predicted “they” will create viruses and sell us the cures.
column8: Gaddafi has not made the claim that's being attributed to him.

column3: Italian Prime Minister admits Italy is lost.
column8: The quote is made up and illustrated with the picture of president of Brazil Bolsonaro.

column3: COVID-19 test in Germany is 37 times cheaper than in Croatia.
column8: The test costs approximately the same in both countries.

column3: People older than 60 not given medical help in Italy anymore.
column8: Italian doctors are treating as many patients as they can manage, regardless of their age.

column3: People who got a flu shot are at a greater risk from COVID-19.
column8: There is no evidence that a flu vaccine makes things worse for Covid-19 patients.

column3: 18 Italian people are illegaly entering Ivory Coast to flee coronavirus.
column8: Ivorian authorities denied: they are tourists coming from different European countries, and none of them are Italian. They entered Ivory Coast before actions were taken to slow down of the epidemic.

column3: RAI TV news report from 2015. proves SARS-CoV-2 was made in a Chinese laboratory
column8: The news report in question was not related to SARS-CoV-2.

column3: COVID-19 no longer considered a dangerous disease in the UK.
column8: The false claims misrepresents UK's system for disease classification.

column3: 5G is the cause of the coronavirus pandemic.
column8: Neither 5G nor other means of electromagnetic transmission are causing virus epidemics.

column3: COVID-19 is no more harmful than the common cold.
column8: There is numerous evidence that Covid-19 is much more dangerous than the common cold.

column3: PM Modi announced internet suspension due to viral fake news related to COVID-19.
column8: The news bulletin image is digitally edited. No announcement of Internet ban was announced by PM Modi.

column3: Indian state of Madhya Pradesh’s Goverement have issued order of shoot at sight due to failure at lockdown implementation.
column8: No shoot at sight order was issued by Madhya Pradesh Govt., the State goverement have issued a clarification regarding this.

column3: Home Ministry of India have issued an order that sharing of any news related to Coronavirus is an punishable offense under the IT Act.
column8: The viral order is fake and was not issued by the Home Ministry of India.

column3: A new born baby suffering from birth defects predicted that using Turmeric can cure Coronavirus in India.
column8: The baby was suffering from Anencephaly and was stillborn and has no connection with COVID-19.

column3: Iranian child celebrity Anahita is sufferenig from COVID-19.
column8: The family of the girl denied the claim on the girl's instagram account. the girl also appeared on a video 30/3/2020 and is appearing healthy.

column3: The Government is not getting the test to detect COVID-19 from the company Genomica because it is run by the sister of a former opposition minister.
column8: The Ministry of Health has acquired the Genomica tests and also those of Cestest, another Spanish company cited in the viral messages. None produces quick tests, but kits to do PCR tests.

column3: Castilla La-Mancha prohibits the use of adapted diving masks in patients with COVID-19.
column8: The Castilla-La Mancha Health Service ensures that its use "is left to the professionals' discretion".

column3: There is an old undocumented man that  “does not remember anything” hospitalized in the “La Paz Hospital”.
column8: The image was viralized in 2017 related with the same history, is not from now.

column3: A trucker assures in a video that he transports material to France and that it does not arrive in Spain because the Government does not pay for it.
column8: The material that was sent to France was not for hospitals but office supplies.

column3: The father of Pablo Iglesias, vice-president of Spain, is hospitalized at the Clinical Hospital of Salamanca, (the photo is from 2016).
column8: The image is from 2016.

column3: The former mayor of Madrid, Manuela Carmena, has received a respirator at home in order to avoid “going to a public hospital”.
column8: The mayor and the company that supplies the respirators denied it.

column3: Iberdrola, a Spanish electricity provider, offers a discount “for the coronavirus”.
column8: The company explained it was a discount for its users before the crisis.

column3: Coffins of people who died of the coronavirus.
column8: The images were from Lampedusa.

column3: All communications between citizens will now be recorded by the government in France.
column8: It's a message that already existed in 2017. Spread in several languages, in 20+ countries.

column3: Viral message claiming that disinfection will be conducted with the usage of helicopters in Poland.
column8: It was debunked by local authorities.

column3: The video shows Muslims licking plates and spoons to spread the coronavirus.
column8: The video has been on the internet at least since July 2018. It was there even before the registration of first coronavirus case in the world.

column3: A video of a man committing suicide by jumping from a hotel in Italy as his entire family died due to coronavirus.
column8: The video has been on the internet since December 2019. But, the first death due to COVID-19 was reported in January, 2020. So, there is no relation between the video and COVID-19. Also, the hotel in the video is in Spain.

column3: Video of Police strictly implementing lockdown in Spain.
column8: The video is not related to COVID-19 lockdown in any country. The video shows Azerbaizan Police (not Spain) dispersing a protest in October 2019.

column3: Recent photo of PM Modi visiting a Church and offering prayers to save the country from the Coronavirus outbreak.
column8: It is an old photo. The photo was taken when Modi visited Sri Lanka in June 2019. He paid homage to those killed in the serial bombings at St Anthony's Shrine (Colombo, Sri Lanka).

column3: Photo of Deer on Ooty-Coimbatore road during the current lockdown (COVID-19).
column8: It is an old photo. The photo is on the internet atleast since 2014. It was taken in Japan, not in India.

column3: Photo of a vaccine developed by US scientists for COVID-19.
column8: The photo shows a COVID-19 diagnostic test kit developed by Sugentech, a South Korean based company. It is not a vaccine. As on 23 March 2020, there is no vaccine for COVID-19. Also, Trump announced FDA’s approval of a Coronavirus ‘test’, not a vaccine, developed by a company ‘Roche’ to increase and accelerate the country’s capacity to test for the virus.

column3: PM Modi on 2nd April ’20 announced extension of nationwide lockdown till 4 May 2020.
column8: PM Modi has not made any announcement for extension of nationwide lockdown till 4 May 2020. The image is digitally edited.

column3: “Mainstream media” used photo from 2017 movie as an image from Italy’s coronavirus morgue.
column8: The original photo is from a 2013 news report showing an airport hangar filled with coffins of African migrants who died in a shipwreck near an Italian island. It has not appeared in any recent media reports.

column3: Governors across U.S. are announcing that the current school year will be repeated due to coronavirus school closings.
column8: The posts are April Fool's jokes, created using a prank-generating website to make fake headlines.

column3: UN is giving humanitarian aid in coronavirus emergency.
column8: UN is not delivering food aid. The message is a phishing scam.

column3: Spraying with boilling water eliminates coronavirus.
column8: There is no scientific evidence that proves that boiling water eliminates the new coronavirus.

column3: Hydroxychloroquine and Azithromycin are a cure for Covid-19.
column8: There are hopeful trials but they are small, early and have methodological issues raised by experts. There is no controlled clinical trial. Some trials are ongoing.

column3: Italian Prime Minister Giuseppe Conte broke down amid Covid19 deaths in his country.
column8: The image in question is old. The man in the image is not Italy’s Prime Minister Giuseppe Conte but shows Brazil’s President Jair Bolsonaro who was overwhelmed while speaking about an attack on him

column3: WHO reported that Coronavirus lasts upto 8 hours on cabbages thus, cabbage consumption should be restricted.
column8: WHO did not publish any such report.

column3: Rubbing mustard oil on your nostrils can prevent Coronavirus.
column8: Rubbing mustard oil cannot prevent Coronavirus.

column3: Notice for preparing emergency drugs was released on social media for alumni of Seoul National University College of Medicine.
column8: It didn't happen.

column3: Vitamin C can cure covid-19.
column8: Not based on medical evidence.

column3: The Japanese Government gives out 40 masks to every household, free of charge.
column8: It didn't happen.

column3: The covid-19 test kits from a Korean company are deemed suspicious by U.S. Congress.
column8: Not true. Some Korean media reported this because of a translation error.

column3: The executive order to restrict worship in South Korea for prevention of epidemics is religious oppression.
column8: It is possible to forbid by Korean infectious disease prevention law.

column3: The flight which was chartered for Korean people by the Korean government only served Chinese people?
column8: It turned out to be a chartered flight for Chinese people by a Chinese travel agency.

column3: Video of Muslims applying their saliva to plates and spoons to spread the coronavirus disease.
column8: The first Coronavirus case in the world was registered in December 2019. But the video is found to exist on social media at least since July 2018.

column3: Video of Muslims gathered on roads despite the curfew to curb the spread of Coronavirus.
column8: The video is from Ahmedabad (Gujarat) and was taken in December 2019. So, the video is of an incident that took place prior to the announcement of lockdown in Gujarat.

column3: India TV telecasted news that Bollywood Actor Shahrukh Khan donated 450 million (45 Crore) Rupees to Pakistan Oil tanker blast victims.
column8: The video is a clipped version of India TV’s fact-check video. In the original fact-check video, India TV has debunked the same claim and concluded that Shahrukh has not made any donation to Pakistan Oil tanker blast victims.

column3: People of Italy throwing money on the streets as they felt that the money couldn’t save them from COVID-19.
column8: The photos are not related to the recent COVID-19 outbreak. They were taken in Venezeula, not in Italy. Some people threw the notes as they became valueless due to hyperinflation in the country.

column3: Video of a person infected with coronavirus comitting suicide in New York.
column8: The video was taken in 2015. It shows a pregnant woman jumping off a building top after finding that her husband was having an affair with her mother.

column3: Photo of Kanika Kapoor meeting Prince Charles during her recent visit to United Kingdom. Prince Charles was tested positive for coronavirus just after the meet.
column8: The photo was taken in 2015 when singer Kanika Kapoor attended the Elephant family charity, 'Travels to my Elephant', hosted by Prince Charles and Camilla, Duchess of Cornwall.

column3: Video of Police strictly implementing lockdown in Spain.
column8: The video is not related to COVID-19 lockdown in any country. The video shows Azerbaizan Police (not Spain) dispersing a protest in October 2019.

column3: Recent photo of PM Modi visiting a Church and offering prayers to save the country from the coronavirus outbreak.
column8: It is an old photo. The photo was taken when Modi visited Sri Lanka in June 2019. He paid homage to those killed in the serial bombings at St Anthony's Shrine (Colombo, Sri Lanka).

column3: Indian Army has built a 1,000-bed hospital in Rajasthan in eight days for the treatment of COVID-19.
column8: The Indian Army has mentioned that the news that it is building a thousand-bed hospital for the treatment of COVID-19 in Barmer (Rajasthan) is false. Also, the photos in the post are old.

column3: A message warning of home thefts in Spain during quarantine by delivering subpoenas.
column8: There is no alert of this type of theft in the National Police of Spain and it is a hoax that has been recycling since 2011.

column3: Turning a severe person with coronavirus upside down can help them survive.
column8: Turning coronavirus sufferers upside down is being done in hospitals, and there are studies supporting its efficacy, but more scientific evidence is lacking.

column3: Coronavirus can be spread through fruits and vegetables.
column8: There is currently no evidence that food is a source or route of transmission of the coronavirus.

column3: South Korean presidential Blue House forbids the term ‘Wuhan pneumonia’.
column8: It was based on guidance of calling infectious desease from WHO.

column3: People from Wuhan share a laundry room although they are in quarantine.
column8: People in Wuhan should clean their clothes in their room, by themselves.

column3: When transporting patient, people who wear only a facial mask violate safety measures.
column8: They also use ambulances with negative pressure ventilation equipment.

column3: Health insurance fee in South Korea will increase because of the treatment cost for Chinese patients.
column8: The cost of treatment for foreigner will be paid from state budget, not insurance companies.

column3: Novel coronavirus came to South Korea through yellow sand storm.
column8: The virus dies after staying in the air for some time.

column3: Crackdown on drunken driving stopped due to risk of Covid-19 transmission
column8: The crackdown is ongoing ; it's a separate operation.

column3: Koreans who were on the cruiseship ‘Diamond Princess’ cannot be brought back.
column8: It is possible by negotiating with Government of Japan.

column3: Quarantined person fled from a facility in Daegu south Korea?
column8: The photos are manipulated.

column3: There is no way to forbid religious gatehrings temporarily in South Korea to prevent the virus from spreading.
column8: They can be forbidden by the Korean infectious disease prevention law.

column3: Person who fainted at a subway station has Covid-19.
column8: It was not. It was another disease.

column3: Ministry of Economy and Finance in South Korea and pharmaceutical companies had a secret meeting.
column8: There was no meeting.

column3: It is possible to self-diagnosis by holding breath for 10 second.
column8: There is no medical evidence for this.

column3: A 9 minute viral video in a woman claims India has entered stage-3 of COVID-19. She claims that her husband is employed with a major news channel and the information was passed to him by some Dr.Gyani who heads the Indian Covid team and asks people to stock up on food, medicines and baby food for one month. She also cautions people about the Army being deployed to enforce a strict lockdown in the upcoming days.
column8: Our investigation revealed that the claims made in the video are false and baseless. Dr. Gyani, an expert mentioned in the video as a source of the information, denied the claims and deemed the video as completely false. Also, the Indian government has already clarified that messages about Army deployment during the lockdown are false.

column3: Government of an Indian state Madhya Pradesh ordered shoot-at-sight to enforce lockdown.
column8: Our research revealed that a screenshot of a news channel report is circulating without context. MP government has not given any such order. MP government and Jabalpur police clarified it on Twitter.

column3: An image of a doctor goes viral with the claim that Dr. Usman Riyaz died while treating coronavirus patients in Delhi, India.
column8: he photo that has been gone viral is of Dr. Riyaz Usman from Dubai. He is alive and healthy. He does not work in Delhi. He has put out a Facebook post rubbishing the rumors of his death. We also found that one Dr. Osman Riyaz has died in Pakistan due to COVID-19. We also confirmed with Delhi Health Department that no doctor has been died due to coronavirus in Delhi.

column3: People in Italy are throwing money on the road as they are saddened by the fact that all the money in the world could save their dear ones.
column8: Our investigation revealed that the photos are from Venezuela. Last year, bank robbers had thrown the old banknotes on the road to make the point that the currency of the country was worthless. It has nothing to do with coronavirus

column3: A claim that a trolley collector at a supermarket in the Australian state of New South Wales tested positive for the novel coronavirus, COVID-19, in March 2020 has been shared hundreds of times in multiple posts on Facebook.
column8: The claim is false; the shopping centre where the supermarket is located said that it had no confirmed COVID-19 cases in March 2020; local health officials in New South Wales also did not report any confirmed cases in the suburb cited in the misleading Facebook posts in the final days of March.

column3: Multiple articles widely shared on Facebook claim that 59 church members died after drinking household disinfectant which their pastor said would prevent coronavirus infections.
column8: The claims, although based on an old story, are false -- South African police denied any current investigations on their part.

column3: A photo of a group of people holding a banner that bears the Chinese and Malaysian flags has been shared thousands of times on Facebook and Twitter alongside a claim it shows Chinese doctors arriving in Malaysia to combat the novel coronavirus, COVID-19.
column8: The claim is misleading; the photo actually shows medical supplies donated by China that were delivered to a hospital in Malaysia.

column3: A video has been viewed thousands of times in multiple posts on Facebook which claim it shows bodies of novel coronavirus victims being thrown into a ditch in Italy.
column8: The claim is false; the footage was taken from the 2007 US television programme Pandemic.

column3: A photo has been shared hundreds of times in multiple Facebook posts alongside a claim that it shows a hospital car park in Singapore which will be converted into wards during the novel coronavirus pandemic.
column8: The claim is misleading; the hospital clarified its car park would temporarily be used to test patients suspected to have been infected with the novel coronavirus, COVID-19, but it would not be converted into “wards”.

column3: Seven photos have been shared repeatedly in multiple posts on Facebook and Twitter, alongside a claim that they show vegetables donated to disadvantaged people during a curfew prompted by the novel coronavirus pandemic in Sri Lanka.
column8: The photos have been shared in a misleading context; they actually show vegetables being donated at an event in southern Sri Lanka in August 2019, more than eight months before the curfew was implemented.

column3: A claim has circulated in multiple Facebook, Twitter and YouTube that a “new virus” named hantavirus has emerged in China in March 2020. The posts were viewed hundreds of thousands of times as the world battled the spread of the novel coronavirus, which causes the disease COVID-19.
column8: The claim is false; scientists say hantavirus is not a new virus and was first detected during the Korean War in the 1950s; the US-based Centre for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) says the virus has almost exclusively been found to pass from rodents to humans, rather than from person to person.

column3: A post has been shared multiple times on Facebook in March 2020 that claims China and Japan are “free” of the novel coronavirus, which causes the disease COVID-19.
column8: The claim is false; data from the World Health Organization (WHO) shows new cases continue to be reported in both countries.

column3: A post that said coronavirus “was released by the Chinese Communist Party” and that is a mixture of HIV and tuberculosis.
column8: There is no evidence that the coronavirus was created in a laboratory and it is proven that its incubation period is 14 days and not 27, as the text states.

column3: A message that offers food assistance to people at risk of social exclusion in Spain.
column8: A WhatsApp chain says that due to the coronavirus quarantine they are "granting the new food card bonuses" with "initial benefits of 550.65 ₤". It is phishing.

column3: A tweet that stated that the former mayor of Madrid, Manuela Carmena, received a respirator at her home when she was ill with COVID-19.
column8: The former mayor of Madrid, Manuela Carmena, and the company accused of tweeting of delivering a respirator to her home denied that this was the case. She is neither ill nor received a respirator.

column3: A table comparing COVID-19 stats for countries that did impose lockdown against countries that didn’t.
column8: Although the numbers are accurate, some of the countries marked as "not on lockdown" are actually on lockdown. Also, the comparison ignores all other factors, including initial response and current stage.

column3: João Doria, governor of São Paulo, forbade doctors to give chloroquine to COVID-19 patients.
column8: Authorization for medication use in Brazil is not under state jurisdiction, but federal jurisdiction. Doctors are allowed to prescribe chloroquine for patients with severe cases of COVID-19 in Brazil since March 27. It is not different in São Paulo.

column3: Myanmar president and state counselor are under 14 days quarantine after meeting with COVID-19 patient from Switzerland.
column8: State counselor addressed about the COVID-19 updates few hours the post is published. President office spoke person U Zaw Htay has also confirmed to media that both president and state counselor is not in quarantine.

column3: Former MP Bimal Rathnayaka made a comment stating that deceased Muslims from COVID19 should be buried as per their customs and not cremated.
column8: Manipulated image to give the impression that MP Bimal Rathnayaka made a comment stating that deceased Muslims from COVID19 should be buried as per their customs and not cremated.

column3: Italians throwing money on streets amidst COVID19.
column8: This is an incident when a bank was looted in Venezuelan city of Mérida and old money notes had been scattered on the streets.

column3: Last picture of Indonesian doctor Hadio Alo bidding farewell to his family.
column8: This image was uploaded in Malaysia and this is not related to Indonesia.

column3: High death rate in Italy is due to people taking Ibuprofen.
column8: Both universities cited as the source termed it fake news, while the WHO has said there isn’t enough evidence against using ibuprofen in the treatment of COVID-19.

column3: Russia released 500 lions to ensure people would stay inside houses.
column8: This photo was is from 2016, South Africa, part of a movie production.

column3: Cuba sent 200.000 doctors across the world to help nations fighting against COVID-19 Pandemic.
column8: According to WHO and Cuban State Media, nearly 400,000 Cuban healthcare professionals working in 164 countries, out of them are only 50,000 doctors. Cuban government made this achievement in the past 50 years, not in a single year.

column3: Images of money thrown on streets by helpless Italians.
column8: Old image from Venezuela shared with false context.

column3: Shopping malls crowded in Italy during the pandemic.
column8: Old video from Brazil shared with false context

column3: Indian Home Secretary warning against those who post about Coronavirus on Whatsapp will be prosecuted except for government agencies.
column8: The Government has clarified that the Whatsapp forward is fake.

column3: Over 500 years of Adhan (The Islamic Call to Prayer) ban lifted in Spain amid coronavirus.
column8: The claim is false. There was no ban in Spain on Adhan (The Islamic Call to Prayer) for over 500 years.

column3: Indian State of Kerala’s government is paying news channels to telecast CM’s interview.
column8: All these claims are raised by using some screenshots of sponsored posts in Asianet News fb page & some pics of CM's press meet which is broadcasted in different tv channels with a sponsored tag. But the fact is the sponsored program is not CM's press meet. That's a program called 'Naam Munnottu' to give awareness about the government's different projects and also to interact with the CM. The last episode was about Kerala's hard work to eradicate corona & for that they used a one minute portion from CM's press meet video. That pics was used in the fb post claiming gov giving money to channels to retelecast the press meet.

column3: Actor Vijay donated 3 billion (300 crore) rupees for coronavirus relief.
column8: It is fake news claimed using a fake news card of Dinamalar news channel. The channel has denied broadcasting such news.

column3: There no coronavirus in Africa because there is no money there and they cannot get into debt with the International Monetary Fund.
column8: African countries are also being affected by the COVID-19 pandemic, and the IMF is already preparing some financial instruments to support these countries.

column3: COVID-19 can be removed with a blow dryer on the nose or with a pot of boiling water.
column8: Home remedies to remove COVID-19 with a hair dryer or a pot with boiling water are false, dangerous and without any scientific basis.

column3: China creates meat from the dead bodies of coronavirus victims and transport them to Africa.
column8: The photos used in the claim came from different sources: 1. some from a store in london was selling for Resident Evil game 2. most images are sculptures made from bread 3. some photos are from burying ritual in China.

column3: Medical masks have 2 ways to wear it depending on your purpose: if you are sick, put the white side on your mouth and if you fear infection, wear it the oppisite way.
column8: There is only one correct way to wear the medical masks: colored side on the outside.

column3: Video shows Italy turns to Islam after giving up by the Italian authoritis
column8: The video is from Hamburg protest in Germany in solidarity with Uyghurs, which was held 18 january 2020.

column3: According to the Mexican Health secretary, president Andrés Manuel López Obrador has COVID-19.
column8: The health secretary did not confirm that the president has COVID-19.

column3: Ronaldo Caiado, governor of the Brazilian state Goiás, was beaten up due to his lockdown decrees. A gallery of photos “prove” it.
column8: Pictures that support the claim were taken in 2013, and the man being kicked is just a lookalike.

column3: A PSOL (Brazilian left-wing oppositon party) state representative was arrested, heavily intoxicated, while attending a party during the COVID-19 lockdown in Niterói, Rio de Janeiro.
column8: The story itself is true, but the man is a member of PSL, Bolsonaro's party until late 2019.

column3: World Health Organization condemned lockdown measures against COVID-19.
column8: WHO did not condemn lockdown. During an interview, Tedros Adhanom Gheybresus acknowledge lockdown measures have serious economic impact, especially on the poor, but he did not say countries with epidemic focuses should abandon it.

column3: Two men identified as “the owner of Carrefour” supermarkets in Brazil in videos where they criticized lockdown measures.
column8: The largest shareholder of Carrefour holds less than 10% of the shares, so the company does not have a single owner. The men in the videos have no relationship whatsoever with the company.

column3: The COVID-19 epidemic is almost finished in the Netherlands. The government did not close a single shop. Tweeted initially by a former Bolsonaro minister, Osmar Terra, on March 31.
column8: The COVID-19 epidemic is not anywhere near the end in the Netherlands, and the government did impose lockdown measures, although lighter than in neighbouring countries.

column3: A video of a man, standing at a fresh food distribution center in Contagem, Brazil, claiming there was a shortage of food in Minas Gerais caused by lockdown measures. He claims the video was shot on March 31. ]The video was tweeted by Jair Bolsonaro, who, later, deleted it.
column8: The video was staged. It was shot while the place was being cleaned, so all the food stalls were taken away.

column3: As of April 1st, all coronavirus patients from Blumenau, Brazil, were cured.
column8: As of April 1st, there were 33 people still sick with COVID-19 in Blumenau.

column3: An inmate who was released from prison under COVID-19 “humanitarian house arrests” was arrested again in Campo Bom. Police officers found more than 100 kg of cocaine in his house, and several guns.
column8: Campo Bom police officers did arrest a former inmate with 100 kg of cocaine in his house. His prior release had nothing to do with COVID-19. Actually, he had finished serving his term.

column3: Video shows the suicide of an American man because he is affected by coronavirus.
column8: The video is from a suicide from 2015 of a 37 year old American man at Center City’s Embassy Suites Hotel in Philadelphia.

column3: Video shows that the Italian government/ Brisbane police used zombie robots/ drones to chase their citizen and make them stay home.
column8: The video was a prank scene filmed in 2016 in Brazil.

column3: Video shows a supermarket in Louisiana had a breakdown: people were plundering goods with armed soldiers onsite.
column8: The video documented that Mexican people were robbing a supermarket to protest against the raise to gasoline in January 2017.

column3: The video of unprecedented stone rain in Rome suggests the fate of pro-communist Italy.
column8: The video shows hail filmed in Zalau, Romania, on May 28. 2019.

column3: Should you take Ibuprofen to treat a fever from the coronavirus?
column8: World Health Organization does not recommend against the use of ibuprofen based on lack of medical reports showing any negative effects, and there is no published clinical or population-based data on this topic.

column3: Drinking alcohol beverages can help prevent COVID-19.
column8: Photo being spread online is of is a fake hospital news release saying alcoholic beverages would help reduce risk of getting coronavirus.

column3: Ron Johnson said Americans should go back to work, because “death is an unavoidable part of life.”
column8: A summary of Johnson’s USA TODAY guest column implied he was calling for a widespread return to work. That’s an exaggeration, since Johnson supports continued social distancing and some business closures. But Johnson did refer to death being unavoidable while noting the impacts a prolonged shutdown could have on employment and mental health.

column3: North Carolina “hospital beds are typically 85% full across the state.”
column8: Records show that NC hospitals are, on average throughout the year, between 60-to-75% full. However, medical professionals say Jackson is right that hospitals operate at maximum capacity during certain parts of the year, such as flu season.

column3: Italian Prime Minister Giuseppe Conte said, “We have lost control, we have killed the epidemic physically and mentally. Can’t understand what more we can do, all solutions are exhausted on ground. Our only hope remains up in the Sky, God rescue your people.”
column8: The quote attributed to Italian Prime Minister Giuseppe Conte is fabricated. The image accompanying the post shows the president of Brazil, not the Italian prime minister.

column3: “We’ve got to give the American public a rough estimate of how long we think this is going to take, based mostly on the South Korean model, which seems to be the trajectory that we are on, thankfully, and not the Italian model.”
column8: The U.S. and South Korea have similar case fatality rates – Italy’s is higher – but all three countries have age-specific mortality rates that are about the same. Public health experts say the fatality rate wouldn’t be the only or the most important metric used to determine when businesses may reopen.The growth in cases and hospitals’ capacity to treat new patients is the most important factor.

column3: Video of a waitress saying, “I lost my job. But I’ll sleep better knowing” that the coronavirus relief bill included funding for the Kennedy Center, refugee resettlement, PBS, and congressional salaries: “Thanks, Democrats”
column8: The post accurately cites several provisions that are in the coronavirus relief bill passed in late March. But it’s misleading to suggest the financial needs of a laid-off waitress aren’t addressed in the bill.

column3: Students in America have to repeat the same grade next year.
column8: Stories about students having to repeat their grade originated on hoax sites.

column3: President Donald Trump will announce that a scientist “finally found vaccine to cure corona virus.”
column8: Trump has not announced a vaccine to prevent COVID-19. As of now, there is no specific treatment for the coronavirus.

column3: Swiss newspaper says president of México is the “worst example” of how COVID-19 is handled.
column8: They manipulated the translation. It really says "Where the coronavirus is most dangerous"

column3: Putting eucalyptus (Vicks VapoRub) in the nose prevents COVID-19.
column8: Eucalyptus has some antiseptic and anti-inflammatory properties, but is not virucidal and there is no evidence that it fights SARScov-2.

column3: Water vapor inactivates SARScov2.
column8: There is no evidence supporting hot water as a preventive measure.

column3: Bolivian education, Minister Victor Hugo Cárdenas, said: “Students will repeat the school year”.
column8: The image is edited, Victor Hugo Cardenas actually said: “The COVID-19 is going to affect our school calendar, let's wait that this interruption will be short and the classes can resume normaly to make the readjustment to the scholar calendar.

column3: WHO’s general director stepped back and said that social isolation should not be a measure in the fight against coronavirus.
column8: In the speech highlighted by the posts, the executive warns, in fact, that governments should consider the social and economic impacts of confinement on the poorest population, but does not advocate the end or relaxation of these measures. The statement was made by Ghebreyesus in a press conference in March 30 and, since then, it has been used by profiles aligned to "bolsonarism" as evidence of a supposed retreat from WHO towards a position close to Jair Bolsonaro's opinion against social isolation.
column9: facebook posts, sites and the bolsonaro family

column3: The number of new cases of COVID-19 is decreasing since the 19th March in Peru.
column8: Mrs. León used wrong figures according to official information and explanations by specialists of the Ministry of Health.
column9: maría isabel león, president of the national association of private business institutions of peru

column3: We’re in a battle against a virus that is in the air.
column8: The congressman said it in the context of the study on the stability of SARS-CoV-2 and SARS-CoV-1 in aerosols and on various surfaces. But it was refered to the experimental circumstances tested and not in open spaces.

column3: Brazilian Ministry of Health hinted that relatives of COVID-19 victims should doubt the death certificates.
column8: The recommendation, which circulates on social media as if it were official, was denied by the brazilian Ministry of Health's advisory and does not appear in the guidelines of the Brazilian government on the management of bodies in the context of the new coronavirus.

column3: Video shows an empty Brazilian market and the cause of the shortage is the social isolation measures.
column8: The video, which have already been deleted by the Brazilian president, shows an unidentified man in front of the empty market complaining about the effects of the quarantine. The market (named Ceasa), however, is functioning normally, according to a note published on its webstie. According to the regional Association of Merchants, the misleading video was recorded on March 31 at a time when Ceasa was closed for cleaning.

column3: Lukewarm water with lemon or water with lemon and bicarbonate are preventive measures for COVID-19.
column8: There is no scientific evidence that hot water or vitamin C prevents COVID-19.

column3: Before reaching the lungs, The coronavirus remains in the throat for three or four days and at this time the person begins to cough and have sore throats. If you drink a lot of water and gargle with warm water and salt or vinegar, remove the virus.
column8: The WHO does not include among its recommendations drinking or gargling with any liquid as a prevention method. Also, that can damage the throat.

column3: Water in Venice begins to become more crystalline, thanks to the ban in Italy by COVID-19.
column8: The event happened in Cagliari, Sardinia, 874 kilometers from Venice

column3: The photo of a porn actor used to pass as a health professional.
column8: Several publications on Facebook and Twitter, some with up to 24 thousand interactions, present Ángel Muñoz, popularly known as "Jordi el Niño Polla", as part of various teams to deal with the pandemic due to the new coronavirus.

column3: A boy is called COVID-19 in Monterrey, Mexico.
column8: Until March 18 we do not have records of people bearing that name in Monterrey, México.

column3: Vladimir Putin says that world leaders are trying to reduce the population.
column8: The Spanish subtitles are manipulated and the video is from 2016.

column3: List of UNICEF recommendations against COVID-19 includes drinking hot water.
column8: All the recommendations issued by Unicef are focused on the care of children and families during the pandemic. None of those included in the viral chain belong to or were cited by Unicef.

column3: Kids are not allowed to say goodbye to their parents before being hospitalized for COVID-19.
column8: Kids are allowed to say googbye to their families. If they die, 5 to 10 people are allowed at the funeral.

column3: Guatemala Ombudsman wants citizens to pay their COVID-19 tests.
column8: He said he wants the Governement to allow testing also at private labs -currently only allowed at the National Public Lab- but he says as well that the Governement should provide free test for the citizens.

column3: Doctors and nurses in Italy are dying and are lying dead on the ground due to the Coronavirus outbreak.
column8: The image does not depict dead doctors and nurses in Italy. It is a part of a demonstration by youngsters to spread awareness about coronavirus in Bogota.

column3: In India from 24th March 2020 during lockdown all grocery, milk, chemist, vegetable shops will be open from 9.00 am to 11.30 am in the morning and 4.30 pm to 7.00 pm in the evening. Anybody found moving around after this or opening any kind of outlet will be strictly detained by the police. It also claims that no home deliveries will be available.
column8: Delhi Police has clarified that the viral message on social media is Fake.

column3: You have to take off your clothes and shoes outside and wash them with desinfectants, the virus sticks to the floor for 9 hours and also spreads via the wind.
column8: The claims lack context or are unproven. It is sufficient to wash your clothes normally. There are no studies regarding the lifespan of the virus on the floor.

column3: If you can hold your breath for more than 10 seconds, you are not infected by coronavirus.
column8: By holding your breath for 10 seconds, you cannot confirm whether you are infected with coronavirus or not.

column3: Chancellor Angela Merkel knew of the pandemia since 2013; the virus is from a laboratory.
column8: A risk analysis was published by the German government in 2013 about a fictional coronavirus named „Modi-SARS“. It didn't foretell this pandemic. Scientists say the virus originated in nature.

column3: By clicking on an italian Youtube song you donate money to a hospital in Bergamo
column8: Direct clicks are not giving out money, but the singer of the song on he video said he would donate proceeds.

column3: Five helicopters are spraying desinfectants over German cities.
column8: There are no helicopters spraying desinfectants over Germany and also no plans to do so.

column3: Vitamin C kills viruses.
column8: There is no evidence that vitamin C can kill viruses or helps against COVID-19.

column3: In Hong Kong people destroyed a 5G pole because of coronavirus.
column8: The video is from September 2019, it shows protesters tearing down a smart lamp because they fear surveillance.

column3: The coronavirus is a bioweapon by the USA, says German politician Wolfgang Gedeon in a parliament speech.
column8: International scientists, the WHO and German Robert Koch Institute see strong evidence that the coronavirus is of natural origin and its outbreak related to bats.

column3: Leaving half an onion in your home will ‘catch’ the coronavirus and prevent people from getting it.
column8: Onions are not a way to prevent the coronavirus from entering your home. The claim that onions can help prevent illness has been around since the 1930s.

column3: The army is patrolling all the streets, towns and villages in Ireland.
column8: New and unprecedented measures have been introduced to help curb the spread of the coronavirus, but the post false describes that those rules actually are. Police are patrolling parts of the country, but not all of it, and there are no plans at present for the army to patrol the streets.

column3: People will not be allowed to organise a funeral for any family members who die of COVID-19. Instead, the State will take care of the disposal of the body.
column8: The rules around funerals have changed as gatherings are currently not allowed, but families are still allowed to look after funeral services for their loved ones without the involvement of the State.

column3: The Irish Prime Minister/Taoiseach Leo Varadkar has urged people not to use the Houseparty video messaging app due to security concerns.
column8: Prime Minister Leo Varadkar never said this. The tweet was doctored and is false. He did not say anything publicly about using Houseparty.

column3: Confidential studies from Universities of New York, USA states that some patients infected with COVID-19 were healed with eucalyptus.
column8: There is no studies with scientific support about the cure of COVID-19.

column3: No deaths have been reported in Israel due to COVID-19 because they have found a cure for the disease. A solution of hot water, baking soda and lemon is the cure for COVID-19.
column8: There have been 15 deaths in Israel due to COVID-19 plus the solution of lemon, hot water and bicarbonate is not proven to cure COVID-19.

column3: Video of mass grave claiming to be Italy.
column8: This is from the movie Pandemic.

column3: Post claiming that a national-wide committee to prevent, control, and treat COVID-19 led by Myanmar state counselor was dissolved.
column8: The committee dissolved by the announcement made on 31st March from the president office is the central committee for prevention and treatment of COVID-19 led by a union minister, not the committee led by Myanmar state counselors.

column3: Srilanka’s KDU hospital to be dedicated to treat only VIP COVID19 patients.
column8: Hospital director, Chief Epidemiologist and Defence Secretary all refuted the claim and said the hospital is ready to admit any patient.

column3: Neem leaves can cure COVID-19.
column8: WHO has iterated that while some traditional medicines, western medicines, and home remedies may provide comfort and alleviate symptoms of COVID-19, there is no evidence of a single medicine that treats COVID-19 currently.

column3: Post claiming that Myanmar found COVID-19 treatment medicine called “chlorofos”, a medicine to treat malaria. The post also claims “chlorofos” is one of the selected medicine to treat COVID-19 by WHO
column8: There is no evidence or recommendation from WHO for possible COVID-19 treatment using “chlorofos” but we found that “chloroquine” is used as a potential medicine in some countries. WHO has reiterated that there is no single medicine effective for curing COVID-19 as yet.

column3: People in Italy have thrown all of their money on the roads outside saying that this money is useless to save them from death.
column8: The images doing rounds on social media are not from Italy but from Venezuela when the country was facing economic collapse in 2018.

column3: A video is going viral on WhatsApp and Sharechat claiming that the man and woman in the video are doctors who treated 75 coronavirus patients and now they both are infected by it.
column8: The claim associated with the video is false and misleading. They are not Italian doctors who treated 75 coronavirus patients and got infected but are actors from a Mexican television series called ‘Triunfo del Amor’.

column3: Turkey helped Italy with 200.000 masks and other equipment but nobody took notice.
column8: Important context is missing. It was not a humanitarian aid delivery. Italy bought 200.000 masks from a company in Turkey and they were blocked at the customs for more than two weeks before Turkey decided to let them be exported.

column3: While everybody is busy with coronavirus, authorities in Görlitz, in Germany, secretly brought asymlum seekers in to the city.
column8: It was not a secret mission but the normal transfer of 23 asylum seekers from an initial reception site. This happens regularly.

column3: Supermarkets in Germany will only open on two days a week. A screenshot shows a report about this from the media outlet Focus.
column8: Supermarkets are open like usual. The screenshot is doctored; Focus did not report this.

column3: In China there is now also an outbreak of the hantavirus, with a first recorded death.
column8: There is no "outbreak“, the hantavirus is an endemic disease in China with about 100 deaths every year. It is usually not transmitted from human to human.

column3: Russian government has unleashed lions on the streets to inpose public curfew.
column8: The viral bulletin is digitally edited and the lion in the image was a part of a movie shoot from South Africa.

column3: You should take high doses of vitamin D against COVID-19; children don’t get sick because they lack the receptors for the virus to bond; the coronavirus is an unnatural mutation; it is not susceptible to temperatures, which is why infections will not sink in summer; the oldest patients will not be treated and left to die; 5G harms the immune system.
column8: There is no evidence that vitamin D can cure or prevent COVID-19; children can get sick but it is unknown why they usually suffer less than adults; experts are convinced the virus originated in nature; the warmer weather will probably make the infection rate sink but not stop the virus; no patients are sorted out only because of their age and electromagnetic fields like 5G can't harm the human body.

column3: American scientists have developed a cure for Coronavirus.
column8: The viral image on social media is not a vaccine for coronavirus but it is a COVID-19 test kit recently developed by South Korea.

column3: Multiple news reports circulating in Nigeria claim that Buckingham Palace has announced Britain’s Queen Elizabeth tested positive for COVID-19.
column8: Although the Queen’s eldest son was diagnosed with the disease, the Palace said the monarch herself is “in good health”.

column3: After 23:30, the city will be disinfected by a helicopter and the doors and windows should be closed.
column8: This has not been announced by authorities. This hoax has spread in many other countries.

column3: If people get infected with CoVid-19, they may not be able to fully recover.
column8: It is quite understandable that people with chronic illnesses and the elderly are at greater risk of this virus and this is repeatedly stated by the relevant institutions so that they can be more careful. But whether they will have, if they heal, lasting consequences, have not been confirmed, at least not by a single relevant global health institution.

column3: During the pandemic, Macedonian citizens will have no bread.
column8: The information was sharply denied by the Minister of Economy Kreshnik Bekteshi, who assured there is enough flour and wheat and imports from Serbia, Bulgaria and Hungary are also allowed.

column3: A video has been viewed tens of thousands of times in multiple Facebook posts which claim it shows a man wiping his sweat on the buttons of a lift in a residential block in Hong Kong.
column8: The claim is false; the footage has circulated in media reports about an incident in Thailand.

column3: A photo has been shared hundreds of times in multiple posts on Facebook and Twitter alongside a claim it shows the bodies of people who died in Italy after they became infected with the novel coronavirus, COVID-19.
column8: The claim is false; the photo actually shows people participating in a 2014 art project in the German city of Frankfurt.

column3: Italians bidding goodbye to the world because of coronavirus.
column8: The video dates back to November 2019 and has nothing to do with the coronavirus pandemic. It is actually from an anti-fascist protest held in Italy.

column3: A group of Muslim boys licking utensils to spread coronavirus.
column8: The people seen in the video are Dawoodi Bohras, who are licking the utensils in an attempt to follow their belief of zero wastage of food.

column3: A set of claims passed as instructions to be followed during the COVID-19 Pandemic period.
column8: Some of the claims about COVID-19 are true. However, it contains factually incorrect claims such as drinking hot beverages can kill the novel coronavirus and coronavirus remains in throat and can be digested by the stomach if we intake enough fluids.

column3: Muslims Intentionally Licking The Cutlery And Plates to spread COVID-19.
column8: People shown in the video are of Dawoodi Bohra religion and people of these community do not waste food. That is why after eating, he lick all the utensils such as plate, spoon and bowl to ensure no food wastage and then wash the vessels.

column3: Doctored image of Donald Trump shared claiming he asked people to chant Hare Krishna Hare Rama.
column8: The claim is fake and the image is doctored.

column3: Indian Actor Kamal Hassan put under quarantine.
column8: Kamal Hassan and his party has issued an official statement saying there was a misunderstanding between officials as his daughter has self-isolated herself. It was presumed that Hassan had met his daughter in Mumbai. However, he did not meet his daughter and later the officials were also convinced about it and they removed quarantine poster from his wall.

column3: Restrictions to transit by your ID-number due to coronavirus.
column8: Even there are some restrictions and schedules to transit and buy, there are not by ID-numbers in Venezuela. Text in Whatsapp mixes measures from Colombia, Bolivia and Ecuador.

column3: Indian Police personel beaten by a person while enforcing lockdown. Claim made through an image.
column8: The image is old and shared out of context to make a false claim.

column3: Hindu God Ganesha’s idol placed and worshiped inside an Italian Church.
column8: It is an old video of celebration of a Hindu Festival called Ganeshotsav in a Spanish church which is shared with misleading context.

column3: The ex-Health Minister Nikola Todorov, otherwise a lawyer by profession, is a consultant of the current Minister of Health for expert advice and expertise in the field of epidemiology.
column8: Denial about this information came from the Minister of Health himself, who explained that the expert epidemiologist and former VMRO-DPMNE minister is actually a doctor, Dragan Danilovski.

column3: France needs tests for its population however Paris sent tests to Algeria.
column8: A thousand tests have been sent to Algeria to slow the spread of the coronavirus epidemic. But it was the Institut Pasteur which sent them to the other establishments in its international network, and not the French state.

column3: Video shows Muslim prayers in the White House, in Washington DC, due to the outbreak.
column8: The video goes back to 2017, inaguaration ceremony of Mr. Trump.

column3: The text claims that mass media owners, called “Satanists” in the text, are forcing the public to voluntarily look for a coronavirus vaccine. It also describes the vaccine (which still does not exist) as: “A vaccine in which the beast’s mark is present in liquid form with nano-technology, and he will completely control the world and all people”.
column8: Regardless of their religious feelings, believers, and everyone else, should remain rational, sober, and informed for their own good only from relevant sources. Postings on social networks, if not from officials, no matter where they come from, should be taken with great care and checked before they can be trusted.

column3: A Chinese study is the definitive proof that Chloroquine works.
column8: A widely shared video on social media claims that Chinese studies prove that chloroquine cures almost all of COVID-19 patients. Even though there have been some encouraging initial results, the researchers are in fact very cautious.

column3: Video shows Muslim prayers at a chuch in Switzerland due to the outbreak.
column8: The video goes back to 2017, an interfaith peace event in Switzerland, Olten.

column3: A document that talks about the benefits of wine to prevent coronavirus.
column8: The Spanish Federation of Oenology published on March 23 a statement about the coronavirus that helps better oral hygiene and that the virus does not survive in wine. No substance prevents the coronavirus.

column3: Does stage 4 of the epidemic mean “quarantine for all cities in France”?
column8: Stage 4 of an epidemic in France doesn't imply general quarantine, on the contrary. The fourth and last stage of an epidemic means a gradual return to normal situation. France is still in stage 3, according to the authorities and to medical experts.

column3: Usefulness of homemade chlorine wipes
column8: Chlorine or bleach is a disinfecting substance that can be used on surfaces but can damage the skin.

column3: Sanitary proteccion supplies being retained by La Paz Hospital in Madrid
column8: The hospital denies that they are retaining sanitary supplies, but they have donanted material that they can't use until it's checked.

column3: The following statement: “There are prisoners infected with the coronavirus, the state is hiding this fact.”
column8: This false information was denied by the Directorate for Execution of Sanctions and Minister of Health Venko Filipce, one day later.

column3: Army trucks are deployed in Paris and in other big French cities because of the coronavirus epidemic
column8: Photos shared thousands of times on social media show military vehicles transported by truck on the highway near Paris. But the French Ministry of Armed Forces denies any link with the coronavirus epidemic and explains that it is a routine logistical operation.

column3: Boil weed and ginger for COVID-19 victims, the virus will vanish.
column8: There is no evidence supporting the claim that marijuana and ginger can cure COVID-19. To date, there is no specific treatment available for COVID-19, although clinical trials evaluating certain existing drugs are underway.

column3: A sensationalist headline: “LATEST NEWS / SOMETHING BIG IS HAPENING IN EUROPE”
column8: This is blank text, no information, no facts, no source of information and nothing that can serve the reader. The purpose of this article is only to cause panic and to collect as many clicks as possible. The text is no longer available.

column3: COVID-19 was invented and patented years ago by the Institut Pasteur, a French medical research center
column8: The patent, filed in 2004, relates to vaccinal research on SARS-CoV-1, responsible for the SARS epidemic in 2002 and 2003, and not the SARS-CoV-2, that causes the current COVID-19 epidemic.

column3: A sensationalist headline claiming that there is a new virus in China – the Hantavirus.
column8: Passengers have been isolated and tested because of the suspicion that the coronavirus may be the cause of the deteriorating health of the passenger, not because of the danger of transmitting the hantavirus. The hantavirus first appeared in 1950, not nowadays.

column3: Because of the COVID-19 epidemic, an ice rink is turned to a morgue in Mulhouse (France)
column8: The rumor which spread on social networks was denied by the city, the president of the hockey team and by a witness with photos. Besides, an ice rink wouldn't be an efficient morgue.

column3: “Italians remove EU flag and put the flag of the PR of China,” the headline says, suggesting that such a phenomenon is happening in Italy – people are removing the flag of the European Union and are replacing it with the Chinese flag.
column8: Those were individual cases in which citizens or companies, in a revolt from the EU's attitude towards their country in the most difficult moments of the epidemiological crisis, have taken the EU flag off. But this is not a general trend.

column3: There is a connection between COVID-19 outbreak and 5G technology.
column8: There is no proven connection between the viral infections and radio waves.

column3: Iceland is testing its entire population.
column8: In Iceland, 3,5% of the population has been tested so far, according to the government. Iceland is doing a massive testing, with an average of 582 tests every day since mid-March. But even at this rate, it would take more than a year and a half to test all of the residents.

column3: The maps shows the cases by provinces in Turkey.
column8: The data does not show the local cases but calculated on proportionality to population in every provinces. Turkish authorities do not announce the local figures yet.

column3: The roll-out of 5G is causing coronavirus or coronavirus-like symptoms.
column8: The effect of 5G on the public's health is a long-standing cause of concern, also in the Dutch language area on local facebook groups such as 5G-plein. At the end of January coronavirus has started to be mentioned in these groups as a by-product of the roll-out of 5G (cf. Thomas Cowan's youtube video). There is no proof for this.

column3: In the Philippines, Senator Manny Pacquiao was the only senator who responded to the coronavirus crisis.
column8: Other senators, and not just Pacquiao, also responded to the outbreak by providing aid to frontliners and those affected by the enhanced community quarantine, among others.
column9: facebook user michael john gocela sabio

column3: A claim on Facebook that began to circulate around Wednesday, March 25, says that putting a peeled onion in any room can remove “all viruses and bacteria including coronavirus.”
column8: Putting peeled onions in a room will not prevent COVID-19 or a coronavirus infection, according to the National Onion Association (NOA) in the US. There are no official cures or vaccines for COVID-19, according to the World Health Organization (WHO) as of Tuesday, March 31, though there are cures and vaccines in testing.

column3: People in Italy are threw away their money after they lost their family members to coronavirus.
column8: The claim along with the images is false. The images are old and are not related to the ongoing coronavirus pandemic in any way.

column3: A satellite map by the Royal Dutch Meteorology Institute (KNMI) showed lowered nitrogen levels since the coronavirus crisis, which would supposedly indicate nitrogen levels in the Netherlands are unrelated to the Dutch agricultural sector.
column8: The satellite images only show nitrogenoxide levels (NOₓ) and leave out ammonia levels (NH₃), the compound which is responsible for the lion's share of nitrogen emission and is emitted predominantly by the agricultural sector.

column3: 1 out of 3 deaths from coronavirus in Spain lived in a nursing home.
column8: The media outlet added data on deaths in nursing homes by autonomous communities in recent weeks, but mixes deaths with coronavirus with other deceased elderly people, it is unknown if they had the virus.

column3: Video shows re-opened wet market in China .
column8: The video dates back to 2017 and recorded in Indonesia. Wet markets are currently closed down in Hubei.

column3: A message that claimed that an electric company in Spain was offering 25% discount to its customers for the coronavirus.
column8: Iberdrola, an electrical company in Spain, carried out a 25% discount campaign to a sector of its customers. The campaign existed but not for all its clients.

column3: Prof. Shenme Minzi from Zanjan University told that lemon cure is helpful for COVID-19.
column8: There is no Zanjan University in China (it's in Iran), and no researcher named Shenme Minzi at all. Lemon contains vitamin C which is helpful to enpower the immune system but does not cure the disease.

column3: Muslim azan was recited in Granada, Spain, for the first time after 500 years due to the outbreak.
column8: The video is from Azerbaijan and the voice belongs to Persian artist Mehdi Yarrahi. The video is manipulated.

column3: Video of a carrier who is allegedly moving medical supplies from Spain to France.
column8: In a video, a trucker shows a warehouse with boxes and ensures that they have medical supplies, such as gloves, masks, and that they will be transported to France. The boxes that the transporter shows inside a truck show brand of paper sheets, Fabriano. Not sanitary material.

column3: A headline that alleges that the first pregnant woman with coronavirus gave birth in Macedonia.
column8: The event did not happen in Macedonia, but in Serbia.

column3: An email from Caixabank that ask people to change data related to their account.
column8: An email allegedly sent by CaixaBank requesting account verification through a link in less than 24 hours to prevent unauthorized access. It is a case of phishing.

column3: A image of a 24-year-old doctor that coronavirus killed.
column8: An image that says that doctor Francisco 'Paco' Pérez of the Hospital de La Paz in Madrid died at the age of 24 from the coronavirus accompanied by a photo of the porn actor Jordi 'el niño polla'.

column3: A photo of the vicepresident of Spain in the hospital allegadly visiting his father sick of coronavirus.
column8: The vice president of Spain, Pablo Iglesias, did not visit his father at the Hospital Clinico Universitario de Salamanca, who is neither ill nor admitted. The photo is not current.

column3: Voice message of a so called ombudsman that says that internet may collapse in Argentina.
column8: The official ombudsman denied that the message came from his office and the national institute of communication advised for a rational use of internet but did not recommend to stop sending videos via Whatsapp.

column3: The Indian Army has been called to control seven areas in Mumbai that are nor following the 21 day lockdown and are out of the Mumbai police’s control.
column8: The Mumbai police has not called in the army and the seven areas are duly following the lockdown prescribed by the government.

column3: The Indian Home Ministry considers posting anything about Coronavirus as a punishable offence.
column8: The message was attributed to a non existent Home Ministry official and the ministry has not passed any circular stating that any message about coronavirus should not be shared.

column3: Marathi newspaper reports conspiracy theory of Coronavirus being a bioweapon.
column8: The conspiracy theory is actually picked up from a Reddit thread which hosts contests for fictional stories that are inspired from real events.

column3: An image of a baby born with deformities claims that the baby was suffering from Coronavirus.
column8: This image is of a still born baby suffering from anencephaly wherein the baby is born without parts of the brain/skull.

column3: Two audio clips stating that the Mumbai police commissioner is going to enforce strict actions during the 21 day lockdown in India and that there will be a spike in cases after March 27, 2020.
column8: Mumbai Police officials denied that this audio was of the city police commissioner. The voices in both the videos were different.

column3: WhatsApp group admins were detained for sharing coronavirus messages in Dadar, Mumbai.
column8: Mumbai Police spokesperson rubbished the claim that Mumbai police's cyber cell was registering cases against 52 WhatsApp group admins and called it fake.

column3: The lockdown due to Coronavirus has led to the reemergence of a large flock of birds at the riverfront in Ahmedabad.
column8: These birds are a regular site at the riverfront in Ahmedabad and the video has been shared with a false narrative.

column3: India has decided to extend its financial year to July 1 due to the current COVID-19 outbreak.
column8: The Income Tax department tweeted that the financial year has not been extended and that this gazette was for the collection of stamp duty on security market instruments through stock exchanges and clearing corporations.

column3: Says the Coronavirus Aid, Relief, and Economic Security Act gives members of Congress a pay increase.
column8: No version of the coronavirus Aid, Relief, and Economic Security Act grant pay raises for members of Congress.

column3: Says certain states are banning the sale of alcohol.
column8: Claims that states are banning alcohol sales appear to have originated on a prank page.

column3: “We inherited a broken test” for COVID-19.
column8: There was no inherited test because a test couldn’t be created until the new virus had emerged.

column3: Says a study projects Wisconsin’s coronavirus cases will peak on April 26, 2020.
column8: The first iteration of a study estimating coronavirus peak dates for each state pegged Wisconsin at May 22, last in the nation by two weeks. But updates to the model used in the study changed the dates for almost all states, affecting Wisconsin the most. The organization now predicts an April 26 peak in Wisconsin.

column3: Health care workers union “suddenly finds stash of 39 million face masks”.
column8: Health care workers’ union launched a nationwide search on March 21 for face masks and other protective gear that have been in short supply since the COVID-19 pandemic swept across the U.S. On March 26, the union announced that it had found a supplier with 39 million masks.

column3: Old “Martinelli” and “Whatsapp Gold” hoaxes surface in Belgium in wake of Corona infodemic.
column8: Messages circulating on Whatsapp of people sharing "insider"-information (self-declared government officials) on the virus percolate quickly. A localized version of the Martinelli & Whatsapp Gold hoaxes surface in Belgium as well, adding further confusion and unrest.

column3: Drug for coronavirus was found.
column8: Article is misleading. Research is still ongoing and it's too early to say that drug for coronavirus was found.

column3: Polish government confiscated coronavirus testing mashine which was originally bought by local hospital in Grodzisk Mazowiecki city.
column8: Article is misleading. Although hospital did indeed collect the money for buying the mashine, it didn't buy it eventually as the mashine was redirected to the city where it was much more needed. Polish government didn't take if forcefully or confiscated it as articles were suggesting.

column3: Police in India lashed sticks at filmmaker Sudhir Mishra for not following the rules of lockdown.
column8: The viral video has been falsified based on the tweet made by Sudhir Mishra himself on the viral clip.

column3: French professor Didier Raoult, director of IHU Marseille, told Africans not to take “Bill Gates’ vaccine” against coronavirus because it is “poisonous”.
column8: The IHU Marseille has denied that its director made such comments, and there is currently no vaccine or approved treatment. If scientific research is underway, no vaccine should be released until at least next year.

column3: Video clip of a massive stadium converted into a graveyard claimed to be scenes from Italy related to ongoing COVID19 outbreak.
column8: Scene from movie “Flu 2013” portrayed as scenes from Italy.

column3: Johns Hopkins University says that the fatality of coronavirus in Colombia is the third lowest in the world.
column8: Neither Johns Hopkins University said that the fatality of COVID-19 in Colombia is the third lowest in the world nor the data that excongressman Alfredo Rangel gave in his tweet is correct.

column3: French professor Didier Raoult, big defensor of chloroquine treatment, insulted ex-European MP Daniel Cohn-Bendit, after Cohn-Bendit criticized his scientific work.
column8: Professor Didier Raoult denied having insulted Cohn-Bendit on his real Twitter account.
column9: twitter parodic account of didier raoult

column3: According to DW, Venezuela is the only country who took in advance measures againtst the outbreak.
column8: DW didn´t publish or broadcast that.

column3: Venezuelan youtuber Ruby Demestoy talked about Event 201, Bill Gates and VIH + Sars conspiracies.
column8: Well-known conspiracies and many other lack of precise scentiftic information.

column3: WHO admitted coronavirus is airbone transmitted cause is on the air for 8 hours.
column8: Using a real CNBC link claimed the opposite of what WHO discovered and found.

column3: The brazilian Health Surveillance Agency approved the chloroquine/hydroxychloroquine as a treatment for COVID-19.
column8: Unlike what publications on social networks suggest, the release of chloroquine for the treatment of COVID-19 did not occur unrestrictedly. Nor did the guarantee come from Anvisa (Brazil's National Health Surveillance Agency). In fact, an information note from the brazilian Ministry of Health published on March 27 authorized the use of the drug and indicated its dosage only for hospitalized patients in serious condition. In other words, the standard of the ministry does not allow the drug to be sold in pharmacies or prescribed by doctors for any treatment against the disease resulting from the new coronavirus.

column3: Two malaria medications work to treat COVID-19.
column8: President Donald Trump announced that the FDA already has a treatment for COVID-19. In his announcement, he mentioned two drugs used to treat malaria as well as an antibiotic.
