However, a comprehensive review of available scientific evidence shows hydroxychloroquine and chloroquine have not yet shown sufficient efficacy for treating respiratory disease caused by the novel coronavirus. These medications are still in early-phase clinical trials for treating the disease.

column3: You shouldn’t open your windows.
column8: A study published in the New England Journal of Medicine warned that the novel coronavirus remains viable for up to: three hours floating in the air, four hours on copper coins, a whole day on cardboard surfaces and as long as two or three days on plastic surfaces or stainless steel faucets. This scientific data went viral on social media as an oversimplified, false message: “The virus no longer spreads simply by being in contact with infected people or in places where the infected have been. The virus is now in the air. We have entered a new phase, ” reads an audio message sent around on Whatsapp. However, research by the United States National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases published in the New England Journal of Medicine mentions no such new phase. To date, the World Health Organization (WHO) reports that the viability of the novel coronavirus in the air does not imply that the contagion is like measles, which can live up to two hours in the air where an infected person has coughed or sneezed.

column3: Venezuela and El Salvador buy Interferon, despite the fact that it has not been proven effective in treating coronavirus.
column8: Before they even registered cases of people infected with COVID-19, the Venezuelan and Salvadoran governments went ahead and bought the antiviral called Interferon to "cure" possible future patients. But there is still little scientific evidence in regards to the efficacy of this medicine, and it cannot be used for all infected patients.

column3: A chart comparing those infected and killed by the coronavirus in Argentina and Spain.
column8: The data on the chart was incorrect and it is not advised to compare and make projections with information from different countries, that are experiencing the pandemic in different stages.

column3: The virus can be overcome by drinking hot water every 15 minutes, avoiding cold drinks and ice cream, going out in the sun to kill the virus, as well as the “self-diagnostic guideline”, i.e. if you hold your breath for 10 seconds and then you do not cough, you do not choke,you do not feel any tension in the lungs than you have no cystic fibrosis in the lungs and the situation is not irreversible.
column7: North Macedonia, Croatia, Bosnia and Herzegovina, Greece
column8: All of this misinformation has nothing to do with the truth, because the virus not only enters the oral cavity but also the nose, so drinking hot water will not carry the virus to the stomach. Viruses are destroyed at higher temperatures than those normally tolerated by humans, and even sun exposure and body heat have no effect.

column3: About a thousand people wait to enter the Military Medical Academy (VMA) in Belgrade for examinations.
column8: People came for routine check-ups and only their temperature was measured. Many people were only accompanying those who went for a check-up and were not allowed to enter thus causing queues outside.
column9: serbian news portal "vecernje novosti" and twitter

column3: A statement saying: “‘Serbs have’ lion’s genes’ that protect them from coronavirus, unlike Italians who have ‘weaker genes'” by pulmonologist Branimir Nestorovic.
column7: North Macedonia, Serbia, Bosnia and Herzegovina
column8: Nestorovic claims that he did not say such a thing, nor did he think Serbs had superior genes, but only different ones, and that such a "statement" was filled by the tabloid.

column3: Gargling with “Betadine” to kill germs or reduce their numbers in the throat before they go down to the lungs, and a statement by Eleni Jamarely, professor of Infectious Diseases, claiming that that HIV is transmitted more easily from the new coronavirus through the spoon at communion.
column8: This is incorrect because, according to the CDC, HIV infection in such a case is possible only if a person has an open wound in the mouth. Also, gargling with Betadine is dangerous because it is not said which "Betadine" product you should gargle. There is a special "Betadine" mouthwash product, whose efficiency on the novel coronavirus has not been proven yet and which can cause allergies to some people. Any other type of Betadine product can have counter-effects.
column9: professor of infectious diseases, eleni jamarelu and greek news portal

column3: Video of police roughing up civilians claimed to be Police in Spain enforcing a lockdown.
column8: The video is originally from Baku, Azerbaijan from a protest in October 2019.

column3: The vaccine against the new coronavirus was created before the disease appeared ; three persons who recently arrived from China in Sarajevo Canton are under medical supervision and have brought the COVID-19 in Sarajevo.
column7: North Macedonia, Croatia, Bosnia and Herzegovina
column8: The British National Health System and the World Health Organization report that there is currently no vaccine for COVID-19 and the vaccine is currently being developed. Also, at the time of the disputed news release about the three patients in Sarajevo infected with COVID-19, there was no confirmation of a coronavirus positive finding in the three patients, and for several days thereafter results were found to be negative.

column3: “A few hours ago, China officially announced the success of the CUBAN serum that Dr. Hala, CUBA’s Minister of Health, presented to the Chinese Ministry of Health to treat the Corona virus , which turned out to be 100% effective in more than 7 cases that have been cured”
column8: China has not announced anything of the sort.

column3: Audio from the Secretary of Risk Management for Cali on the exponential growth of coronavirus.
column8: The voice is not from politician Rodrigo Zamorano but from the doctor César Augusto Arias, interviewed on a radio program.

column3: Chain message warns against accepting immunisation from coronavirus; says they are rather implanting COVID-19 through the said vaccine.
column8: The whole plot screams foul play! First, no news platform has published anything close, besides this, WHO has said there’s no vaccine yet for the virus. Also, a reverse image search proved that the claim-author manipulated one of the many images shared by health workers to encourage people to stay home during this trying time.

column3: A Facebook publication ensures that “there is a new generation of genetic vaccines ready to be inoculated in the world population.”
column8: Genetic vaccines are being tested and the specific effects on DNA are unknown. There is a North American company that is testing these vaccines for coronavirus, but it is not known if, specifically, for COVID-19.

column3: Announcement on social media according to which markets in North Macedonia (Ramstore Capitol, Ramstore Center, Tinex Dramski, Tinex Prvomajska) had workers infected with coronavirus. Citizens are also urged to avoid these markets.
column8: This is fake news that was soon denied by companies whose stores were on the list - Tinex and Ramstore.

column3: As per Home Ministry of India, sharing information related to the coronavirus is now a punishable offense.
column8: We found that there is no official named Ravi Nayak in MHA, India as claimed in the viral message. Also, there was no official notice on the website on MHA. It is evident from our fact check that the message viral on social media claiming to be from the Home Ministry of India is false.

column3: To defeat the coronavirus, China had built a thousand bed hospital in 10 days, while India has prepared a modern hospital of 6370 beds overnight, at a very low cost.
column8: A close study on the viral claim revealed that a 6370-bed hospital has not been constructed overnight in the country. Isolation wards have been made in some bogies of the country's first medical train Jeevan Rekha which was run in the year 1991.

column3: COVID-19 is a secret American weapon aimed for depopulation purposes.
column8: Article is based on debunked conspiracy theories.

column3: Italian priest died, refusing to use respirator as he sacrificed it to a younger person.
column8: He didn't sacrifice the respirator. He didn't use it due to medical preconditions.

column3: A video of police arresting a man has been viewed thousands of times on Facebook and Twitter alongside a claim it shows police in Italy detaining a man who flouted a national lockdown during the novel coronavirus pandemic.
column8: The claim is false; the footage in fact shows police arresting a knife-wielding man in the Brazilian city of Sao Paulo.

column3: A claim has been shared thousands of times in multiple posts on Facebook and Twitter that an emergency decree issued in Thailand due to the novel coronavirus pandemic included a strict curfew.
column8: The claim is false; the emergency decree declared on March 25, 2020 by Thailand’s prime minister did not include a curfew.

column3: If you are infected with the new coronavirus, for high fever you should not take ibuprofen (Brufen) or paracetamol ; Adults should drink a strong black coffee every few hours.
column7: North Macedonia, Greece, Serbia, Bosnia and Herzegovina
column8: There are no clinical trials or practice data that would suggest that brufen should not be taken with COVID-19 infection. The Specialist pneumophysiologist and family medicine doctor, Dobrinka Granzov - Kozlina. debunked the fake news about drinking coffee against coronavirus.

column3: Lemon and bicarbonate can cure coronavirus.
column8: Doctors and experts suggest that there is no medical evidence to corroborate the claim.

column3: Actor Vijay’s father criticized government for enforcing curfew to abate COVID-19.
column8: The newscard shared to make the claim is fake. The news channel has not published any such news.

column3: Hydroxychloroquine (HCQ) can prevent COVID-19.
column8: The USFDA has however approved the drug for treatment of COVID-19 as this anti-malarial drug might ease some symptoms. However, it is not proven to build resistance and prevent COVID-19 and its use without Doctor's prescription is not recommended.

column3: pH level of coronavirus varies from 5.5 to 8.5 and to beat the virus we should consume more alkaline food.
column8: Speaking to The Quint, Dr Shaheed Jameel, a leading virologist said that viruses do not have pH values.

column3: Harvard scientists explain: Here’s how you can cure the coronavirus yourself before the vaccine comes out and a WhatsApp message stating: “The Ministry of Health has approved an immediate 350 euro reward for those staying home.” The first child that lost its life because of coronavirus.
column8: The "information" contained in the WhatsApp message was denied by the Minister of Health and Social Affairs. The link didn't bring to an existing page. The British media article was about an infected child, not a child who lost his life. There is no exact data so far, but according to WHO, children are less at risk of coronary heart disease when they catch the novel coronavirus.

column3: Tamil Nadu Govt ordered to re-open TASMAC bars.
column8: A fake screenshot has been used to make the claim.

column3: Italian President breaks down and surrenders in front of COVID-19 epidemic.
column8: An old image of Brasilian President Jair Mesaias Bolsonaro has been used to make the false claim.

column3: A post with photos claiming that COVID-19 infected patients in Italy are left in the street.
column8: The photos were from a hospital in Croatia after the earthquake struck the capital of Zagreb on March 22.

column3: The new coronavirus COVID-19 is a US biological weapon against China and Italy ; Milorad Dodik, the Serb member of the BiH presidency, is infected with COVID-19.
column7: North Macedonia, Croatia, Bosnia and Herzegovina
column8: Considering the impact of novel coronavirus on the US people, such a claim doesn't make any sense. It's also completely unfounded. Radovan Kovačević debunked the false news about Milorad Dodik being infected with COVID-19.

column3: There is now a COVID19 cure from USA.
column8: It was a test kit from South Korea, that was shared as an American-made vaccine for COVID19.

column3: Myanmar’s former military junta donated Ks 1000 Lakhs to COVID-19 fund.
column8: The list of donors in The Mirror daily circulated on March 26 shows no name of former military junta or current army chief or former president.

column3: Viral video shows a man having great difficulty breathing. Even the medical team keeps a safe distance from this man. These videos are shared as patient suffering from COVID-19.
column8: Upon investigation, we found out that all three clips are from Indian State of Gujrat. The man seen in the clips is mentally unstable. Health Authorities from the state confirmed that the man does not have coronavirus infection.

column3: Hospital La Paz in Madrid, Spain is requesting blankets for patients admitted to the hospital.
column8: The authorities of the La Paz Hospital in Madrid, Spain deny having requested donations of blankets and bedspreads for patients admitted to their hospital.

column3: Lies spread by Serbian authorities about COVID-19. For example:  the virus does not affect pregnant women, children and young people, that no newborn is infected with the corona virus and that the virus does not last long on objects, the number of respiratory machines that Serbia posesses etc.
column8: There have been cases of infected and pregnant and newborns as well as people of different ages, their claim is untrue. When it comes to persistence of the virus on different surfaces, according to the latest research from the US National Institutes of Health, it has a stable presence in aerosols for a duration of three hours, on copper up to four hours, can remain on cardboard for 24 hours and two to three days of plastic and inox.

column3: Garlic can protect you from the virus and the most vulnerable group with the new coronavirus are people with blood type A.
column7: North Macedonia, Bosnia and Herzegovina, Croatia
column8: Garlic can really help boost immunity, but it can neither protect nor cure because although it has antibacterial properties, the World Health Organization (WHO) has not confirmed that it can cure the new virus and also statistics show that 38 percent of those infected in the city of Wuhan in China had blood type A, but also that as much as 31 percent of the city's population is with that blood type.

column3: In a seemingly careless message being sent as an e-mail, recipients in Greek are warned that if a company (shop) has to shut down because of the new coronavirus or staff illness or other reason, the sender must notify the sender of that message about the termination of the employment of an employee.
column8: This message contains an "attachment" that carries a high risk of being a malicious software, such as a virus, a Trojan, or other form of malware. The e-mail address is @gmail.com. No legitimate public institution (even a private company) will write to you from a gmail address or any other free service.

column3: A Russian drug called Arbidol, cures coronavirus ; a recipe for a mainly fruit-based drink that has been claimed to help prevent new coronavirus infections.
column7: North Macedonia, Serbia, Bosnia and Herzegovina
column8: The claim for medical advice has been invented, the analysis says, and the WHO is definitely not putting the drink on its list of recommendations.Although there have been some clinical trials showing that Arbidol has anti-influenza and some other viral infections, both the WHO and the US Food and Drug Administration have not put it on their lists of drugs to treat viral illnesses.

column3: A drug called Favipiravir is a cure for coronavirus, and an advice for people not to go inside their homes with the shoes because they can bring the infection home.
column7: North Macedonia, Croatia, Bosnia and Herzegovina
column8: Favipiravir may help treat those who have mild symptoms of COVID-19 but not those who are more severely ill. The director of the Spanish Center for Emergency Coordination Fernando Simon said on 16 March that there was no need to leave shoes out of the home. The same opinion holds the head of the Italian Institute of Health, Silvio Brusafero, and Fabrizio Preljasko, a virologist at the University of Milan.

column3: Several home-made cures for coronavirus, ; garlic / vodka / vitamin C treats corona virus ; children do not transmit the coronavirus and “Serbs have lion genes”.
column8: There is no evidence as of now that ibuprofen (also commercially named Brufen or Advil) worsens symptoms, there is also no proof that vitamin C, vodka and garlic treat coronavirus. Epidemiologist Predrag Con states that children can spread the virus.

column3: A web publication shared hundreds of times on Facebook, Twitter and WhatsApp in Nigeria claims the government will pay each citizen 8,500 naira ($23.60) monthly to encourage Nigerians to stay at home in a bid to slow down the spread of the novel coronavirus.
column8: The claim is false; officials have dismissed the claim, and the author of the viral publication admitted it was incorrect.

column3: Multiple posts on social media claim that schools in South Africa will reopen months from now in September, as a result of the increase in COVID-19 cases.
column8: The claims are false; the Department of Basic Education has not made any such announcement and refuted the claims.

column3: A post has been shared tens of thousands of times on Facebook and Twitter with a claim it is an official advisory issued by Singapore’s Ministry of Health about the first symptoms of the novel coronavirus, COVID-19.
column8: The claim is false; a spokesperson for the Singaporean health body told AFP it had not issued the purported advisory.

column3: A post shared repeatedly on WhatsApp and Facebook claims a Chinese doctor has discovered that drinking tea is effective in curing and relieving symptoms of the novel coronavirus, COVID-19.
column8: The claim is false; health experts say there is insufficient scientific evidence to show that drinking tea is effective in preventing or curing COVID-19 infections; as of March 2020, the World Health Organization (WHO) has said there is no cure for COVID-19.

column3: If you can hold your breath for 10 seconds without coughing or chest pain, you are good, you don’t have COVID-19, and If your nose is clogged or runny, it’s just a cold.
column8: Dr Robert Legar Atmar told CNN that these are not accurate because someone with an acute viral infection breathes with difficulty because the airways are irritated, but being able to hold his/her breath for 10 seconds does not mean he/she is not infected with coronavirus. Similarly, the expert rejected other claims on the list, calling them myths.

column3: A video has been have been viewed thousands of times on Facebook alongside a claim it shows how to make a hand sanitiser that is effective in protecting against the novel coronavirus, COVID-19. The video appears to show someone mixing rum, bleach and fabric softener in a bottle before rubbing the solution on their hands.

A screenshot of a World Health Organization (WHO) webpage has been shared in multiple posts on Facebook, Twitter and messaging app Line alongside a claim it shows international health authorities raised Thailand’s pandemic stage to a “level 4” during the novel coronavirus crisis.
Videos of patient gasping for breath shown as patient from India.
column8: The video is not from India but Eucador where the person was suffering from acute respiratory distress syndrome.

column3: An audio file from an alledged state official from Ceará, Brazil, named Ricardo Certi, asking the directors of a local TV station to criticize Bolsonaro and praise Ceará’s government COVID-19 policies.
column8: Ricardo Certi, the man who allegedly recorded the message, does not exist. There's not a single person with this name working for the Ceará state government.

column3: Luciano Hang, Roberto Justus (Brazilian businessmen, pro-vertical isolation tactics) and Eduardo Costa (singer, Bolsonaro supporter) donated 4 million Brazilian reais and 90 respirators to SUS (National Health Care system).
column8: Hang told us he donated 2 respirators to a hospital in his hometown, Brusque. Justus said he donated to "some iniciatives" against COVID-19, but did not disclose the amount. Costa said he's trying to gather some businessmen together to purchase some respirators for Minas Gerais hospitals, but nothing concrete has happened so far (March 30). Thus, none of the statements are correct.

column3: A link offering registration for United States humanitarian aid to other countries for the coronavirus
column8: A web page called borrowed.xyz is faking CNN image with an alleged offer from the United States to give humanitarian aid vouchers to citizens of other countries. It is a case of phising.

column3: Drinking bitter gourd juice cures Coronavirus
column8: There is no proven evidenvce from any research so far which establishes that bitter gourd juice cures coronavirus.

column3: Not a single Muslim died of Coronavirus in China.
column8: There is no such claim made by China so far that not a single Muslim has died of coronavirus. China has not released any list of people who have died in coronavirus.

column3: WHO has said, do not eat Cabbage as it will increase the chance of Coronavirus infection.
column8: WHO has not said anything that shows cabbage has any relation to coronavirus.

column3: A photo making the rounds on social media claims to show people who have died from the coronavirus in Italy.
column8: The coffins in the photo are those of the victims of the Lampedusa maritime tragedy in 2013.

column3: A claim circulating on social media and messaging apps says that keeping your throat moist will wash the coronavirus down to your stomach where the virus will die.
column8: Both the World Health Organization (WHO) and doctor Norberto Francisco, chief of clinical trials and research at the Lung Center of the Philippines, say that drinking water will not prevent a coronavirus infection.

column3: Coronavirus patients in Italy are now on the streets because hospitals are no longer able to accommodate them.
column8: The photos were taken in the aftermath of the 5.4-magnitude earthquake that struck Croatia on March 22.

column3: Inhaling the steam from boiled water with dissolved salt is an effective cure for COVID-19, the disease caused by the novel coronavirus.
column8: As of Tuesday, March 31, there is still no cure approved to treat the novel coronavirus, but there are treatments approved by the US Food and Drug Administration (FDA) that may help ease the symptoms. Inhaling salt water steam is not among them.

column3: The WHO allegedly announced that face masks do not protect and are not effective for walking on the street.
column8: The WHO says that masks should be used rationally and appropriately due to the scarcity of this protection worldwide, not that it does not protect when going on the street.

column3: Santiago Abascal, general secretary of VOX (political party), allegadly didn’t respect the quarantine period after being tested positive for COVID-19
column8: Santiago Abascal, secretary general of the VOX political party, respected the statutory quarantine periods after being positive by COVID-19 and did not skip the quarantine to go to the Congress of Deputies.

column3: Supposedly according to the new decree issued by the Spanish government to regulate non-essential activities during confinement, customs officers must not work and therefore goods would not enter Spain.
column8: The decree published by the Spanish government to regulate the performance of non-essential activities during confinement authorizes the work of customs agents, as an essential activity.

column3: A photo where Pablo Iglesias, vice president of the Spanish government, is praying in a Catholic church before beginning his COVID-19 quarantine.
column8: the image where Pablo Iglesias, vicepresident of Spain, appears praying in a catholic church is a montage putting his face on the body of another person. The original photograph was published years earlier on the internet.

column3: Coronavirus infections are linked to a lack of vitamin D.
column8: There is no evidence that vitamin D reduces the risk of coronavirus infection. Some preliminary studies suggest that it could prevent it, but drawing premature conclusions about studies or publications can be a risk for the general population.

column3: Bombay High Court is extending Maharashtra’s lockdown to April 31.
column8: The High Court had only extended its interim orders and not the lockdown.

column3: Tips from Professor Wong Kin-Chung to delay the progress of COVID-19 condition: rinsing mouth with cold salty water; drinking water and red wine; taking vitamin C; having chicken soup, shiitake mushroom, astragalus, codonopsis, and ginseng.
column8: There is no evidence that those mentioned in the claim can prevent COVID-19. Plus, we are not able to identify Professor Wong Kin-Chung, a medical professor, doctor as well as a nutritionist in the USA, who allegely made that claim.

column3: Increase in cases of pneumonia in Mexico.
column8: In Mexico, what has been verified is that it is false that the cases of pneumonia and bronchopneumonia have registered an increase so far in 2020, according to the last report from the authority in mid-March. Although the rumor of the data of some supposed 70 deaths linked to the new coronavirus has spread in networks, data that some businessmen from funeral homes in the Toluca Valley, State of Mexico, reportedly provided; This has been ruled out by some authorities and even by the same source to which the report was attributed.

column3: Speaking of his restriction on travel from China, Donald Trump claims: “I had (Joe) Biden calling me xenophobic. … He called me a racist, because of the fact that he felt it was a racist thing to stop people from China coming in.”
column8: Biden has not directly said that the restrictions were xenophobic. Around the time the Trump administration announced the travel restriction, Biden said that Trump had a “record of hysteria, xenophobia, and fear-mongering.”

column3: Says Nevada Governor Steve Sisolak “has banned the use of an anti-malaria drug that might help cure coronavirus.”
column8: A Nevada emergency regulation restricts the prescription of chloroquine for COVID-19 patients in outpatient settings, but not in hospitals and emergency rooms. Gov. Steve Sisolak signed the order on the recommendation of state health officials, who said there is the potential for stockpiling the drug.

column3: Says imposters in hazmat suits are going door to door in Stockton, California, saying they are checking residents for fever or COVID-19, but they “will enter your home and physically attempt robbery.”
column8: Posts around the nation warn people not to open their doors to imposters who say they are doing coronavirus testing but actually want to rob the residents. Like other such claims, this one about an alleged scam in Stockton, Calif., is false, according to police.

column3: “COVID literally stands for Chinese Originated Viral Infectious Disease.”
column8: COVID-19 is an abbreviation of “coronavirus disease 2019.” “CO” stands for “corona,” “VI” stands for “virus” and “D” stands for “disease.” The number 19 reflects the year the disease was identified — 2019.

column3: Trump claims he “didn’t say that” some of the medical equipment that governors are requesting, they don’t actually need.
column8: During the interview with Hannity, Trump said, “I have a feeling that a lot of the numbers (for ventilators) that are being said in some areas are just bigger than they're going to be. I don't believe you need 40,000 or 30,000 ventilators.”

column3: Pangolin proven to be ‘responsible’ for coronavirus.
column8: No investigation to date has concluded or established with absolute certainty that the pangolin, a mammal under protection regime and that inhabits Asia and Africa, is part of the chain of species through which the sars-cov2 virus mutated and it happened to humans. The publications (1) in which the “responsibility” of this species is reiterated are the result of the erroneous interpretation of investigations in which, through genetic analysis studies of pangolin-associated coronaviruses, some relationships between these infectious agents and sars-cov2, which causes COVID-19.

column3: In the United States, can WIC receivers still only get one type of food during a pandemic?
column8: While this post is true in that individuals qualifying for WIC cannot swap out food items, the specific rules differ state by state, especially during a crisis like COVID-19.

column3: Nancy Pelosi tried to secure taxpayer funds for abortion through a coronavirus bill.
column8: Pelosi never inserted abortion funding in a coronavirus bill. However, some conservatives said by failing to specifically say money couldn’t be used for abortions, that would leave open the possibility that federal money could be used for abortions.

column3: Ibuprofen ramps up coronavirus 10 times.
column8: There is no evidence that ibuprofen or other similar drugs exacerbate the disease. Instead, the notion is simply a hypothesis that has not been tested.

column3: Governor of Maranhão, Brazil, Flávio Dino, giving food baskets to a crowd of poor people, in spite of reccomendations against crowds during the COVID-19 crisis.
column8: The picture is from 2019. The man in the picture is not Flávio Dino, but Roberto do Posto, mayor of a small town in Maranhão.

column3: The Brazilian Government is handling a 600 brazilian reais monthly COVID-19 emergency allowance to poor citizens. To access it, you need to fill out an oficial form (link to the form).
column8: Although the COVID-19 emergency allowance itself is a real thing, it has not been formaly approved by the Senate yet (March 30, morning). The Brazilian government has not announced how it will be payed. The given URL directs to a non-governmental internet address, registered abroad, quite possibly a phishing scam.

column3: A message from Brazilian Workers’ Party (PT), Gleisi Hoffmann, asking party affiliates to boycott the 600 reais monthly COVID-19 emergency allowance. Eligible PT voters should reject it and denounce it, since it is being paid by a “fascist government”.
column8: PT, as all Brazilian parties with seating representatives, voted for the COVID-19 emergency allowance, not against it. Gleisi Hoffmann published a text on her Facebook account denying this request.

column3: Coronavirus fears in Germany result in large crowds outside the supermarket.
column8: The viral video is 9 years old and has nothing to do with COVID-19.

column3: Donald Trump said, “People are dying who have never died before”
column8: The quote has been on the internet for over a decade attributing it to different people at different times.

column3: Janta curfew or nation wide for 14 hours will break the chain of coronavirus spread and see reduction of 40 per cent cases.
column8: There is no scientific proof to the claim as yet, that 14 hours curfew will break the chain of coronavirus spread and see reduction of 40 per cent cases.

column3: People rioting on the streets of London due to economic crisis in the wake of coronavirus outbreak.
column8: The viral video is almost nine years old and from the London riots in 2011.

column3: Vaccines to cure COVID-19 are ready.
column8: Viral image is of a COVID-19 testing kit. A cure is still being researched.

column3: Timings for sale of milk, newspapers, grocery and medical stores have been issued by the Mumbai Police commissioner.
column8: It is a hoax. The Mumbai Police commissioner has not issued any such order.

column3: Italian PM said that the country has surrendered to the Covid-19 pandemic
column8: The quote attributed to Italian PM is made up.

column3: Lions released on Russian streets by Vladimir Putin to force people inside.
column8: This viral picture is from Johannesburg in South Africa and about four years old.

column3: Aajtak news channel has run a news claiming that consuming a herbal plant ” Tulsi” will cure Coronavirus.
column8: WHO has not confirmed anything about Tulsi that it cures coronavirus. Aajtak channel has not run anything like that. The viral photo with channel logo is fake.

column3: Due to the fear of Coronavirus, Muslims in China are offereing Namaz in the open street.
column8: The viral video is four years ols and has no relation with coronavirus.

column3: Most of the passengers in the Ethiopian airlines flight from Italy are infected with Coronavirus.
column8: The viral video is of a mockdrill from Senegal.

column3: News graphic saying Indian Prime Minister has asked for internet to be shut down in the country.
column8: The news graphic is photoshopped and fake. The Prime Minister did not make this statement.

column3: A news publication reports royal Palace confirms Queen Elizabeth tests positive for coronavirus.
column8: While we cannot know if Queen Elizabeth does not have COVID-19, no evidence suggests she does. Besides, no notable publications corroborate this assertion. And, although she came in contact with Boris Johnson, Prime Minister of England who has a positive COVID-19 status, no reports definitively say she has undergone a test. Rather, credible intel suggests she is “following all the appropriate advice with regards to her welfare”.

column3: A website claiming that China has confirmed that patient zero had sex with a bat.
column8: World News Daily is a website generating fake news and it is scientifically seen that the virus has emerged from an animal source.

column3: A Facebook post suggests that a scientist in the United States has found a cure for coronavirus.
column8: There is currently no cure for COVID-19. A breakthrough suggesting otherwise would warrant notice of international TV coverage; not a mere social media posting or blog site.

column3: China Killed Pigs For Fear of coronavirus.
column8: The video is misleading.
column9: facebook accounts and pages and twitter accounts

column3: The Chinese President Visits A Mosque To Ask Muslims’ Prayers To Fight coronavirus
column8: Misbar investigated the video, and found it dates back to 2016, when Chinese President Xi Jiping visited a mosque in northwest China.

column3: Three Misleading Pictures of coronavirus Hospitals In China.
column8: Misleading Pictures.

column8: It was revealed to Misbar that the episode refers to a virus transmitted through a factory in Japan called the "Osaka" flu, and that the image circulated showing the name of the virus in the video clip is fabricated.

column8: Misbar investigated the image, and found that it belonged to a young man with Egyptian nationality, and he was not going to Beijing, but was returning from China to Egypt.

column8: America predicts COVID-19 9 years ago, and the proof is the movie "Contingent." This news is fake because of the clear difference between talking about intersections between the film's story and the spread of COVID-19.

column3: Videos showing police raids or army raids against people who don’t respect confinement measures in Algeria or Morrocco.
column8: The video was shot on March 7th, 2020. It shows the dispersal of an antigovernmental demonstration by the security forces, with no link with confinement measures or coronavirus.

column3: Drinking tea can help cure COVID-19.
column8: There is no evidence that drinking tea can help mitigate the effects of the coronavirus.

column3: A list of ten claims about the coronavirus, allegedly from a doctor who worked in a hospital in Shenzhen.
column8: Most of the claims in the message are false and many are misleading. Drinking warm water will not protect you from getting the coronavirus, for example, and there is no evidence that the virus is killed by a temperature of 26/27 degrees either.

column3: Rapper Eminem contacted coronavirus.
column8: Viral post is a hoax. Eminem has not contacted coronavirus till the time of the article got published.

column3: Tea can cure COVID-19 patients suggested by China’s whistleblower doctor Li Wenliang, the news was published by CNN.
column8: No scientific proof as of yet to suggest that tea can cure COVID-19 patients , CNN didn’t publish this news.

column3: A Popular Video of An Iranian Man Running After A Cleric Claiming To Be Infected With coronavirus.
column8: Misbar found that the video has been published on Facebook since July 2017.

As for the image circulated in the memorial service of the President of the Islamic Association of Shanghai Province in 2018 upon his death, no official party has announced that a large number of Chinese have embraced Islam after the spread of COVID-19.

Misbar checked the news and found it to be false. Returning to the official website of the World Bank, Misbar found that the World Bank announced an initial financing package worth $ 12 billion to tackle COVID-19 spread in more than 60 countries in the world.

Also, the number of pages in the largest editions did not exceed 280, so page number 365 does not exist as the fake posts claims, which was shared by dozens of pages and met with great interaction.

column3: Egyptian Health Minister Arrives to Italy with Secret coronavirus Cure.
column8: Egyptian ministry of health denied any intention to visit Italy, and Misbar could not find any report published in the Foreign Policy regarding the claim.
column9: facebook accounts and pages and twitter accounts

column3: Trump faints, is infected with coronavirus.
column8: A video shows a sudden fainting of US President Donald Trump while making a speech before a group of people. It turns out to be an old video dates back to 2016.
column9: facebook accounts and pages and twitter accounts

column3: A Video Shows Chaos in London While coronavirus Spread.
column8: Misbar investigated the video and it turned out to be old and dating back to August 2011.
column9: facebook accounts and pages and twitter accounts

column3: Did Pollution Rate Decreased in the Aftermath of coronavirus Outbreak?
column8: Misbar found that the claim is misleading; the pollution rate did decrease in some cities.
column9: facebook accounts and pages and twitter accounts

column3: Brazillian President Declares “Gaza is the Only coronavirus Free City”.
column8: Misbar investigated the claim and found that the Arabic translation with the video is fake.
column9: facebook accounts and pages and twitter accounts

column3: Italian prime minister Conte: We Lost Control Over coronavirus, Everything in the Hands of God.
column8: Misbar investigated the claim and found that it is fake; no such statement had been released from the PM on any official record.
column9: facebook accounts and pages and twitter accounts

column3: Video Shows A Woman falling down in Jeddah.
column8: Misbar investigated the video and found that the woman is mentally unstable, which caused her to fall, according to Saudi authorities.
column9: facebook accounts and pages and twitter accounts

column3: Leader of North Korea Kim Jong-Un Visits an Infected Woman Without Wearing Mask.
column8: Misbar investigated the picture which accompanied the claim, and it turned out to be old, dating back to April 2018.
column9: facebook accounts and pages and twitter accounts

column3: French Company Produces The First coronavirus Drug.
column8: Misbar investigated the claim and found that there no cure for COVID-19 until this moment, and the proposed drug has dangerous side effects when used without doctor consultation.
column9: facebook accounts and pages and twitter accounts

column3: A Photo of Coffins In Italy Relates To coronavirus.
column8: Misbar investigated the photo and found that it belongs to dead people in an unauthorized migration boat accident.
column9: facebook accounts and pages and twitter accounts

column3: Qatari Deputy Minister of Health leaves an Interview Because of coronavirus
column8: The claim isn't true. While in an interview, the host broke his chair which made the interviewee stand and helps him.
column9: facebook accounts and pages and twitter accounts

column3: Brazilian government iniciated the registration process for the coronavirus financial aid by WhatsApp.
column8: The message has been accompanied by links that can be used to steal personal data and redirect users to suspicious websites. The false information was denied by the brazilian government and Ministries of Citizenship and Economy.

column3: Vaccine made by Roche Medical Company cures COVID-19 in 3 hours.
column8: It is not true that a vaccine against the coronavirus was discovered that cures the patient in three hours, as stated by publications circulating on the networks. The photo that accompanies the text is actually a quick test for the detection of COVID-19 produced by the South Korean pharmaceutical company Sugentech. There are no approved vaccines against the new coronavirus yet.

column3: After coronavirus pandemic, Chinese president said it’s China’s time to lead the world.
column8: The excerpt highlighted today on social media, in fact, is from a speech by Xi on October 18, 2017 at the opening of the 19th Congress of the Chinese Communist Party, which takes place every five years. In the speech, Xi Jinping spoke about the achievements of his first government and said that he wanted to further strengthen China's role on the international stage.

column3: H1N1 was more lethal than COVID-19 in Brazil.
column8: The pieces of misinformation are misleading when comparing the number of cases in the first weeks of COVID-19 in Brazil with the accumulated eight months of swine flu. In the 28 days since its arrival in the country, the new coronavirus infected 1,891 people and killed 34; H1N1 infected 627 people and killed one in its first month.

column3: China released a movie called ‘Coronavirus’ in 2013.
column8: The image circulating in social media publications is an adulterated version of the South Korean production poster The Flu, whose name treats a fictional H5N1 epidemic, an avian complaint, not a virus that causes COVID-19.

column3: Brazilian government will apply fees to everyone who gets caught on the street after March 24.
column8: Although the brazilian Ministry of Health recommends that the population avoid agglomerations so as not to stimulate the spread of the new coronavirus, no legislation or regulation that prohibits the movement of people on the streets is contained in the Official Gazette of the brazilian Union, where all acts of the are published.

column3: Graphic shows that COVID-19 killed less people daily than other diseases.
column8: In addition to bringing old data (February 11), the graphic ignores that the number of daily deaths caused by the pandemic has been growing rapidly - the average daily mortality jumped from 78.7 in the first month of infection to 419.7 in the second. Experts consulted by Aos Fatos claim that the comparison with other diseases masks the severity of the current situation, because, even if the mortality of the new coronavirus is not the highest, it spreads very quickly and overloads health systems.

column3: 232 kids died from COVID-19 in Italy in one day.
column8: According to the data from the ISS (Istituto Superiore di Sanità), an Italian government agency, until March 24 (most recent data), the country had not registered a child death due to the new coronavirus. In fact, the youngest victims in the country were in the 30 to 39 age group.

column3: People looted a supermarket in São Vicente (city in Sao Paulo state) because of the lockout.
column8: It is old news that stores and supermarkets in the city of São Vicente, on the coast of São Paulo, were looted. The misinformation stems from a June 2013 brazilian TV Tribuna report.

column3: Israel is fighting coronavirus without lockouts and economy impacts.
column8: Two emergency regulations have already been approved by Israel government that restrict the movement of people of all ages. It is also false that the country's economy and health system are not being harmed by the pandemic. The government estimated that, because of the disease, the country's GDP will not grow this year and warned of the lack of respirators in hospitals.

column3: Brazilian government iniciated the registration of Social Security withdraws to fight the pandemic by WhatsApp.
column8: Besides such a fund does not exist, the link that accompanies the text on social networks leads to a suspicious address that can not only steal users' personal data, but also leave cell phones vulnerable to invasions.

column3: Israel’s Ministry of Defense said the best measure against the pandemic is isolating the elders.
column8: In the video, published on March 20, Naftali Bennett says that the most important thing to contain the COVID-19 crisis is that young and old do not live together. However, publications that disseminated the material omit that the minister himself corrected himself four days later, in a video published in his official account, and defended the massive lockout.

column3: Photo shows a man that was cured of COVID-19 by hydroxycloroquine.
column8: The image in question is from a 2019 brazilian RBS report, prior to the coronavirus pandemic and any case recorded worldwide. The man is Walter Hugo Balestra Pombo, a patient with pulmonary emphysema admitted to the ICU of the Moinhos de Vento hospital in Porto Alegre due to treatment for pulmonary emphysema.

column3: Tire repairer who died in a work accident was included in the death figures for COVID-19.
column8: In a note to Aos Fatos, the Pernambuco's Department of Health reported that the death certificate of a 57-year-old man who circulates in social media publications is true, but the cause of death was rectified after further laboratory tests concluded that he died on account of another respiratory virus. The state agency also reported that the man's death was never included in state statistics as a result of COVID-19.

column3: The title of the article states: “The first pregnant woman with coronavirus in Macedonia gave birth.”.
column8: The assertion in the headline that the first pregnant woman with coronavirus gave birth in Macedonia is false. Actually it is an event that happened in Serbia.

column3: A declaration of the director of the Center for Coordination of Health Alerts and Emergencies of Spain about tests of COVID-19 to health personnel
column8: Fernando Simón, the director of the Center for Coordination of Health Alerts and Emergencies of Spain said that all the health personell in contact with a infected collegue with COVID-19 during a public speech, this was denied by the Health Ministery, the protocols and the personnel.

column3: Garlic, onions, and other traditional medicine recipes are the treatments against the new coronavirus.
column8: There is no evidence that garlic can protect from the new coronavirus - WHO. As well as there is no support that traditional medicine can help with the new coronavirus.
column9: secretary of the national security and defense council oleksiy danilov

column3: Terrible conditions in Ukrainian hospitals for ordinary people on the photo.
column8: The photo of the hospital is not new. It was taken in Horlivka in 2014.

column3: Government to spray medicine in the air overnight to kill coronavirus.
column8: There is no such government order for residents of Chandigarh, Bengaluru, or any other city that government would spread medicine in air to destroy coronavirus.

column3: Passengers at Delhi airport got agitated Wednesday morning as their passports were withheld by airport authorities.
column8: This incident took place a few days back at IGIA in relation to mandatory coronavirus screening

column3: Hot air application through hairdryer will beat coronavirus.
column8: There is no proven evidence that hot air application through a hairdryer will cure coronavirus.

column3: In the city of Lviv (or Vinnytsia) the coughing man was thrown out of the bus.
column8: The security service of Ukraine stated that the video is not related to the new coronavirus and was recorded well before the start of the pandemic or quarantine in Ukraine.

column3: Donald Trump announced that Roche will launch a vaccine for coronavirus next Sunday.
column8: Donald Trump never said this. Roche has only got emergency approval from FDA for coronavirus tests.

column3: One can get free masks from the government to fight coronavirus by filling this form in the web link.
column8: These are dubious web links. The government is not making any such offer.

column3: Actor Tom Hanks died due to coronavirus.
column8: This is a hoax. Tom hanks and his wife is recovering from coronavirus.

column3: China is supplying Quran to people to read after the Coronavirus outbreak.
column8: This is at least a seven-year-old video and has no relation to coronavirus.

column3: A viral post claiming there is a French state scandal about chloroquine, additioning 20 different claims.
column8: Most of the claims are false or out of context.

column3: French champion of chloroquine Didier Raoult is supposed to have said not to use Bill Gates’ vaccines.
column8: Raoult's team denies he made such a statement.

column3: The brazilian doctor Drauzio Varella defends that the population don’t need lockout.
column8: The video brings outdated information about the COVID-19 crisis and creates confusion by mixing real recommendations, how not to create panic, with others now ineffective, how to maintain normal life. Sites also amplify misinformation and use false titles to disorient. In a note on its website, the team that works with the doctor classified this type of disclosure as "disservice", which, according to them, is "confusing the population".

column3: Auto-hemotherapy cures COVID-19.
column8: Auto-hemotherapy it's not among the prevention or treatment measures for the new coronavirus recommended by national and international health authorities. In addition, documents from medical entities and Anvisa (Brazilian National Health Surveillance Agency) published before the COVID-19 pandemic already warned of the risks of the practice, which has no scientific backing and may offer health risks.

column3: Dr Naresh Trehan has said that the Indian government is going to declare a national emergency.
column8: This is a hoax. Dr Trehan's office has not issued any such message.

column3: The new coronavirus is a biological weapon.
column8: There is no evidence this claim is correct.
column9: ex-general prosecutor of ukraine svyatoslav piskun

column3: Italian PM broke down over coronavirus deaths in his country.
column8: The man seen crying in the picture is Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro and the incident has nothing to do with the COVID-19 outbreak.

column3: Ministry of Home Affairs in India has directed people to not post anything related to coronavirus.
column8: The message has been undersigned by the Principal Secretary to the Home Minister but in reality there is no such post of person in the ministry.

column3: Drug ”ibuprofen” can be an aggravating factor , one should use “paracetamol” instead.
column8: Based on currently available information, WHO does not recommend against the use of of ibuprofen.
column9: media citing the french ministry of health

column3: Woman burned her hands while putting on the stove due to high alcohol content in hand sanitiser.
column8: It is a hoax. Alcohol in hand sanitisers evaporate completely once applied on the hands.

column3: Tokyo Olympics logo has been redesigned on the theme of social distancing.
column8: The Tokyo Olympics logo has not been redesigned.

column3: The text from a Macedonian website, and more specifically the headline says that the Leader of the French National Front, Marine Le Pen, is the first victim from the EU from coronavirus.
column8: It is a bad translation from foreign media. Marin Le Pen has never stated that she is the first coronavirus victim in the EU. She said in an interview with the French edition of Russia Today that "the EU is a victim of coronavirus". This is very different from the text's claim that "Le Pen is a coronavirus victim".

column3: A licensed guide from Rome and the Vatican named Katya tells what is really going on with the coronavirus epidemic in Italy.
column8: Several statements do not correspond to scientific facts and official statements.

column3: The viral image is of a doctor couple in Italy who gave their lives treating coronavirus patients.
column8: This photograph was taken in Barcelona airport, Spain. No such news report of the Italian doctor couple found.

column3: Dolphins and swans return to Italy waterways after COVID-19 lockdown.
column8: Dolphins and swans are spotted on Italy's waterways and this has nothing to do with the coronavirus lockdown.

column3: Live stream about the infected foreigners coming to Ukraine from Italy, which went viral.
column8: It turned out later that the people on that plane were not infected and some of the information by the speaker was lies.

column3: Clapping together at 5 pm will create a vibration which will destroy coronavirus.
column8: There is no proven evidence that vibration created by collectively clapping can destroy coronavirus.

column3: An audio clip claiming to be of renowned heart surgeon Dr Devi Shetty is going viral on Facebook, Twitter, and WhatsApp.
column8: The viral clip has been falsely attributed to Dr Devi Shetty.

column3: Bolivian former Health minister, Ariana Campero, use an image in twitter post to criticize the actual government.
column8: The image is from Ecuador.
column9: ariana campero, health former minister of bolivia

column3: Coronavirus patients in China are being caught by officials on a highway.
column8: The video in the post is the video of a ‘Mock drill’. The China SWAT team in the video is ‘practising’ to deal with coronavirus patients.

column3: Video of police killing COVID-19 affected people in China.
column8: The posted video was edited with three unrelated clips to falsely claim that Police with arms are killing people. The Yiwu Police have clarified that the armed Police in the video were on their duty to kill a rabid dog. And, the last clip is related to an accident.

column3: China court gave permission to kill 20,000 patients affected with coronavirus.
column8: There is no evidence for the claim that the chinese court had ordered to kill the 20,000 patients affected with coronavirus. Also, the website that published this news had published few fake news stories in the past.

column3: Coronavirus is found in Broiler Chicken.
column8: No evidence to prove that Coronovirus found in the broiler chickens. WHO has clarified that meat cooked properly can be consumed.

column3: Video of bats found under the tiles of many roofs in Hubei, China. They were the source of coronavirus.
column8: The video was not taken in China. It’s an old video uploaded on 05 July 2011 by a Miami based roofing company called ‘Istueta Roofing’. The bats in the video were found under the tiles during the process of replacing a roof for a customer in Miami (US).

column3: 2019 novel coronavirus can be cured by one bowl of freshly boiled garlic.
column8: World Health Organization (WHO) has issued a clarification that garlic may have some antimicrobial properties but there is no evidence that it can protect people from the 2019 novel coronavirus.

column3: Dettol sanitizer can kill coronavirus. The company knew about the coronavirus back in 2019.
column8: The ‘Coronavirus’ mentioned on Dettol bottle is the previous strains of coronavirus, not the 2019 novel coronavirus (2019-nCoV). Also, Dettol manufacturer (‘RB’) has clarified that they do not yet have more details of the new virus and are not yet in a position to confirm levels of effectiveness against the new strain.

column3: Image of coronavirus victims in China.
column8: The image is from Germany and it shows people lying down in a pedestrian zone, as part of an art project in Frankfurt, in remembrance of victims of the Katzbach Nazi concentration camp.

column3: Videos of Pigs being buried in China due to the coronavirus outbreak.
column8: The videos posted are old. They are in no way related to the recent coronavirus outbreak.

column3: Homeopathic drug ‘Arsenicum album 30’ can be used to prevent coronavirus.
column8: There is no scientific evidence to claim that Homeopathic drug 'Arsenicum album 30' can be used to prevent coronavirus. Even WHO doesn't list any medication that can prevent being effected with coronavirus.

column3: Effects of coronavirus on an affected persons lip.
column8: The video shared a effect of Coronovirus on a patient lip is found to be on the internet at least since November-2019 i.e. before the recent epidemic broke out. So, it is not related to the recent coronavirus epidemic.

column3: Video is of Canadian PM Justin Trudeau’s wife who is suffering from COVID-19.
column8: Woman seen in the video is not the wife of Justin Trudeau but a COVID-19 patient from London.

column3: Sex helps to prevent coronavirus.
column8: No proves that sex can help fighting the new coronavirus.

column3: Picture is of coffins of coronavirus patients who died in a single day in Italy.
column8: The picture is indeed from Italy but is seven years old and has nothing to do with the coronavirus outbreak.

column3: Hold your breath for 10 seconds to check if you have coronavirus or not.
column8: The fact is that most young COVID-19 patients will be able to hold their breaths for much longer than 10 seconds, while on the other hand, many elderly without the virus won’t be able to do it.

column3: Video of passengers infected with Coronavirus on an Ethiopian Airlines flight from Italy that reached Addis Ababa airport.
column8: The video is of an ‘Emergency Exercise’ at Blaise Diagne International Airport (Senegal) in November 2019. So, the video is of a drill that was conducted a month earlier before the first coronavirus case was detected in China.

column3: Press Release on movement restriction for COVID-19 outbreak by National Security Council, PMO (India).
column8: The press release in the post was issued by the Malaysian Government, not by the Indian Government.

column3: BBMP (Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike) will be spraying medicine in the air after 10 PM tonight in order to kill COVID-19.
column8: The BBMP Commissioner and the Mayor have clarified that the message is just a rumor and the BBMP has no such plans to spray any medicine for COVID-19.

column3: Scientists have found that drinking bitter gourd juice can cure Coronavirus.
column8: The World Health Organization (WHO) or the Ministry for Health & Family Welfare (India) hasn’t announced that drinking bitter gourd juice will cure coronavirus. The Press Information Bureau (PIB) has clarified that the message is ‘fake’.

column3: Video of goats affected by Coronavirus.
column8: The video is an old one. It was taken before the recent coronavirus outbreak. Also, the Minister for Animal Husbandry, Dairying and Fisheries has clarified that there is no evidence to show that eating mutton can transmit coronavirus.

column3: Gargling warm water with either salt or vinegar can eliminate coronavirus.
column8: The World Health Organisation (WHO) or Indian government has not mentioned anywhere that the gargling of warm water with salt or vinegar can eliminate coronavirus. Indian government’s Press Information Bureau (PIB) has also said that the message that was circulating on social media is fake.

column3: Video of American President Donald Trump announcing that Roche Medical Company will launch the vaccine for COVID-19.
column8: In the video, American President Donald Trump hasn’t said that Roche Medical Company will launch the vaccine for COVID-19. He announced FDA’s approval of a coronavirus ‘test’ developed by a company ‘Roche’ to increase and accelerate the country’s capacity to test for the virus.

column3: Coronavirus was found in meat (mutton).
column8: The photo in the post was edited. Also, the photo was taken five or six years ago. WHO and FSSAI have also mentioned that properly cooked meat can be consumed.

column3: Video of police in China taking into control suspected COVID-19 patients in the country.
column8: The video shows Police in Hong Kong taking into control demonstrators who were protesting against the introduction of a controversial bill that would have allowed extraditions to mainland China.

column3: Details of three Coronavirus positive cases reported in Kothapet (Hyderabad, India).
column8: Dr G Srinivasa Rao (Director of Public Health, Telangana) has told FACTLY that the viral message is not true. Also, Rachakonda Police has tweeted that a FIR has been filed in the Chaitanyapuri PS (Kothapet area) on the person who spread the fake news.

column3: After husband tested positive for coronavirus, wife fled from Bangalore to Agra in India.
column8: The woman went to her parents place in Agra on 9 March, while her husband was confirmed positive for coronavirus on 12 March. Also, she didn’t enter Bangalore city. Karnataka government has also clarified that the woman didn’t flee to her parents’ place.

column3: Video of the new hospital set up by China for coronavirus patients.
column8: The video is found to exist on the internet at least since 2018. So, the claim that it shows the new hospital set up by China for coronavirus patients is FALSE.

column3: Images of BJP men smearing cow dung on one another after their party leader Suman Haripriya has said that cow dung may help cure Coronavirus.
column8: Assam BJP MLA Suman Haripriya has made those statements on 02 March 2020. But the images are from ‘Goraihabba’ festival that was celebrated in Thalavadi (Tamil Nadu) on 30 October 2019.

column3: European Health Organization (EHO) announced that eating beaf can cure coronavirus.
column8: There is no official institution with the name European Health Organization (EHO). Also, no authority in the European Union has announced that eating beaf will cure coronavirus.

column3: Precautionary measures suggested by the UNICEF.
column8: The viral message was not issued by the UNICEF. Some of the measures suggested in the message contradict the WHO’S view on COVID-19. Also, some have no scientific evidence.

column3: In the video, the woman who is asking to take coronavirus seriously is the wife of the Prime Minister of Canada.
column8: The woman in the video is not Canada Prime Minister’s wife (Sophie Grégoire Trudeau). She is Tara Jane Langston, a waitress who contracted COVID-19 and undergoing treatment at Hillingdon Hospital in London. She took the video to tell people in her country that the coronavirus is serious.

column3: Reserve Bank of India (RBI) extended the year closing till 30 June 2020.
column8: The normal financial year in India followed by the government & all other institutions including for taxation purpose is 01 April to 31 March. However, RBI’s accounting/financial year is from 1 July to 30 June. There is no change in the normal financial year.

column3: Video of the current situation in Italy due to coronavirus.
column8: The video is of an ‘Emergency Exercise’ at Blaise Diagne International Airport (Senegal) in November 2019. The mock drill was conducted to ensure if the crew can handle emergency situation at the airport.

column3: Video of Canada PM Justin Trudeau’s wife pleading people to take COVID-19 seriously.
column8: The woman in the video is not Canada Prime Minister’s wife (Sophie Grégoire Trudeau). She is Tara Jane Langston, a waitress who contracted COVID-19 and undergoing treatment at Hillingdon Hospital in London.

column3: The Russian president, Putin, has left 800 lions outside to make people stay in their homes.
column8: The photo in the post has no connection to Russia. It is a photo of a movie shooting in South Africa. Putin did not leave 800 lions outside to make people stay in their homes.

column3: Image of the people who died of Coronavirus in Italy.
column8: The photo is not related to recent coronavirus deaths in Italy. It was taken in Frankfurt (Germany) in 2014 as part of an ‘art project’ in remembrance of 528 Katzbach victims of the Nazi concentration camp.

column3: Photo of the prime minister of Italy crying and expressing his helplessness that he couldn’t save coronavirus patients in Italy.
column8: The person in the photo is not the PM of Italy. He is Jair Bolsonaro, the President of Brazil. The photo was taken when he cried at an ‘Evangelical Thanksgiving Service’. The PM of Italy has not expressed helplessness that he couldn’t save coronavirus affected patients in Italy.

column3: Photo of a vaccine developed by US scientists for COVID-19.
column8: The photo shows a COVID-19 diagnostic test kit developed by Sugentech, a South Korean based company. It is not a vaccine. As on 23 March 2020, there is no vaccine for COVID-19. Also, Trump announced FDA’s approval of a coronavirus ‘test’, not a vaccine, developed by a company ‘Roche’ to increase and accelerate the country’s capacity to test for the virus.

column3: There is science behind Indian Prime minister Modi’s 5 PM clapping initiative: Clapping generates vibration which can kill Coronavirus. Also, 22 March 2020 is Amavasya.
column8: There is no scientific evidence to prove that vibration from clapping hands can kill coronavirus. The Press Information Bureau of India has clarified that the message is fake. Also, Amavasya is not on 22 March 2020.

column3: Coronavirus can live only up to 12 hours on any surface
column8: According to a scientific study, coronavirus (SARS-CoV-2) was stable on some surfaces (like plastic and stainless steel) for up to 72 hours (3 days). Also, on the WHO website, it can be read that virus ‘may persist on surfaces for a few hours or up to several days’.

column3: Audio clip of a conversation claiming that Government of India will announce shutdown of the country in the coming days from 15 April to 15 June in the wake of Coronavirus outbreak
column8: PIB termed the audio clip of the phone conversation discussing ‘complete lockdown’ of the country from 15 April to 15 June as ‘fake’. WHO India has also confirmed that the audio is fake.

column3: People shouting ‘Allahu Akbar’ in Europe after the Coronavirus outbreak.
column8: The video is not related to COVID-19 outbreak in Europe. The video was found to be on the internet since 13 January 2020, whereas the first COVID-19 case in Europe was reported on 24 January 2020. The video was taken in Germany, where the first COVID-19 case was reported on 28 January 2020.

column3: Government of India has announced a ‘National Lockdown’ in the country from 20 March 2020.
column8: No, the Government of India hasn’t announced a ‘National Lockdown’ in the country from 20 March. PM Modi, in his recent address to the nation about the coronavirus outbreak, has asked people to practice ‘social distancing’ and to stay home as much as possible for the coming few weeks to combat COVID-19. Also, the Press Information Bureau (PIB) has clarified that the message is ‘fake’.

column3: Indian PM Modi is providing free masks to people under ‘Swachh Bharat Mission’ to keep them protected from Coronavirus outbreak.
column8: The website in the post is a dubious one and there is no government scheme of PM Modi under which free masks are being provided to people. The Press Information Bureau (PIB) has also clarified that there is no Central government scheme that provides free masks to people to keep them protected from coronavirus outbreak.

column3: Recently, Petrol companies have reduced Rs. 6.40 on petrol and on Diesel Rs. 6.80.
column8: Recently, the petrol and diesel price has not reduced by Rs.6:40 and Rs.6.80 respectively. Petrol and diesel prices have come down by about Rs.2 in the last three weeks.

column3: COVID-19 patients will not show symptoms for the first 14 days.
column8: On the WHO website, it can be read that the incubation period for COVID-19 range from 1-14 days. But, most commonly COVID-19 patients show symptoms in around five days.

column3: Photo of an Indonesian doctor, Hideo Ali, looking at his children and pregnant wife for the last time.
column8: The one in the photo is not Indonesian doctor, Hideo Ali. He is a doctor from Malaysia. A Malaysian man posted this picture on Facebook saying that the doctor is his cousin and because of the spread of COVID-19 across the country, he had to leave his family and work constantly. Since, he doesn't have time he is looking at his family from a distance, and the photo is related to that instance.

column3: COVID-19 was known to humans before its outbreak in 2020.
column8: The new SAR-CoV-2 virus (which cause COVID-19) was first reported in December 2019. All the old images and videos being shared on social media refer to the virus as coronavirus, not as SAR-CoV-2 (or COVID-19). coronaviruses were known to human decades ago. All the references made on social media were about the coronaviruses, a general term for various viruses which cause diseases ranging from the common cold to Severe Acute Respiratory Syndrome (SARS).

column3: Image of dead bodies of coronavirus victims in Italy.
column8: The image shows coffins containing the dead bodies of Lampedusa shipwreck victims. In 2013, a boat packed with around 500 African migrants caught fire and sank around half a mile from the Italian island Lampedusa leading to the death of more than 300 people.

column3: Photos of coronavirus patients being treated on the road in Italy.
column8: The photos in the post are related to the earthquake in Croatia on 22 March. Patients at the hospital were evacuated because of the earthquake.

column3: Another new disease called ‘Hanta virus’ in China.
column8: Hanta virus' has infected people in different countries for many years. That's not a new virus. In the US, between 1993 and 2017, approximately 728 people were infected with the virus which can be seen on the CDC website.

column3: A video of a policeman taking down a man wandering during ‘lockdown in Italy’.
column8: The video is from Brazil and it shows Police taking down an alleged knife-wielding-man in Sao Paulo on 19 March.

column3: A video showing a pile of corpses in Italy.
column8: The video in the post is not real. It was a movie clip from a 2007 mini-series called 'Pandemic'.

column3: Mustard oil prevents a person from getting infected with COVID-19.
column8: Neither World Health Organization (WHO) nor the Ministry for Health & Family Welfare (India) has announced that using mustard oil can prevent a person from getting infected with COVID-19. The Press Information Bureau (PIB) has clarified that the message is ‘fake’.

column3: Coronavirus is also spread through newspapers.
column8: When a person with COVID-19 disease touches the newspaper coronavirus can be on the newspaper for some time, but the risk of coronavirus infection due to newspapers is very low, according to the World Health Organization (WHO).

column3: Photos of Italian man committing suicide after he lost his entire family to COVID-19.
column8: The video was taken in Spain and is found to be in circulation on the internet at least since the last week of December 2019. But, the first COVID-19 death was reported only in the second week of January 2019 in China.

column3: Photo of the prime minister of Italy crying and expressing his helplessness that he couldn’t save coronavirus patients in Italy.
column8: The person in the photo is not the PM of Italy. He is Jair Bolsonaro, the President of Brazil. The photo was taken when he cried at an ‘Evangelical Thanksgiving Service’. The PM of Italy has not expressed helplessness that he couldn’t save coronavirus affected patients in Italy.

column3: Video of Italian police taking down a man who has come on to the streets despite lockdown in the country.
column8: The video is from Brazil and it shows Police taking down an alleged knife-wielding-man in Sao Paulo on 19 March.

column3: Kerala has asked NABARD for a loan of Rs 20,000 crore to deal with COVID-19.
column8: While it is true that the Kerala Government has announced a financial package of Rs. 20,000 crore to fight the pandemic, they have not asked NABARD for a loan of Rs 20,000 crore. They have requested for a special line of credit of Rs 2000 crore from NABARD under RIDF.

column3: Look at the condition of of a Karimnagar person who is affected with coronavirus.
column8: The video in the post is not related to India. A doctor from Equador has posted in her twitter account that the video was taken in Equador.

column2: fake news, conspiracy theory, manipulation of facts, disinformation, clickbait
column3: Coronavirus was created in the lab in order to destroy the Chinese economy. The vaccine is already available.
column8: Claims that the "mutation of the virus corona was caused artificially in the laboratory" and that it was a "biological war" and that the virus was "released to weaken the Chinese economy" are rated as conspiracy theories because there is no evidence or argument for them.
column9: serbian news agency, and then dozen of media in balkan region

column3: China Seeks Court’s Approval To Kill 20000 coronavirus Patients.
column8: Post claiming China seeks court’s approval to kill 20000 coronavirus patients is fake.

column3: Video broadcast on networks allegedly shows the ‘first killed by COVID-19 in Ibagué’, in Columbia.
column8: The images were taken out of context. It is actually the first coronavirus patient in this city to be discharged from the hospital.

column3: In audio, they warn of the arrival of COVID-19 at Suba hospital.
column8: Health entities in the capital confirmed that this is misinformation. So far, there are no cases of coronavirus in the Suba hospital.

column3: Three photos showing coffins lined up in an enclosed space have been released on social media with a message about the coronavirus pandemic in Italy. “This is Italy,” he said.
column8: The images correspond to migrants killed in shipwrecks in the Mediterranean in 2013.

column3: Ecuadorean government gives money to people from Venezuela.
column8: The government doesn't give money to Venezuelans.

column3: On WhatsApp a video circulating of Rabbi Dan Ben Avraham, International President of the Netzarita AMI Alliance, according to their Twitter. In the video, the rabbi says that “the Israeli Minister of Health has officially declared that Israel has the coronavirus vaccine.” And sentence, “Israel has the vaccine already.” But this is not true. Although Israel is working on a vaccine, it is not ready yet.
column8: According to the WHO, the necessary safety approvals to bring a viable vaccine to market could take up to 18 months.

column3: A WhatsApp chain cites real research on the survival of different coronaviruses in various materials and in the air.
column8: SARS-CoV-2 does last hours or days on some surfaces, others need to be studied. One of the studies cited found that the SARS-CoV-2 virus survives: Three hours dispersed in air, Four hours in copper, 24 hours in cardboard and Two to three days in plastic or stainless steel.

column3: Claims that Columbian President Iván Duque approved collective dismissals of workers due to the emergency by COVID-19. Some of the messages attach as proof screenshots of Resolution 0803 of 2020 of the Ministry of Labor.
column8: Government has not approved collective dismissals for coronavirus. Resolution 0803 of 2020 of the Ministry of Labor does not authorize collective dismissals. Other measures require the employee to agree.

column3: An image accompanies the text: The Italian Prime Minister wept when he recognized that they were losing the battle against the Coronavirus.
column8: Message assures that the Italian leader cried over the situation of COVID-19 in his country, but the image that supposedly proves it is of Jair Bolsonaro from Brazil at a religious ceremony in 2019.

column3: Coronavirus (COVID-19) is ‘mix of SARS, HIV, tuberculosis and malaria’.
column8: A WhatsApp audio assures this, but neither that statement, nor several others that he mentions, have scientific support.

column3: In a statement, Russian President Valdimir Putin said that Russian citizens have to choose between quarantine and prison.
column8: Putin has not enacted this, although it is a possible punishment in Moscow and there is a bill that could send those who break the quarantine and cause infections to jail.

column3: Photo of Deer on Ooty-Coimbatore road during the current lockdown (COVID-19).
column8: It is an old photo. The photo is on the internet at least since 2014. It was taken in Japan, not in India.

column3: Iranian girl Anahita Hashemzadeh has contracted Coronavirus.
column8: Anahita Hashemzadeh hasn’t contracted coronavirus. In the comments section of her Instagram videos, her mother has clarified multiple times that she is ‘safe and healthy’ and the news regarding Anahita getting infected with coronavirus is ‘fake'.

column3: This is a picture of the old city in Hyderabad (India) today despite the lockdown.
column8: The video is an old one. It was not taken during the current lockdown. Also, today’s Friday prayer at Mecca Masjid was conducted with only a few members.

column3: A video of a Chinese epidemiologist saying that there are millions of infected.
column8: Same case of this Newtral verification: https://www.newtral.es/bulos-coronavirus-wuhan-casos-videos-teorias-conspiranoicas/20200225/.

column3: A 1981 book predicted the coronavirus outbreak.
column8: There are coincidences, but it's not a prediction.

column3: Bats that hide under Wuhan rooftops caused the COVID-19 outbreak.
column8: The video was filmed in Miami in 2011.

column3: A monkey is been infected with coronavirus in this photo.
column8: The photo is a capture of a video taken at least two months before the first symtoms of COVID-19.

column3: A man with a gas mask at a supermarket in Lugo (Galicia, Spain).
column8: The picture was taken in Austria, not Spain.

column3: China builds a hospital in 48 hours for Coronavius patients.
column8: Please click the link to read the full article

column3: Viral claims propogating UNICEF Message About coronavirus.
column8: Mr. Jeremy Sprigge, Communication Specialist of UNICEF Sri Lanka confirmed that “these messages are NOT UNICEF statements and henceforth FALSE” and that an official communication regarding the same would be published via UNICEF’s social media channels.

column3: Coronavirus found in Broiler Chicken.
column8: No evidence to prove that Coronovirus found in the broiler chickens. WHO has clarified that meat cooked properly can be consumed.

column3: Cocaine kills coronavirus.
column8: Fake story was generated by a website that allows people to create their own news stories. Previously busted claim.

column3: CDC Recommends Men Shave Their Beards To Protect Against coronavirus.
column8: The claim is based on a Centers for Disease Control chart created in 2017 to advise medical workers on the best practices for wearing "filtering facepiece respirators" during contact with viral patients. It was not intended for the general public - nor specifically for preventing the spread of coronavirus.

column3: A WhatsApp message suggests holding the breath during 10 seconds and drink water every 15 minutes are effective methods fighting coronavirus.
