column8: There are no medical and scientifical evidences of this.

column3: Madrid’s government has announced students will have to make-up classes during summer.
column8: Madrid's government hasn't announced the students will have to make-up classes during summer: the shared photo is fake.

column3: Neuroscientist Rodolfo Llinás says that if you can last 10 seconds without coughing and without discomfort it means that there is no fibrosis in the lungs and therefore no coronavirus infection.
column8: Rodolfo Llinás claims that he has not said that and there is no evidence that these recommendations are effective.

column3: Audio from WhatsApp in which the head of Cardiology at the Gregorio Marañón Hospital states that we are in a moment of uncontrolled coronavirus infection.
column8: The public health authorities of the Community of Madrid have classified the audio that supposedly belongs to the head of Cardiology at the Gregorio Marañón Hospital as false.

column3: Nostradamus predicted the coronavirus pandemic.
column8: In the book Prophecies of Nostradamus it doen´t say any of the words that are now being spread. The prophecies that record the words "plague" and "dust" are different from the one that circulates in the image that went viral.

column3: Italians throw money on the streets.
column8: The photo has nothing to do with Italy. The photos were taken in Venezuela and published on March 11, 2019. Hooded men robbed the oldest Bank in Merida and scattered bolivars (the currency of Venezuela), which had lost value as a result of hyperinflation, through the streets.

column3: Davao City Mayor Sara Duterte said that local government units (LGUs) should be blamed for why the P200-billion cash assistance has not reached constituents.
column8: The statement did not come from Sara Duterte nor did it reflect her views about federalism and the national government's response to the coronavirus crisis.

column3: Man is spitting on police officer to spread COVID-19 in India.
column8: An older video of an under trial spitting on a cop as he was denied home cooked food was falsely shared as being related to COVID-19.

column3: Rotis hailing PM Modi shared in Madhya Pradesh, India during lockdown.
column8: The rotis were distributed in 2014 and are not related to the recent COVID-19 outbreak.

column3: A video purporting that an attack on doctors was avenged by police men.
column8: A set of doctors were attacked in India when they went about collecting samples for COVID-19. This video is not a revenge by policemen for the same and is not linked to coronavirus.

column3: Lemon bicarbonate as tea and green tea can treat and prevent coronavirus.
column8: There is no scientific evidence stating that any kind of tea impacts the spread or growth of the novel coronavirus.

column3: People under querantione singing a Kurdish song at their balconies in Diyarbakır.
column8: The video is from İtaly, Sicilia. The Kurdish song was added to the original video.

column3: Chinese people convert to islam because of cov.
column8: It s an old video, not related to CoV.

column3: Video of Wuhan market where the new coronavirus started to spread.
column8: Video is from a market in Indonesia.

column3: Vitamin C and warm water with lemon are effective ways of preventing COVID-19.
column8: Vitamin C has no know effect on the novel coronavirus, and neither does warm water with lemon.

column3: Weed kills coronavirus.
column8: The news clip was created through a meme generator while the WHO has stated that there are no proved cures for the virus yet.

column3: China orders citizens to abandon/kill their pets as they can transmit coronavirus.
column8: There is no proof that chinese authorities have ordererd the killing of pets; however, there is proof that some chinese authorities have apporved killings of stray dogs and cats in order to stop the spreading of the virus. The WHO says that right now there is no evidence that the virus can be transmitted through pets.

column3: Satellite images showing high levels of sulphur dioxide above China are possible evidence of mass cremations of people who have died from coronavirus.
column8: This is a forecast based on historical data. Full Fact analysis was mentioned in our article.

column3: China seeks approval from the court to kill over 20 000 coronavirus patients.
column8: There are a few inadequacies detected on the source’s website. Also, zero credible news platforms have published this claim. All these make the claim unsubstantial.

column3: Chinese elderly couple infected with coronavirus say goodbye while they are in a hospital.
column8: The elderly couple hospitalized for other conditions such as lung cancer and respiratory failure.

column3: Pictures and reports of “empty hospitals” prove COVID-19 spread is “fake crisis for real government planned agendas.”
column8: There are hospitals with significant numbers of empty beds — but not because of a conspiracy that exaggerates the coronavirus outbreak.

column3: “There was no effort” to get American experts into China after it announced the coronavirus, and “we had one person in-country (and Trump) pulled him out of the country.”
column8: Top Health and Human Services officials offered to send American experts to China within a week after China revealed a new virus was on the loose. China resisted American and World Health Organization teams, but eventually allowed a WHO team —that included some Americans — to enter the country.

column3: Says Nancy Pelosi’s “daughter is on the board of the Kennedy Center so that’s why it was so important to send them all that money.”
column8: None of House Speaker Nancy Pelosi’s children is on the Kennedy Center’s board. Pelosi is an ex-officio board member. So are several top Republican lawmakers.

column3: “In Chicago, Covid-19 actually LOWERED the death rate.”
column8: Deaths in Chicago increased in March 2020 compared to previous years, despite a decline in murders.

column3: “This lady here applied sanitizer to her hands/forearms & went to the kitchen to cook. The moment she turned on the gas stove, her hands caught fire due to the alcohol contained in the sanitizer.”
column8: This Facebook post has the ingredients of a hoax. We could not find the original photo through reverse image searching, and we found no news reports about it. Hand sanitizer is flammable because of its alcohol content. But the fire risks are low when the product is applied properly and given time to dry.

column3: “We were slow with the testing, but very quick with the travel ban. And that’s been much more critical in saving lives.”
column8: Travel restrictions can buy a government some time in stopping viral spread. But with that time, research shows, authorities need to put a dent in local transmission – by testing robustly, and then quarantining people who are positive.

column3: Says the U.S. is developing an “antivirus” that includes a chip to track your movement.
column8: This is a hoax. There is no “antivirus” or vaccine being developed that includes a chip to track movements.

column3: Photo of Money Wasted by Italians in the Middle of the Corona Pandemic.
column8: The photo was taken in Venezuela in March 2019 where there was a bank that was looted, then the perpetrators spread the old Venezuelan money, Bolivar Fuerte, on the streets and burn it.

column3: Corona Virus Form Successfully Photographed by Indian Scientists.
column8: The photo is an illustration of a virus and bacteria attached to the hand. The photo was posted on the Shutterstock website on June 15, 2015, long before the coronavirus first appeared in Wuhan, China, in December 2019.

column3: In the backdrop of the lockdown, videos of wild animals taking over the roads are surfacing on the internet. Among them, a set of pictures of a herd of Deers is doing the rounds on social media claiming that these pictures are from Lake Club, Chandigarh.
column8: The viral images are not from Chandigarh but from Sanjay Gandhi National Park in Borivali, Mumbai.

column3: There are plenty of mortuary bags in Lenox Hills Hospital in NY.
column8: There are three parts in the video. Two were indeed filmed near/in Lenox Hill Hospital in Manhattan. But the main one, with dozens of mortuary bags, comes from Ecuador (Guayaquil).
column9: el nuevo diario dominicano, and many twitter accounts

column3: Indian Social Activist Trupti Desai arrested for buying liquor during Covid 19 lockdown.
column8: The video is old and unrelated to COVID-19.

column3: Tabligi Jamat members in India are licking plates to spread COVID-19.
column8: This is an old and unrelated video, People shown in the video are of Dawoodi Bohra religion and people of these community do not waste food. That is why after eating, he lick all the utensils such as plate, spoon and bowl to ensure no food wastage and then wash the vessels.

column3: Indian State of Gujarat’s government constructed hospital for COVID-19 patients with 2200 beds in just 6 days.
column8: Gujarat government has set up 2200 beds in 4 different hospitals in 4 cities as opposed to claim. The Gujarat state government has not constructed one hospital with capacity of 2200 beds in 6 days.

column3: Lockdown in India extended till May 8th.
column8: The screenshot shared to make the claim is edited. Government has confirmed that the news is fake.

column3: A video of an orangutan washing its hands has been viewed millions of times in Facebook, Twitter and YouTube posts which claim the animal was imitating its zookeepers during the novel coronavirus pandemic.
column8: The claim is false; the video of the orangutan has circulated in reports since at least November 2019, weeks before COVID-19 was first detected in the Chinese city of Wuhan in December 2019.

column3: This pictures shows two people that have been seen going around pretending to give protective masks to people in need. Be careful, they’re thieves and not healthcare personnel.
column8: These two individuals have nothing to do with Italy or COVID-19. The pictures come from the police of Dusseldorf (Germany), and they've been taken on December 2019.

column3: Ansa news has reported that former ECB Governor Mario Draghi will lead the Italian task-force against Covid-19.
column8: The Italian police has said that it's not the original version of the certificate, but a manipulated version of it.

column3: Ghana has 307 ambulances with mobile ventilators.
column8: Despite the fact that the claim made by the Presdential advisor on health is rated Mostly True. Mobile/portable ventilators are supposed to be complemented by critical care ventilators and one cannot be spoken of in isolation.

column3: Buring candles will increase the temperature which in turn will kill coronavirus.
column8: First, it is not possible to gauge the rise in temperature because of lighting candles until we know the candles’ dimensions. Second, there is no evidence that heat can kill coronavirus.

column3: A Facebook user uploaded a video showing a man inside a police van spitting on a cop. The post claimed that this video is a proof that Tablighi community is spreading coronavirus in India.
column8: The video viral on social media in the backdrop of the Nizamuddin Markaz incident is misleading. The video has no connection with the ongoing novel coronavirus Pandemic.A 26-year-old undertrial allegedly attacked a few policemen for not allowing him to have home-cooked food brought by his family.

column3: Google has donated 59 billion (5900 crores) rupees to fight coronavirus to India.
column8: Google has not donated directly anything to India but to US. Alphabet and Google CEO Sundar Pichai has announced the company will provide over $800 million to support small and medium businesses (SMBs), health organisations, governments and health workers on the frontline of global COVID-19 pandemic.

column3: In Bolivia, a street-selling child was expelled of his selling spot (in the street) by municipal guards. They threat him to take his products away, during the quarantine times.
column8: This happened in La Paz, Bolivia, the story was covered by the newspaper Pagina Siete on February 6th 2019.

column3: Ruth Mari Calderon from the Academy John Maxwell in Bolivia shares information on the unknown cures of Covid-19.
column8: There is no scientific evidence in the OMS to support the information about the cures she has been discussing.
column9: fb account: cherry news; ruth mari calderón

column3: Coffee cures coronavirus.
column8: There is not scientific evidence to prove that coffee cures coronavirus.

column3: A picture of Tiago Leifert, host of Big Brother Brazil, with a group of Globo employees in a restaurant. The caption states that while Globo advocates for lockdown, its employees are hanging out in fancy restaurants during the COVID-19 epidemic.
column8: The picture was published by Leifert on his Instagram account in 2019. There's a banner on the background that says BBB 19 (Big Brother Brazil 19).

column3: “Joe Exotic tests positive for coronavirus in prison. It’s been confirmed.”
column8: Joe Maldonado-Passage, aka Joe Exotic, is on quarantine after transferring from a prison where other inmates tested positive for COVID-19. There has been no official confirmation that he has the disease.

column3: Says a “5G LAW PASSED while everyone was distracted” with the coronavirus pandemic and lists 20 symptoms associated with 5G exposure.
column8: President Donald Trump signed a law March 23 that tasks the federal government with securing 5G data networks. It does not explicitly provide for the installation of more cell towers. Misinformation about the health effects of 5G can be traced to a 2019 propaganda campaign promoted by Russian state television.

column3: The government of Paraíba, a state in Brazil, received 11.6 million brazilian reais from the federal government to spend on healthcare during the COVID-19 crisis. Instead, this money is being spent on artistic performances.
column8: While Paraíba did receive the 11.6 million Brazilian reais, most the money has been transfered to municipal authorities for COVID-19 prevention measures. The rest, around 2% of the money, is being used by the state health department to fund its own COVID-19 related expenses. Meanwhile, two state funded cultural agencies started a project to support live artistic performances online during the lockdown. 160 thousand Brazilian reais will be spent with that. The government transfer and the cultural actions are not related.

column3: Says for otherwise healthy people “experiencing mild to moderate respiratory symptoms with or without a COVID-19 diagnosis … only high temperatures kill a virus, so let your fever run high,” but not over 103 or 104 degrees.
column8: A fever makes it harder for some viruses to survive, but it’s not yet known whether that’s true for the novel coronavirus.

column3: The government raided The Medical City and other private hospitals, taking away their personal protective equipment (PPE).
column8: The Medical City, Pasig City police, and the Office of Civil Defense all denied the claim.

column3: New York hospitals treating coronavirus patients with vitamin C.
column8: There is no evidence that assuming doses of vitamin C cures COVID-19.

column3: Indian actor Shah Rukh Khan donated money to Pakistan to fight Coronavirus and did not help India at all.
column8: Old video of Indian news channel India Today debunking claims that about Shah Rukh Khan donating funds to Pakistan in 2017 shared with a false narrative.

column3: Beware of food delivery apps in India as they blow into the food before packaging it.
column8: The video is a 2019 video from another South East Asian country and not India.

column3: News channel graphic stating that the Indian lockdown is to be extended to May 4.
column8: The news bulletin was photoshopped.

column3: An Indian social activist was arrested when she tried to buy liquor during the lockdown period.
column8: An older video of the said social activist was shared with a false narrative.

column3: Pope Francis kissed the feet of “black people” and asked forgiveness during novel coronavirus scare.
column8: The viral video is one-year-old and has no relation to novel coronavirus.

column3: A man in Serbia broke the curfew by putting on a tree costume.
column8: The video dates back to 2016, Portland, US. The man in the video was an artist and arrested for interruğting the traffic.

column3: An orangutan in US started to wash his hands imitating his keeper.
column8: The video dates back to November, 2019 before the outbreak. Primats can imitate humans.

column3: This voice record circulating in Turkey is based on Johns Hopkings University research.
column8: Johns Hopkings University denies the research and there is no such a paper in the database. The multiple allegations in the voice record are generally not based on scientific evidence nor the methodology.

column3: Video shows demolished 5G stations in Hong Kong, protestors held the 5G responsible for COVID-19.
column8: The video dates back to summer 2019, the protests in Hong Kong. The protestors were demolishing face recognition cameras, not 5G stations.

column3: The pandemic was foreseen in Madonna’s 2019 album cover.
column8: Corona is an classic typewriter brand and the version can be seen on the cover has been produced more than a century in the US. Nothing to do with the outbreak.

column3: Photo shows the last meeting of a Turkish doctor who died due to Covid-19 with his child in Munich.
column8: The photo belongs to an American doctor with his son and he is still alive.

column3: The viral post claims that Aajtak news channel shows lockdown is withdrawn at few places while India Today news channel shows it is extended till May 4.
column8: The lockdown is neither extended nor withdrawn at any location. News channel logos are used to create fake photos.

column3: Disaster management act has been implemented, no citizen is allowed to post any update on coronavirus.
column8: The message is misleading and the viral video two years old.

column3: Portuguese authorities decided that each citizen who goes to work has to have an offcial authorization to leave home.
column8: That´s not true. Portuguese government didn´t implement that measure.

column3: If Russian people do not obey mandatory isolation they are imprisoned for 5 years.
column8: It is true that Vladimir Putin implemented this measure, but the prison sentence can be up to seven years.

column3: Hit-run deaths are counted as Covid-19 deaths in São Paulo, Brazil.
column8: The accident mentioned in the posts actually occurred on March 1 on a road in Mogi Guaçu, a Brazilian city that has not yet registered cases of the new coronavirus. In addition, the death certificate displayed in the checked posts shows the surname "de Carvalho", when the victim was named "de Cruz".

column3: Video shows trucks in Brazil discarding food lost due to isolation.
column8: The images were recorded on February 11, when, due to a heavy rain that flooded Ceagesp (market in São Paulo), marketers had to discard much of the merchandise.

column3: Post involves a video that shows how donations to charities in street markets do not go to poor people in Bolivia.
column8: Actually this video is from Colombia. It could be revealed by the license plate.
column9: fb account: empleos y trabajos en cochabamba

column3: Former President of Bolivia Evo Morales: “If I had to donate it would be to Argentina, this country have given me all, since the health services to a place to live.”
column8: The photo of the post has been manipulated. Seals and labels were falsified. The real image is from “C5N” from an interview that took place on November 15th, 2019.

column3: Minister for the Presidency of Bolivia, Yerko Nuñez, said: Government will use savings from the Bolivian State to take care of the health of Bolivians.
column8: In the video of the interview, Yerko Nuñez spoke about the social measures to attend COVID-19, however, he did not say what he would use, I have also announced the enactment of Laws 1293 and 1294.

column3: People from Riberalta, Bolivia were punished for demanding food.
column8: The photo is from Cordova, Colombia. The President, Iván Duque announced a measure that will punish people who break the quarantine
column9: fb account: ariel alberto ayaviri diaz

column3: A voice note says that the government will apply a total lockdown for two months.
column8: The voice note is false and government has not taken the decision.

column3: Colombia is the last country in the coronavirus test ranking.
column8: Colombia is not the last country and the tweet is misleading.

column3: In New York “every contaminated corpse belongs to the state” and will be incinerated without any “wakes or memorial services to pay your last respects.”
column8: New York state is allowing funeral services with limited visitors; cremation is not mandated.

column3: Drinking warm water continously can prevent COVID19. This is why Saudi Arabia are discussing forbidding Ramadan fast, which is supposed to start in late April.
column8: There is no discussion about forbidding Ramadan fasting and WHO said that drinking water doesn't prevent COVID-19.

column3: Corona virus can be killed by consuming alkaline foods.
column8: This claim cites research published in 1991, long before the coronavirus appeared in December 2019. Viruses, including the coronavirus, also have no pH. Therefore, consumption of alkaline foods with higher pH cannot kill the coronavirus.

column3: Malaysians are eating soap as a way to cure covid-19.
column8: Studies indicate eating soap could lead to digestive problems as it causes inflammation and pain in the gums,also Benjamin Chapman, professor and food safety specialist at North Carolina University claims that soap has been known for toxicity for 60 years.

column3: A video shows a woman infected with Covid-19 spitting on the fruit alley in a supermarket and being arrested.
column8: The images used belong to two different videos that were not shooted in the same supermarket. There is no evidence that it is the same woman in both and that she is infected with COVID-19. That was not the reason for the arrestment.

column3: President Giammattei gave instructions that were contradictory to the published law regarding COVID-19 mesures.
column8: The President´s instructions were contradictory to the published law, but the written law prevails, as experts explained us.

column3: Trump got a Moroccan shiekh (muslim priest) to put a spell on him that prevent COVID19.
column8: The original video is from President Trump meeting with religious leaders on National Day of Prayer in 1 september 2017.

column3: 59 Church Congregation in Africa Killed After Drinking Dettol to Prevent Corona.
column8: A priest in South Africa, Rufus Phala, had indeed told his followers to drink Dettol as a cure. However, the incident occurred in 2016, long before the emergence of the Corona COVID-19 virus in December 2019. Photos used to disseminate the narrative have also been circulating since 2016. In addition, no credible sources were found containing information on the existence of 59 church members in Africa Selatan who died from drinking Dettol because recently asked by Rufus.

column3: Soaking in the Sea Can Treat Corona Covid-19 Virus Infection.
column8: As with the nature of other viruses, the novel coronavirus attacks cells in the body, not the surface of the body like the skin, so it cannot be cured simply by soaking in the sea. Until now, according to WHO, there is no drug or vaccine to cure or prevent COVID-19.

column3: By e-mail sent to major newsrooms, Portuguese government announces cancellation of great projects of airports, due to the finantial restrictions caused by the impact of coronavirus.
column8: I's a fraudulent email that was not issued by the Portuguese government.

column3: Coronavirus causes male infertility.
column8: The publications refer to the report published on March 12 on the official website of the Hubei government and the study posted on the platform MedRxiv.org. The published report was not clinically investigated. A few hours later, it was removed from the government's website. Resource MedRxiv.org publishes articles that have not yet been accepted and/or approved by the scientific and / or medical community, may contain errors or incomplete information. To claim that the COVID-19 virus leads to male infertility, based on research not confirmed by the international medical community, is premature and erroneous.

column3: Facebook posts shared thousands of times feature a video of US officials talking to reporters, with captions claiming they are announcing the arrest of a Chinese sci
column8: However, the footage has nothing to do with COVID-19 and scientists have refuted allegations the virus was deliberately created.

column3: Italians threw away their currency on the streets due to COVID-19 deaths.
column8: The images are from Venezuela where vandals robbed a bank and threw the demonetised money on the streets.

column3: UK, USA have asked Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi to lead a task force to tackle Coronavirus.
column8: There is no such task force that the Indian prime Minister is heading. The Indian prime minister has been a part of the G20 and SAARC summits for their discussions on coronavirus. The WION's reporting was misinterpreted.

column3: Muslims are licking their plates to spread coronavirus and infect more people by the virus.
column8: The video is from three years ago depicting a Dawoodi Bohri practice of licking the plate clean so as to prevent any food from being wasted before washing and is not linked to the coronavirus outbreak.

column3: Coronavirus does not cause a runny nose; is killed by temperatures above 26 degrees; causes lung fibrosis within days of infection; can be diagnosed by holding your breath for 10 seconds; and can be cured in the early stages by drinking plenty of water.
column8: Numerous claims circulating on social media tout untested diagnostic methods, preventions, treatments, and cures for COVID-19. While many of these are not harmful by themselves, they could potentially induce a false sense of security that causes individuals to ignore basic, tested precautionary measures such as frequent handwashing, disinfecting surfaces, avoiding touching the face, social distancing, and self-isolation when sick, which have all proven effective in slowing the spread of the pandemic.
column9: steven aitchison on change your thoughts change your life

column3: The coronavirus has been “released” by China […] it was purposely propagated by the Chinese themselves.
column8: All available data indicate that SARS-CoV-2, the virus responsible for COVID-19, is of natural origin. Comparisons of viral genome sequences show that it shares a strong identity with similar coronaviruses that infect pangolins and bats. And further investigations of the SARS-CoV-2 genome suggest that the virus was not artificially created or propagated in laboratories. In the absence of evidence proving otherwise, the claim that SARS-CoV-2 was lab-created and intentionally released is not only unsubstantiated but also implausible.

column3: Video shows EU flag was lowered in France to protests outbreak policies.
column8: The video dates back to May, 2019 before the outbreak. The politician who lower the flag had already a far-right anti-EU thoughts.

column3: People sneezing purposefully to spread coronavirus at Hazrat Nizamuddin mosque in Delhi.
column8: The video has been available on the internet since long. It has no connection to coronavirus.

column3: Bill Gates wrote a letter where he says coronavirus has a “spiritual purpose” and is “a great corrector”.
column8: The viral letter is a hoax and has been falsely attributed to Bill Gates.

column3: Used Clothing in This Video Comes from Corona Patients in China Who Have Died.
column8: Photos of clothes in plastic bags have been circulating since January 30, 2013, long before the outbreak of the Corona COVID-19 virus since December 2019.

column3: Lidl supermarkets are offering 250 euros worth of food due to the new coronavirus pandemic.
column8: It's fake. This is a phishing scam designed to steal users personnal data.

column3: Ginger, onion and garlic help with coronavirus.
column8: WHO has long debunked popular rumors about coronavirus — including about ginger. It doesn't help against the virus. In General, no food product can protect you from the virus (!). and for some people, ginger is simply harmful. The mailing list about onions was translated using an automatic translator, apparently from Chinese. In fact, the onion does not have such properties.

column3: Queen Elizabeth II is infected with the new coronavirus.
column8: Buckingham Palace has only confirmed that Prince Charles is infected with COVID-19. There has never been an official announcement about the Queen.

column3: Italians are throwing their money on the streets as it is useless to them now in the time of Coronavirus scare.
column8: These are old pictures from Venezuela and have nothing to do with the COVID-19 pandemic

column3: UV rays and sunlight can kill coronavirus.
column8: A concentrated form of UVC might kill COVID-19 but it is extremely harmful for human skin. Sunlight cannot kill COVID-19.

column3: Information about a complete quarantine in Guatemala.
column8: Those were mesures taken by the president of Bolivia, not the president of Guatemala.

column3: Guatemalan Ministry of Health is hiding a COVID-19 case in a hospital in the city of Amatitlán.
column8: There wasn´t any hidden cases in Amatitlán.

column3: A list of ten tips to combat coronavirus from the board member of Stanford hospital: COVID-19 patients don’t have a runny nose; drinking hot water can prevent infection with COVID-19.
column8: Stanford Health Care denied its board of directors had published this list. All the tips are typical misinformation around COVID-19 which was already debunked by fact-checkers.

column3: Image with the narration to claim that a huge number of Muslims were roaming in Beruwala City in Sri Lanka during curfew risking the lives of many amidst COVID19
column8: The image was from a large Muslim procession held in March 2019.

column3: Prince Charles recovery from COVID-19 is suspicious, it is the proof that a vaccine already exists.
column8: If there was a vaccine, Prince Charles wouldn't have been sick in the first place.

column3: Because there was no school for weeks due to COVID-19, french summer hollidays will be shorter this year.
column8: This is an april fools joke. The dates haven't been changed.

column3: You can cure coronavirus with lemon, garlic and avocado because of its pH level.
column8: There are several mistakes in the pH scale of the ingredients and there is no known cure.

column3: Missouri students will have to repeat the school year because of COVID-19 school closings.
column8: The posts use a fabricated letter with a state logo to claim all students much repeat a grade because of school closings. State officials have publicly debunked the claim.

column3: Videos show Chinese people spreading the coronavirus in other countries.
column8: In the recordings, people appear spitting and rubbing contaminated fluids on benches, walls and elevators. Of the five recordings, Aos Fatos identified that three have nothing to do with the current pandemic. The other two sections did not have their origin or context identified.

column3: People in italy are dropping their money on the streets because of COVID19 crisis.
column8: The original photo belongs to an old non valuable currency that has been replaced with a new one in Venezuela. the money on the street is from robbers of a bank after they realized that what they have stolen is useless currency.

column3: Azan (islamic prayer call) is said from an old mosque in Granada for the first time after 500 years because of COVID19.
column8: The mosque in the video is in Balakan in Azerbaijan not Granada and the voice on the video belongs to the Iranian Mahdy Yarahi.

column3: Video of the Funeral of Corona Patients in Italy who Died.
column8: The video is an excerpt from a scene in the television series titled "Pandemic" which aired in 2007.

column3: Inhaling Hot Steam Can Kill Corona Covid-19 Virus.
column8: This virus is in the body cells even though the entry is indeed droplet through the respiratory system. so it can't be cured by breathing hot steam

column3: Amid the coronavirus crisis, Italy’s streets are now filled with discarded printed cash as seen in photos circulating on social media.
column8: The photos were taken in Venezuela, not Italy. The discarded banknotes were Bolivar Fuerte, Venezuela’s old currency.

column3: The electromagnetic waves of 5G penetrate the cells and weaken the immune system.
column8: The Italian STOP 5G committees connect electromagnetic waves with the coronavirus. They use a Thomas Cowan video on Youtube video as evidence, but there is no evidence to prove the theory.

column3: Breathing steam from boiling citrus peels prevents and cures coronavirus.
column8: There is no way to increase your body temperature to kill the coronavirus, according to the WHO. Nigerian medical experts agreed that there was no evidence for the video's claims.

column3: Filmmaker Sudhir Mishra getting beaten up by police during the lockdown for stepping out of home.
column8: The man getting beaten up by police is not filmmaker Sudhir Mishra.

column3: Air India is operating evacuation flights to bring back stranded Indians from London.
column8: The Indian High Commission in London has denied the claim. There is no such immediate plan of evacuation.

column3: Here’s the new certificate that the Ministry of the Interior is now requesting to citizens in order to leave their house.
column8: The Italian police has said that it's not the original version of the certificate, but a manipulated version of it.

column3: The Houseparty app has been hacked.
column8: The company denies the claim and is offering a $1,000,000 bounty for the first individual who can prove this.

column3: Lemon juice and bicarbonate mixture prevents and cures COVID-19 in Israel.
column8: Lemon juice and bicarbonate tea has not been proven to affect COVID-19, and the virus has killed more than 30 in Israel.

column3: Bulgarian mystic Baba Vanga predicted the coronavirus outbreak.
column8: She didn't foretold such a thing. Media reports about the prophecy she told to her acquaintance were debunked.

column3: Italian people are throwing their money, now useless because of Covid-19, in the street.
column8: Those pictures were taken in Venezuela, in 2019, after a bank robbery in Mérida city

column3: This Harvard Professor Arrested Because He Created The Corona Virus.
column8: The three were arrested in three different cases and were not related to the coronavirus. Lieber was charged with lying about his participation in a program from the Chinese government and his affiliation with Wuhan University of Technology (WUT). Lieber is not a virus expert, nor does WUT focus on viruses.

column3: The government was supposedly not buying evidence from a company related to the sister of María Dolores Cospedal, former secretary of the Popular Party, for ideological reasons.
column8: The government is buying tests for the coronavirus test from the company Genomica, of which the CEO is the sister of the former leader of the Popular Party.

column3: Several photos of coffins, allegedly, with victims of the coronavirus for which the police are being investigated
column8: Four photos with a large number of coffins are disseminated with messages such as "the photo by which dozens of police and health officials are being investigated" or "images of the Spain that Pedro Sánchez is leaving us". It is a hoax: the photos correspond to a shipwreck in front of the island of Lampedusa (Italy) in October 2013.

column3: The king of Spain can supposedly dissolve the congress and appoint an emergency government during the state of alarm
column8: During the state of alarm, the Congress of Deputies cannot be dissolved. In addition, the acts of the king will always have to be approved and signed by the President of the Government or the Congress of Deputies and the dissolution of the Cortes can only occur in 3 specific cases, which do not contemplate the current situation.

column3: A video of an alleged seer who predicted the coronavirus in December 2019
column8: There is no evidence that the video published by the seer, called Nube de María, a few days ago was recorded and broadcast in December, as they claim.

column3: Inhalation of hot steam can kill Novel Coronavirus.
column8: Inhalation of steam from hot water does not kill COVID19.

column3: The french doctor Jean-Roger Hospital sent an e-mail which claim that you can protect yourself against COVID-19 by drinking water very 15 minutes.
column8: M. Hospital says he has been hacked. It is also false to claim that you can be protected by drinking water.

column3: Website offers a rapid test for COVID19 to check yourself in seconds.
column8: The website depend mainly on fever to diagnose COVID-19 even you said you have all other symptoms including dry cough, dyspnea and fatigue. the algorism will still say you are ok and only having the common flu. the good part in the website is that it guide you when you have fever to go to hospital for treatment.

column3: “The Kaaba opened again” or “the Hajj was not stopped”.
column8: As such, the Kaaba did not close. On February 27, the official website of the Ministry of health of Saudi Arabia in connection with the spread of the coronavirus in the list of measures taken provides for a temporary suspension of the small pilgrimage. In addition, the Minister of Pilgrimage and Umrah of Saudi Arabia, Mohamed Saleh Benten, officially announced on his Twitter page that the small Hajj has been temporarily suspended. However, residents of the city can get into the mosque.

column3: Multiple posts shared hundreds of times on Facebook and Twitter in March 2020 claim a new vaccine and a new drug have been developed to prevent and treat the novel coronavirus. The posts claim the developments were made by scientists in Japan and the Philippines respectively.
column8: The claims are misleading; the Japanese government announced in late March 2020 that Japanese scientists were testing a new drug, not a vaccine, to treat COVID-19; the Philippine Food and Drug Administration warned the other drug cited in the misleading posts was "unregistered" and not safe.

column3: When you complete a registration for a 5000 Baht support fund, it will show you a green sign, not a blue sign.
column5: Fact-Checked by: Sure And Share Center MCOT
column8: The correct one is a blue one.

column3: A video has been viewed tens of thousands of times in multiple Facebook, Instagram and YouTube posts which claim it shows people in China toppling a 5G tower because of fears that they cause the novel coronavirus
column8: The claim is false; the video shows pro-democracy protesters toppling a smart lamppost in Hong Kong in August 2019, several months before the novel coronavirus outbreak.

column3: WHO advisory asks people not to consume bakery items as they get contaminated by coronavirus easily.
column8: WHO has not issued any such advisory. Till now, there is no evidence that bakery items get easily contaminated by coronavirus.

column3: Official news: in Naples people have used Tocilizumab, a drug that will cure Covid-19.
column8: The Italian Healthcare Ministry have authorized experiment to understand whether this drug can be effective against COVID-19 pneumonia. However, this research has not proved anything yet.

column3: A WhatsApp chain that claims that during the Alert State, the government will begin to record all calls and track social media publications of citizens.
column8: A WhatsApp chain ensures that all communications will be recorded. This chain says that there will be a record and monitoring of calls and content distributed through social networks. It is a false string. It has been moving since 2017 in Mexico.

column3: French summer hollidays have been rescheduled to the end of July.
column8: The original dates haven't been changed.

column3: “These are the coffins of people that have died from Covid-19. Would you now stay at home you idiots?”
column8: This picture is from 2013 and shows the coffins of migrants that died crossing the Mediterranean sea.

column3: The Spanish government stopped counting dead from COVID-19 between 6 and 9 of March.
column8: Those days, minister of Health published data on social media and at press conference.

column3: The Spanish president’s wife and daughter went to Cuenca to quarantine.
column8: The presidency and town hall deny it.

column3: Spanish authorities not arresting people who go to attend mass.
column8: The video was fimed in octobre in the Valley of the Fallen.

column3: Nike is giving away free shoes because of coronavirus.
column8: Nike denys it and there is no official information about it.

column3: Huawei has stopped to send masks because of an article of Spanish writer Josep Borrell.
column8: Huawei says it is not true.

column3: Donald Trump announced comercialization of a vaccine.
column8: The text refers to a press conference where Trump did not say that. There is no vaccine yet.

column3: A video from Italian TV predicted the virus in 2015.
column8: The video does not refer to the actual virus and is not talking about that.

column3: A viral text based image post claiming that 5000 from Italy were infected due to mobile phone cover quoting the findings were from a research without specifying any details or name of the research. The post advises to abandon phone cover and use phone without phone cover
column8: There has been no research that proved that 5000 people from Italy are infected due to phone cover.

column3: An image of arms burned for allegedly using gel alcohol to disinfect.
column8: Alcohol based gels (ethanol and isopropyl alcohol) are highly flammable if we expose ourselves to heat sources after applying them, but alcohol evaporates quickly if applied correctly.

column3: A post claiming that Yangon region in Myanmar will be locked down within 48 hours saying that announcement will come out officially.
column8: Yangon region minister for immigration and social welfare Daw Moe Moe Suu Kyi confirms that the news is false, and no plan to lockdown within 48 hours.

column3: Image of bakery items with the WHO logo and a message which given the impression that WHO had advised the public not to consume bakery products amidst COVID19 concerns.
column8: WHO has not issued any statement against consumption of bakery products and FDA confirms that there is no evidence of food or food packaging being associated with transmission of COVID-19.

column3: Pope Francis asked believers to put a white handkerchief on their doorstep for the plague to go away.
column8: There is no reference to the Pope's alleged request in any of the Vatican's official news services.

column3: A video post related to corona virus is circulating in social media saying China distributing Quran
column8: We found this video is related with Chinese Christians when Bible is seen for the first time and the video was originally shared in 2015.

column3: A 20-second clip shows a burqua clad woman having difficulty breathing.
column8: The video is not from Islampur in India, but is from Pakistan. Also, the woman does not have the coronavirus.

column3: Boiled sumac cures COVID-19.
column8: The person makes the claim is a cleric, not a scientist. There is no evidence shows sumac cures the disease.

column3: The current Coronavirus outbreak is due to the movement towards 5G.
column8: The 5G connection has no scientific evidence to the outbreak of coronavirus

column3: The coronavirus stays for 8 hours spreading in the air.
column8: COVID-19 seems to spread mainly through respiratory droplets and close contact. The droplets are too large to be transported by air for long periods of time

column3: The viral text message claims that the chemical substances (methylxanthines) required to cure COVID-19 can be found in tea. Dr. Li Wenliang had found this cure while researching about coronavirus before his death.
column8: A veteran microbiologist of India Dr. Sharad Kale, dismissed such reports saying - though methylxanthines are found in tea, there is no scientific evidence it cures coronavirus. He termed it Hoax. WHO also states that no evidence that current medicine can prevent or cure the disease.

column3: A viral video post claiming that Myanmar people have resistance to coronavirus as they eat fishpaste and vegetables. The video narration he says that Myanmar people eat rice, fishpaste and vegetables- thus we don’t need to worry about coronavirus infections as our immune system is stronger than people from the west.
column8: There is no evidence or recommendation from WHO for possible COVID-19 prevention by taking a certain food. An article in ABC news quoted two experts saying no single food is supercharger for immune system. Mohs has confirmed three COVID-19 confirmed cases two days after the viral video had such a claim.

column3: Huawei stopped donating masks to Europe.
column8: Huawei denied that it has stopped sending masks to support Europe, and has not issued an official statement.

column3: The co-founder of the Union, Progress and Democracy (UPyD) party, Rosa Díe allegedly tweeted that she says “it is time for the Army to take over …” to handle the emergency.
column8: There are no archive that show that this tweet ever existed.

column3: An alleged tweet from the president of the Vox political party in Spain, Santiago Abascal, in which someone has to answer for the infected including a misspelling.
column8: There is no evidence that Santiago Abascal has tweeted this message or that he has deleted it. The tweet is neither published nor archived and the catch that circulates is always the same.

column3: Audio clips from a doctor that works for Argentina´s most important lab testing for coronavirus.
column8: The lab denied the alleged doctor work there. Many of the advises given in the audio clip were denied by specialist.

column3: A comparison of the evolution of the coronavirus in Argentina and Chile.
column8: Specialists indicated that the data in the post is not enough to compare objectively the evolution of the pandemic in each country.

column3: COVID-19 affects mainly people with type A blood (group II).
column8: The articles refer to the Medrxiv website, which can not serve as a reliable source of scientific knowledge, and the figures in the study itself are very controversial and it is impossible to draw a final conclusion from them.

column3: Official statement of the Serbian Governement claiming that experts recommended to ban pet walks.
column8: Experts involved in Crisis Headquoter Fighting against COVID-19 denied Government's claim.
column9: government of the republic of srrbia

column3: Viral post along with a pictures claims civilian thrashing a policeman during lockdown.
column8: The viral photos are three years old and have nothing to do with the coronavirus lockdown.

column3: CDC recommends people to shave their facial hair to prevent coronavirus.
column8: No such recommendations have been made by CDC so far.

column3: Inhaling the steam of sea salt and orange peelings can prevent coronavirus infection.
column8: There is no scientific proof of the claim; WHO does not mention this remedy.

column3: Newborn Babies Call Boiled Eggs Can Treat Corona.
column8: The video used to complete the narration is an edited video. In addition, until now, there has been no vaccine or drug to prevent or treat COVID-19, including eggs. Eggs are recommended for consumption so that the immune system increases.

column3: Italian President Mattarella: “Italy will declare a life-long quarantine”
column8: President Mattarella never said that, and never could. In addition, errors made in the distributed passage indicate that the text is likely to be the product of poor-quality automatic translation. This is the first sign that the authenticity of the message is in doubt, and it needs to be verified in detail.

column3: Houses should be heated above 23º celsius because the new coronavirus can only “spread at low temperatures”.
column8: There is no scientific evidence to support this theory. There’s no connection between the death of the virus and the temperature of the houses.

column3: Video shows Italian people do a islamic prayer in streets, asking God to alleviate COVID19 epidemic.
column8: The video is from San Martin, Peru on the 7 december 2019. It's tied to a political crisis not to the COVID-19 epidemic.

column3: According to an university by the University of Turin: taking more vitamin D to reduce the risk of infection by the coronavirus.
column8: There is not a study from the University of Turin. University professors have written advice for patients with vitamin D deficiency. Professors don't say it reduces risk of infection.

column3: Posts on social media claim that a “Spanish biological researcher” called on international soccer stars Cristiano Ronaldo and Lionel Messi to find a cure for COVID-19 since they earn much more money than scientists.
column8: However, the accompanying photo shows a Spanish politician speaking in April 2018, well before the novel coronavirus outbreak

column3: An article shared hundreds of times on Facebook claims that the Ethiopian government has approved a traditional medicine treatment for COVID-19 after successful clinical trials on animals and humans.
column8: However, the Ministry of Health denied the claims and Capital Ethiopia, which published the story, has corrected its Facebook post.

column3: A post has been shared repeatedly in multiple posts on Facebook which claim that Singapore has started enforcing spot fines for people who flout certain social distancing regulations during the novel coronavirus pandemic.
column8: The claim is false; the Singaporean government agency overseeing the enforcement of the social distancing order refuted the claim; there is no mention of spot fines for offenders in the recently announced government regulations.

column3: Video clip shows people keep leaving Phuket.
column5: Fact-Checked by: Sure And Share Center MCOT
column8: It's not in Phuket. It's actually a news from Thailand-Myanmar border in the north. And they are Myanmar labour who wanted to go to their home country.

column3: Photo of Kenyan crowds waiting for coronavirus curfew to start.
column8: Old photo from 2011; of crowds of Kenyans in Nairobi looking at collapsed building.

column3: Drinking mix of baking soda and lemon as a hot tea cures Covid-19. Claims this “cure” has meant that there have been cases of Covid-19 in Israel, where the drink is popular.
column8: No scientific evidence for claim, confirmed by WHO and experts. Israel had nearly 5,000 cases of COVID-19 at time of publication.

column3: Dr. Usman Riyaz from Delhi died of Coronavirus.
column8: Viral picture is of Dr. Riyaz Usman from UAE and he is alive.

column3: Indian Telecom company Jio announced a free recharge worth Rs 498 for all Indian citizens during Coronavirus lockdown
column8: Telecom company Jio officially denied the claim on their official Twitter handle.

column3: Pakistan’s PM Imran Khan tested COVID-19 positive.
column8: Pakistan's Senator Faisal Javed Khan clearing the air, denied the claim, further asked the news network to correct the report. The Pakistani politician said, "News regarding PM Imran Khan tested positive for COVID-19 is NOT true. Please refrain from spreading fake news.

column3: Pakistan’s Dr. Usama Riaz, who contracted coronavirus while treating patients had left a before he died.
column8: he various social media platforms claiming that the person in the video is Dr.Usama Riaz is misleading. He is Mubhasir Ahmed, who has been living in the United Kingdom.

column3: Misleading that telephone networks are about to collapse in Mexico.
column8: Several messages have circulated about the possibility of collapse in cell phone companies due to the high traffic that has occurred in recent weeks amid the contingency by the new coronavirus.

column3: False that COVID-19 is destroyed with “hair dryer” technique.
column8: False cure using a hair dryer to destroy virus.

column3: Some cities in Turkey are gonna be disinfected by helicopters.
column8: Both national and local authorities denied the measure.

column3: Council of Higher Education in Turkey announced the spring term has alrealy been over.
column8: Spring semester is not over; higher education is going to continue remotely.

column3: Netflix gives spoiler on city screens to discourage people from going out.
column8: Billboards were not prepared by Netflix but by a creative art group.

column3: Two articles claiming that iconic coffee chain Tim Hortons will close all Canada franchises on March 30, 2020 because of the novel coronavirus were shared more than 150,000 times on Facebook.
column8: This is false; though locations are closed to dining-in, drive-throughs remain open, a spokeswoman for the chain told AFP.

column3: News ticker added to an image from Sri Lankan Ada Derana TV channel to give the impression that Dr Seetha Arambepoka stated that there is a secret medicine for COVID19 during a TV interview
column8: We contacted Dr Seetha Arambepola and cross checked with the video interviews and image comparison and confirmed a statement she had made on a different TV interview had been misinterpreted.

column3: A video claiming to be of Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau’s wife Sophie Grégoire Trudeau who is infected with Coronavirus.
column8: The woman in the video is not Sophie Trudeau, but a British woman who has been infected with COVID-19.

column3: Biden claim that Trump did not try to get medical experts into China.
column8: Biden could make a case that Trump’s efforts to gain access for medical experts to China lacked vigor or were ineffectual; he cannot say there was no effort. As for being foresighted enough to make this case early on, Biden did not explicitly call for it until near the end of February, so that appears exaggerated.

column3: Eight regions in Perú have no plan at all to manage the coronavirus crisis.
column8: Four of the mentioned regions already had emergency plans for the coronavirus crisis and they published them before the Ombudsman claim.

column3: The Argentinian vicepresident flew to her home state and violeted the quarantine.
column8: She was not on the flight indicated by the viral post. She is also exempt from the quarantine, as all high ranking government officials.

column3: Series of WhatsApp chains offering sums of money “from the national goverment and the WHO” and food packages from Walmart. All of them shared Google forms to sign up.
column8: The WHO isn´t offering finantial aid directly to people. Tha same desinformation circulated in other countries. Walmart isn´t giving away food packages.

column3: Car insurance won’t cover damage to your vehicle during the quarantine.
column8: This was denied by the state agency in charge of insurers.

column3: A recipe involving a full lemon and ground cloves has cured a woman’s COVID19 symptoms. She isn’t sure she and her maid actually had COVID19, but she still encourage people who think they have it to take this recipe.
column8: There is no evidence that full lemon and ground cloves can cure COVID-19.

column3: 59 people from Kenya die after drinking Detol when Prophet Rufus Phala of AK Spiritual Christian Church told them to do so to prevent COVID19 infection.
column8: The incident is correct but not related to COVID-19 as it happened in 2016. the priest defended himself that the Detol will transfer to water or juice with god's permission while they are drinking it.

column3: An image claiming that Vladimir Putin said that United States created coronavirus as a biological weapon.
column8: One image says Russia's President Vladimir Putin said that Donald Trump made the coronavirus as a biological weapon against China and that humanity is now paying for its mistake. There is no evidence that the Russian President has said this.

column3: An online survey to self-assess coronavirus symptoms.
column8: A questionnaire created in Google Forms circulates for people to do a self-assessment on the symptoms of the disease. It was created by a foundation, it is real, but it is not from any official institution.

column3: An emergency department closed in a Spanish hospital?
column8: Videos are real. But the emergency department wasn't closed in Leganés. It was only full and a lot of patients had to wait in the corridor.

column3: A video claiming bodies packed in body bags are being dumped in mass graves in Italy and Spain’.
column8: The video is from a 2007 sci-fi mini series called Pandemic.

column3: Images showing vaccines for Coronavirus have already been discovered, were patented and will be readily available.
column8: Images of test kits and patents of other coronavirus strains are being falsely shared as COVID-19.

column3: Indian Home Minister Amit Shah claimed to be infected COVID-19.
column8: The news graphic was created from a news generator and the news that the Home minister has COVID-19 is not true.

column3: The Netflix Korean drama My secret terrius predicted the Coronavirus outbreak in 2018.
column8: The show discusses coronavirus which is a family of viruses causing flu like symptoms, the symptoms mentioned are very different from COVID-19 and the fatality rate is much much higher.

column3: False measures of coronavirus in Bogota.
column8: The image shows how this measure will be applied in the municipality of Apartadó, Antioquia.

column3: An image of a elderly man death in Italy.
column8: The image was taken in Wuhan, China.

column3: Alleged images of markets that have been sacked by angry mobs because of the lockdown, in São Paulo.
column8: Images were from 2013.

column3: H1N1 was far more damaging to Brazil than COVID-19: the number of cases and deaths was far higher.
column8: Although the figures are somewhat accurate, they correspond to different timeframes. Data for COVID-19 amounts for the first 24 days of epidemic. The figures for H1N1 are from July 2009 to December 2010. On the first 24 days of H1N1 epidemic in Brazil, there were only 16 confirmed cases, and no one had died.

column3: Israel applied “vertical lockdown” (younger, not at risk people are allowed to carry on their daily routines), and has the lowest death rate for COVID-19 in the world.
column8: Although Israel does have one of lowest death rates in the world, they did not restrict their lockdown policies to elderly people.

column3: Bollywood superstar Aamir Khan donated Rs. 250 crore to tackle the novel coronavirus outbreak.
column8: The image viral on social media claiming that Bollywood star Aamir Khan has donated Rs 250 Crore to fight with novel coronavirus is misleading as the actor has not donated anything yet. A British Boxer named Amir Khan has offered his retail outlet to the NHS to help the COVID-19 patients.

column3: Indian Businessman, WIPRO Chairman, and philanthropist Azim Prem donated 50,000 Crore to fight the COVID-19 outbreak in India.
column8: Several media outlets used an old statement of Azim Premji to back their claim that Azim Premji has donated INR 50,000 crore to fight COVID-19 outbreak in India and then the same media reports were amplified by several verified Twitter handles including journalists, media personalities and politicians.

column3: Coronavirus has been found in crab legs.
column8: The meme actually comes from a bogus news-generating app. Crab legs are safe, health experts confirm.

column3: North Korean president has ordered to shoot the first Coronavirus pateint in his country.
column8: There is no credible media report which claims that Notrth korea has ordered to shoot its first coronavirus patient.

column3: The Ministry for Economic Development has summoned Italians to avoid sharing videos on Whatsapp, due to overcharging issues given by working from home during Covid-19 emergency.
column8: There is no evidence of such a statement from the Italian authorities.

column3: Italy has surrendered to the Coronavirus pandemic as all the measures to control COVID-19 have been exhausted.
column8: The Prime Minister of Italy Giuseppe Conte in his recent statement said "We are giving up the most expensive habits, we do it because we love Italy, but we do not give up courage and hope in the future. United, we will do it". He did not talk about surrendering.

column3: Amitabh Bachchan gave 500 million rupees to the Mumbai government to fight the coronavirus.
column8: A part of an old video of Amitabh Bachchan and Narendra Modi is being viral with false claim. Amitabh has not given a check of Rs. 500 crores to Bombay Municipal Corporation nor to Government of Maharashtra. He has not even met Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi recently.

column3: Indian Army has constructed an advanced hospital with a capacity of 1,000 beds in Barmer, Rajasthan, to cope up with COVID-19.
column8: The images viral on social media claiming that the Indian Army has constructed an advanced hospital with the capacity of 1,000 beds in Barmer, Rajasthan, to cope up with COVID-19 are old and unrelated.

column3: A Matt Damon movie trailer that predicts coronavirus pandemy
column8: A video of the trailer for the movie Contagion starring Matt Damon in 2011 is being used to say that it is a brand-new movie produced in 2019 that predicted the crisis of the coronavirus epidemic.

column3: Hot tubes can help to prevent the coronavirus.
column8: Using WHO recommendations, we warn that the best way to prevent is hand washing and we warn of the risk of burns from extremely hot baths.
column9: asked by our community and web publications

column3: Indian State of Kerala’s Opposition leader writes to Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan to adopt methods to save only those with stronger immunity from COVID19 infection.
column8: FactCrescendo obtained the letter's copy, the opposition leader has suggested only mitigation measures to be adopted by the state to stop the spread of CoronaVirus. The Facebook user has misinterpreted the term 'mitigation methods' and built a false narrative around it. The opposition leader's office has comdemned the post saying no politician occupying the post of the leader of the opposition would suggest such drastic measures.

column3: Indian prime minister Modi announced internet ban due to the spead of misinformation regarding COVID19
column8: Fact Crescendo upon investigation found the viral claim to be False as the viral image is digitally edited from ABP News Hindi bulletin aired on 24 March 2020 when PM Narendra Modi had announced a nationwide 21 days lockdown due to the outbreak of COVID-19.

column3: Video post showing that conflict between villagers and police in India as COVID19 suspected corpse was carried to the cemetery.
column8: This particular village had such kind of conflicts in the past three years for carrying pass a corpse through the village lane,local police cheif has confirmed that the death has nothing to do with COVID19.

column3: Claim that Saint Corona has always been a patron saint against epidemics.
column8: Saint Corona was never specifically worshiped as the patron saint against epidemics before March 2020.
column9: a dutch pastor, after which dutch mainstream media copied the claim.

column3: A herd of Deer reclaimed the Ooty-Coimbatore road.
column8: The viral image is from Japan's Nara, taken in 2014. It has no connection with India or lockdown.

column3: In the 30-sec viral video, a man lifts his shirt and challenges police officer who is pointing gun at him. Another police officer kicks the man from behind, pins down him on the road and makes arrest. The text overlaid on the video reads “Italy says lockdown they mean it”.
column8: Upon investigation, we found out that the video is from Brazil and it has nothing to do with lockdown or coronavirus. The man was drunk and was scaring people with knife in hand. The police of Sao Paulo has to use force to make the arrest.

column3: Donald Trump attending the recital of Quran verses to fight coronavirus.
column8: The video is from 2017, when Trump along with his wife Melania attended the inaugural prayer service after taking oath as the 45th President of the United States. Imam Mohammad Majid, executive director of the All Dulles Area Muslim Society recited verses from the Quran.

column3: A photo with a message of a doctor crying saying that the coronavirus is stronger than science.
column8: A photo of Pep Guardiola, Manchester City football team trainer, is being related to a message saying he is the head of the Madrid Hospital Department, Felipe Monterroso crying inconsolably and saying that the coronavirus "is stronger than science, but not stronger than God".

column3: Hospitals don’t allow parents to visit children with COVID-19 in the hospital.
column8: Hospital policies have become generally more restrictive, but pediatric patients are still allowed visits by at least one parent.

column3: This chart shows the current cases in Turkey.
column8: The chart shows the quarantined people coming from abroad.

column3: The outbreak was discussed in the German Bundestag back to 2012.
column8: The report discussed in the Bundestag was about a possible outbreak and how Germany can be prepared. The possible coronavirus outbreak was also foreseen by scientists.

column3: Putin sent lions into streets to discourage people from going out.
column8: The photo dates back to 2016 and taken in Johannesburg during a movie shooting.

column3: Portuguese government has spent much more than the acceptable price for ventilators.
column8: It´s false that the Portuguese government has spent much more than would be acceptable buying the ventilators. The prices are aligned with market prices.

column3: Supposed quote from the Argentinian president alerting that goverment aid was going to be removed from those who violeted the quarantine.
column8: The quote is fake and the disinformation was created by a joke generator website.

column3: Putin enter a meeting with his ministries wearing the full yellow suit used by quarantine doctors to protect themselves against catching COVID19.
column8: The original photo is from Putin's visit to a quarantined hospital where COVID-19 patient are treated not from a meeting with his ministries.

column3: The coronavirus did not reach the Chinese cities of Beijing and Shanghai, as well as Russia and North Korea.
column8: The virus spread to Beijing and Shanghai in January, Russia had its first cases in February, while North Korea's claim of being coronavirus-free is largely contested.

column3: Dead bodies of coronavirus patients are being discarded now in mass graves in Italy, according to a 23-second video clip that has gone viral on social media.
column8: The video clip was from the US miniseries Pandemic released in 2007.

column3: Video shows bodies on the streets saying that this is the current situation in Italy.
column8: The scenes in the video is from the 2007 movie Pandemic, which talks about the spread of birdflu in Los Angeles.

column3: An image has been shared hundreds of times in multiple posts on Facebook alongside a claim it shows a poster issued by activist group Extinction Rebellion that states “Corona is the cure, humans are the disease”.
column8: The claim is false; Extinction Rebellion said that the image was published by an unaffiliated Twitter account and that the poster’s message in “no way” represents the global environmental movement’s “principles and values”.

column3: Numerous conspiracy theories shared on and off social media claim that 5G mobile networks are the cause of the novel coronavirus pandemic.
column8: This is false; experts told AFP that 5G is based on radio frequency and that this does not create viruses.

column3: The viral video claims mass graves are in Italy.
column8: The viral video is part of a TV series called Pandemic. The viral scene is not from Italy.

column3: There are 59 positive Coronavirus cases in Nagpur along with 3 doctors one of whom is on ventilator.
column8: There are 5 coronavirus cases in Nagpur as of March 26. None of them is a doctor.

column3: Prince Charles infected with coronavirus after meeting Indian singer Kanika Kapoor.
column8: Viral pictures of Kanika Kapoor meeting Prince Charles are old.

column3: A letter supposedly written by Bill Gates where he says that the coronavirus is the corrector of humanity.
column8: The letter supposedly written by Bill Gates in which he says that the coronavirus has a "spiritual purpose", that it is "the great corrector" and that "it is here to teach us some lessons that it seems we have forgotten". There is no evidence that Bill Gates is the author of this letter: he has not said anything similar in the latest public statements and the people who claim this provide no evidence of it.

column3: No, Vladimir Putin did not drop lions in the streets to force the Russians to stay at home.
column8: A picture of a lion in the street went vira, but the animal has nothing to do with coronavirus or Russia.

column3: Are Decathlon’s snorkeling masks used in hospitals to help patients breathing?
column8: The idea came from Italy where a doctor contacted a 3D printer and the sports brand to adapt masks to the respirators. The company shared the 3D plans of her masks, but remains very cautious about the outcome of such an innovation.

column3: No, these photos of patients and medical beds on the street do not show the situation of Italian hospitals.
column8: These viral photos of medical beds and patients on the streets do not show Italy suffering from coronavirus, but Croatia, after the earthquake on March 22.

column3: Why you should not take seriously this card on the efficacy of chloroquine.
column8: Datas of the card are not accurate. Some are obsolete for days and some for years.

column3: A message from the CHU in Mans (hospital in France) presenting alarmist arguments to encourage French people to stay home.
column8: CHU Le Mans denied having written such a message. Arguments in the message are false or unfounded.

column3: Pictures of people stranded on hospital beds claimed to be Italy not coping with the pressure of COVID-19 cases and that India should learn from Italy’s mistakes and not step out of the house in the 21 days lockdown
column8: The images were from the earthquake that hit Croatia on March 22, 2020 and were falsely shared as Italy.

column3: A picture claiming that an Italian man committed suicide after his whole family succumbed to COVID-19
column8: The image is of a woman committing suicide in Spain in December 2019. BOOM could not establish what drove the woman to take such a step.

column3: Reliance Jio, one of the biggest telecom networks in India is providing Internet for free during COVID-19
column8: A spokesperson from the company denied any such schemes and the link in the messages were linked to scamming websites.

column3: Videos showing police detaining COVID-19 patients in India
column8: These were mock drills that were conducted by the UP Police to determine the preparedness of the public with regards to COVID-19.

column3: An image with human body figurines in a bowl that claims China is serving human baby soup in its restaurants.
column8: The image is of an art installation to raise awareness about the rampant killing of sharks.

column3: An image with human body figurines in a bowl that claims China is serving human baby soup in its restaurants.
column8: The image is of an art installation to raise awareness about the rampant killing of sharks.

column3: A herd of deer shared as them flocking out in Tamil Nadu, India due to the lockdown of the Coronavirus
column8: The image is originally from Japan and was taken in 2014. It shows the Nara deers that are considered to be auspicious flanking the streets of Nara.

column3: A 48 year-old man, unemployed due to the COVID-19 crisis, attempted suicide in São Paulo.
column8: São Paulo state officers reported that no such case occured. Photo was from 2017.

column3: Augusto Heleno, Brazilian general, was cured from COVID-19 infection using chloroquine.
column8: Augusto Heleno denied he had taken chloroquine for his COVID-19. He tested positive last week, but returned to work only seven days later.

column3: There is no space in the hospitals in Italy because of which people are crowding outside.
column8: The claim with the pictures is false. While these photos are both real and recent, they are actually from Croatia’s capital Zagreb, which was rocked by a powerful earthquake on 22 March.

column3: An Indian politician claimed that the strain of coronavirus in India is less virulent mutation.
column8: Experts and doctors have denied this claim and said that there is no such study which corroborates the information provided by the politician in his tweet.

column3: An audio that says that MMS or sodium chlorite cures the coronavirus in 24 hours.
column8: An audio by Isidro Fuentes García, alleged biologist, and a video by Josep Pamiès, fined by the Generalitat of Cataluña for promoting pseudotherapies to cure diseases, is going viral. In it he advises the MMS or sodium chlorite as a solution in 24 hours against the coronavirus. There is no evidence that works against COVID-19.

column3: Viral WhatsApp audio message claims President Buhari and his Chief of Staff flew out of the country for coronavirus treatment.
column8: Credible sources from the presidency clarify that Abba Kyari who tested positive for COVID-19 is in Lagos for treatment. As regarding the President, no credible reports suggest he is infected with the novel coronavirus.

column3: Video post claiming that inhaling traditional appetizer salt with limestone can cure COVID-19 infection.
column8: Currently there is no medicine/Vaccine to cure or prevent COVID19 as per WHO, also Dr. Myo Thant-deputy director general of Yangon region’ public confirms the mentioned claims on COVID-19 cure to be false.

column3: Image of mother unable to feed her suckling as she battles COVID-19.
column8: The image is of a 35 year old woman comforting her daughter at the Fred Hutchinson Cancer Center in Seattle, Washington.

column3: Image of COVID19 infected Indonesian doctor Hadio Ali watching his daughters from a distance as he bids them final goodbye, the image is said to be posted by his wife.
column8: The Image posted is of a Malaysian doctor posted by one of his relatives, and the doctor is alive and healthy.

column3: Italian President said that Italy has surrendered to the Coronavirus.
column8: Neither the Italian Prime Minister nor President have stated that Italy has surrendered to the virus. We even crosschecked with Italian fact checkers.

column3: An image poster stating Indian religious leader Mata Amritanandamayi has hidden foreigners in her hermitage and not allowed them to be tested.
column8: FactCrescendo contacted the relevent officials who have dismissed the allegations calling it a motivated campaign against the Hermitage.

column3: Images of the medical facility shared with the claim that the Indian Army set up a 1000-bed hospital in Rajasthan amidst Coronavirus Pandemic.
column8: Upon investigation, we found out that all the images were old and two of them were not even from India. One is from the US and another is from Germany. Even the Indian Army clarified on Twitter that such claims are baseless.

column3: Demon creature flying above a Church in Italy.
column8: This is an old video created digitally using VFX created by an Animation studios.

column3: In Sri Lanka, Sathosa Supermarket trucks bearing the image of former PM Mahinda Rajapaksa being used to distribute food during current COVID-19 curfew. And text condemning the act by mentioning how ethical is it to carry out such acts during this difficult times and gain political advantange.
column8: 2014 Images of Sathosa Lorries with PM Mahinda Rajapaksha portrayed as recent vehicles used to distribute food during curfew. Newspaper which carried original image published a disclaimer.

column3: An audio clip is circulating on Whatsapp claiming that Nagpur (Second Capital of Indian state Maharashtra) has tested 59 positive coronavirus cases including 3 doctors.
column8: We found that there are only 4 positive coronavirus cases in Nagpur. The district administration and Nagpur Municipal Corporation have denied such rumors. Divisional Commissioner of Nagpur said the administration would take stern action against such rumor mongers. We also spoke with Deputy Commissioner who informed the same.

column3: A post with a photo claiming that an Italian mother, suffering from COVID-19, hugs her baby
column8: The viral image is an old image, The mother is suffering from cancer and was clicked post her radiotherapy when she could not hug her child.

column3: Photo posts claiming a person committing suicide by jumping from a building in Italy, Doctor couple in a Italian hospital few hours before their death and chaos in an Italian hospital amid COVID19
column8: The first image is from Spain where a woman commited suicide in December 2019, The second image is of a couple at the Barcelona airport and the third image is from recent earthquake in Croatia.

column3: Chinese Government Accuses Indonesia of Spreading Corona COVID-19 Virus
column8: In its official statement, the Shaanxi Health Commission, China, only announced that there was one case of COVID-19 in its territory which was an import from Indonesia. No sentence was found from the Shaanxi government accusing Indonesia of spreading the Corona virus in the statement.

column3: Doctor Li Wenliang and Hospital in China Suggest Drinking Tea for Corona Patients
column8: There is no evidence to suggest that doctor Li Wenliang examined the effects of chemicals in tea, such as methylxanthine, on Corona patients. Li Wenliang was an ophthalmologist, not a virus expert. In addition, an article from Zhejiang CDC that claims that drinking tea can help prevent COVID-19 has been removed.

column3: Dr. Li Wenliang recommends tea for treatment. Doctors in Wuhan cure COVID-19 with tea.
column8: The doctor in question was an optometrist. Did not recommend a remedy for COVID-19. No scientific evidence shows tea can cure COVID-19.

column3: Netflix and Amazon are offering free subscription amid the coronavirus outbreak.
column8: Contrary to the claims, the website does not belong to Netflix. The streaming platform is available only on netflix.com. The tab thumbnail, however, is identical to the genuine site and bears the red ‘N’ symbol.

column3: A WhatsApp forward is doing the rounds in groups and is attributed to CNN. claiming Dr. ‘Li Wenliang’ who was the whistleblower of the Chinese government’s propaganda about COVID-19, has documented a research report. According to this report, chemicals like ‘Methylxanthine, Theobromine and Theophylline’ stimulate compounds that can ward off this virus in a human body with at least an averagely performing immune system.
column8: WHO has mentioned that to date, there is no vaccine or treatment to prevent or cure COVID-19. Also, the Chinese doctor Li Wenliang did not mention any medication or vaccination to cure COVID-19 in his findings.
