column3: Prince Charles tested positive for COVID-19 after meeting Bollywood singer Kanika Kapoor.
column8: The viral picture is old and was taken in 2015, during a charity event by UK royalty Prince Charles and Camilla; hence it is proved that the viral claim is ‘Misleading.’

column3: Finally India got its Coronavirus Dashboard. This is the official website for CORONA updates. This website is being updated every 4 hrs. You can scroll down for more details, you can know more about coronavirus outbreak in your state by placing your finger on your state on the map.
column8: The said website is not official and the tweet made by Bollywood superstar is misleading.

column3: Indian Government Has Issued A Guideline To Monitor Citizens Activity, their call and social media handles will be under surveillance.
column8: A Twitter user has shared the same claim on November 24, 2017. The viral forward is ‘Fake’ and the Indian government has not issued any guidelines to monitor the activities of its citizens on various social media and messaging platforms.

column3: France has canceled fees for electricity, gas, water and rent.
column8: The person even doesn't mention the source. Just says that France will cancel all these fees, whih is not true. It will be implemented only for certain categories of businesses.

column3: The WHO has decreed the “suspension of any and all medical activities”
column8: It is a false headline, accompanied by a text explaining that it is the Portuguese Government that has taken this measure in relation to dentistry and stomatology.

column3: Puerta de Hierro hospital in Madrid uses a whole floor for the president’s family.
column8: The hospital denied it.

column3: A councilor for Podemos in the Canary Islands tweeted that there are “useless elderly dead” that “are left over on the street”.
column8: That person is not a member of the political party and the Political party in the Canary Islands denied on its twitter account.

column3: First death from coronavirus in Barranquilla, Columbia.
column8: The death has not been confirmed.

column3: A false image and statement from the Prime Minister of Italy.
column8: The person who appears in the image is Brazilian president Jair Bolsonaro, not the prime minister of Italy.

column3: A vaccine for coronavirus has been found.
column8: Is not a vaccine, is a test of antibodies.

column3: The application of menthol ointment in the nostrils helps to prevent the virus
column8: There's no evidence that menthol ointment could prevent the contagion with coronavirus, according the physicians consulted and information spread by WHO and FDA on the prevention of COVID-19.

column3: WhatsApp chain from workers of Argentina´s most important lab that is testing for coronavirus. They advised not to leave the house because the next 2 weeks were the infection peak.
column8: The lab workers denied the message came from them. Many of the claims included in the chain were denied by specialists.

column3: A message sent by WhatsApp states that the Ministry of Defense of China has announced that it has ‘successfully’ developed a vaccine against the new coronavirus, which causes Covid-19 disease. Portugal would receive the first doses in a few days.
column8: It is a fraudulent message that is being sent on behalf of the National Health Service, full of false information, especially regarding vaccines that are due to arrive in Portugal

column3: The Italians accept Islam en masse.
column8: In fact, the video used in the fake was taken during a protest in Germany, in the center of Hamburg, held on January 11, 2020. The action was aimed at the oppression of the Muslim Uighur minority in China.

column3: The brasilian singer Preta Gile was infected with Covid-19 and performed to more than 320 thousand people.
column8: When the singer performed to 320 thousand people, on March 1, she was not infected with the new coronavirus. She started feeling ill on March 11 and tested positive on March 13. Since then, she has been in quarantine.

column3: Several photographs published on Facebook claim to portray coffins with victims of the new coronavirus in Italy.
column8: The pictures were taken in april 2009, after an earthquake in L’Aquila, that killed 308 people.

column3: A message in an image claims that drinking coffee can help to prevent the new coronavirus.
column8: There is no scientific evidence to support this theory. Health authorities have never made this connection an it.

column3: Over 200 doctors in Italy die every day due to coronavirus.
column8: The total number of doctors in Italy who died due to the coronavirus is 66 as of Thursday, April 2.

column3: italian people in the streets surerendering and farewelling the world after COVID19.
column8: The original video is from an Italian protest against the far-right on Nov 18 2019.

column3: A photo of a fleet of blue lorries bearing the image of Sri Lankan Prime Minister Mahinda Rajapaksa has been shared repeatedly on Facebook and Twitter alongside a claim that the lorries were distributing food during the novel coronavirus curfew
column8: The claim is misleading; the photo in fact shows lorries that were used in a political initiative in 2014, more than five years before the coronavirus pandemic. Rajapaksa’s office also denied the claim, saying that authorities are pursuing legal action against those spreading the “false information”.

column3: Images of patients treated in the open are from Italy as it has run out of hospital beds.
column8: The images are from Croatia after it was hit by an earthquake on March 22.

column3: While coronavirus tests in other countries are conducted for free or at nominal charges, in India, it costs Rs 4,500
column8: In India, coronavirus tests are free in government labs. Private labs charge more in India, as well as in other countries .

column3: Thanks to the halt imposed by the government to travel boats for Covid-19, a crocodile has shown up in Venice’s canals.
column8: The picture has been manipulated. There has never been a crocodile swimming in Venice.

column3: The government has mandated by decree a salary cut for high public officials.
column8: The government has never approved such a measure.

column3: This news bullettin from 2015 proves that Covid-19 was created in a laboratory of Wuhan.
column8: The news bullettin from 2015 was reporting on an experiment regarding a coronavirus created in a laboratory. However, this virus has nothing to do with COVID-19.

column3: You can get coronavirus from makeup and creams.
column8: No proofs about it in the new WHO Q&A.

column3: Did an American die because he self-administered chloroquine ?
column8: In Arizona a man died after ingesting chloroquine phosphate on self-medication. He had the idea after listening to a speech by Donald Trump about chloroquine efficiency against COVID-19.

column3: The internet can crash because of a lockdown.
column8: Experts and internet companies assure that the network can handle an increasing traffic. However, extending the lockdown as well as closing the borders could make it more difficult to maintain and to repair the network.

column3: Mosquitoes can spread the coronavirus?
column8: The World Health Organization (WHO) and the French Ministry of Health have been very clear : no, the mosquito does not transmit the coronavirus.

column3: After dealing with 134 patients, an Italien doctor couple took off their masks and stared at each other from the bottom of their hearts. Both of them died later.
column8: The photo is a couple kissing at Barcelona airport on March 12.

column3: A video circulating on WhatsApp on a COVID-19 patient escaping from an hospital in Costa Rica.
column8: The patient didn't have COVID-19 and didn't escape.

column3: A publication claiming the city of San José in Costa Rica has created mass graves for COVID-19 victims.
column8: Authorities denied such a construction work.

column3: Indian Government snooping messages over social media and all social media platforms wll be monitored for COVID-19 messages
column8: The message mentions a fake ministry of internal regulation that does not exist in the country.

column3: A Pakistani doctor, Dr Osama Riaz’s last message for you (while taking his last breath).
column8: The video is not of the Pakistani doctor who died but of another doctor from the UK who tested positive and is going to be discharged soon.

column3: Last Photo of Indonesian doctor,Hadio Ali standing away from his family before he passed away due to COVID-19
column8: The picture is of a Malaysian doctor not infected by COVID-19 but who is treating COVID-19 patients in Malaysia and this was him before he left for duty.

column3: Says to leave objects in the sun to avoid contracting the coronavirus.
column8: There’s no evidence that sunlight can kill the coronavirus. Experts say ultraviolet light in the sun isn’t strong enough.

column3: Streaming apps Netflix and Amazon Prime give free subscriptions during COVID-19 outbreak in India
column8: The websites were phising and spamming websites while the streaming apps have not declared any such free plans. A parody account portraying to be Indian news wire agency, ANI shared the sites stating free plans till April 31 while April has only 30 days.

column3: Indian Army has built 1000 Bed quarantine facility for COVID-19
column8: The Indian army called out this claim to be false and BOOM also found that all the three images were unrelated to each other.

column3: An image of a couple who are claimed to be doctors and have lost their lives due to Coronavirus
column8: The picture is an AFP picture of a couple at the Barcelona airport after US President Donald Trump informed that USA was banning travel from the EU.

column3: WHO is offering monetary help to buy medicines and food during the emergency.
column8: It's not true that WHO is offering monetary help. It's a technical institution, said representatives contacted for this verification.

column3: Chlorine dioxide cures the coronavirus.
column8: Its consumption is dangerous and it is an illegal medicine in Spain.

column3: Prime Minister of Mexico with tears in his eyes says to all the people: We have lost the battle against the coronavirus.
column8: The Italian government has not made such a statement. In addition, the person who appears in the photograph is a representative from another country.

column3: Uber suspends night services in Kenya.
column8: Uber has responded to the post online saying that its services were still available to users after 7pm in Kenya, and had not been suspended as claimed.

column3: Compounds in tea can help to cure COVID-19.
column8: Methylxanthine, theobromine and theophylline, which are found in tea, are good for health and airway management, but cannot cure COVID-19.

column3: A treatment for COVID-19 to be manufactured in Uganda.
column8: The treatment is actually conventional sanitizer, and will be produced by a company already producing hand and surface sanitizer.

column3: A picture showing dead Italian doctors in an operating theater after succumbing to COVID-19.
column8: The picture showing doctors on the floor of an operating room is actually from an episode of Grey's Anatomy.

column3: Nairobi Governor Mike Sonko has donated 58 million shillings for COVID-19 response.
column8: The governor has not made any such donation, and the County Government has also stated that the claim is false.

column3: Coronavirus remains on the asphalt for 9 days.
column8: There is no scientific evidence to show that the coronavirus remains on the floor for 9 days.

column3: Cigarette smoke spreads coronavirus.
column8: There is no scientific evidence that proves the cigarette smoke can spread coronavirus.

column3: A new outbreak pandemy of hantavirus coming from China.
column8: Hantavirus is not a new virus, and is not transmitted from person to person. In Europe it usually causes a disease that has less than 0.5% case fatality.

column3: Purchases of health products and health councils are taking advantage of the “hook” of the COVID-19 disease to sell online cures that are not endorsed by any official organization.
column8: A recopilation of "miracle" products that are being announced in social media to cure COVID-19 and are not aprobbed by any medical or gubernamental institutions. Most of them are scams.

column3: An audio that states that the worst coronavirus crisis in Spain will start on Sunday March 29.
column8: We consulted experts to find out if the audio was real, although there were versions with different dates. Doctors say it is impossible to know when there will be a peak and they are confident in current containment measures.

column3: A publication on Facebook assures that it is confirmed that “the [Spanish] President and the 3 Vice Presidents are ill with COVID-19 and assures that the King must close the Parliament, dissolve the Cortes and take political and military control of the country.
column8: The only Spanish vice president who has tested positive for COVID-19 is Nadia Calviño and the Constitution does not grant the King the power to dissolve the Spanish government in the face of this catastrophe.

column3: Countries that use nivaquine (chloroquine) against malaria are not affected by coronavirus.
column8: Nivaquine is prescribed in other countries, including France where there is coronavirus, and COVID-19 affects many more states than those indicated on the maps.

column3: In France, the state pays 46 billions a year for its army, but only 1 billion for its inhabitants’ health.
column8: It's the opposite : the state spends much more on health than on its army.

column3: COVID-19 can be read on a tank car picture taken in 2019.
column8: Field Guide for Tank Cars does not let the arbitrary titling. The owner of the cars also denied.

column3: CDC announces SARS-CoV-2 can survive on surfaces up to 17 days.
column8: The report on CDC's website was not about the survival period of SARS-CoV-2. Researhers wrote they found RNA traces of the virus, not infectious viral load.

column3: Turkey map on Wikipedia shows the provinces in which COVID-19 cases are diagnosed.
column8: Metadata of the map shows that the data collected from unverified local media news. Turkey does not announce the cases by provinces so far.

column3: Video shows Italians drinking chrism all together against the outbreak.
column8: The video is recorded in Romania not in Italy. It can be detected the flag and the statue in the video.

column3: Video shows Turkish citizens leave food packets on the road for the poor during the outbreak.
column8: The video recorded on 25th of Jan, 2020 and the aid for the earthquake victims in Elazığ. There was no cases in Turkey in that time.

column3: Spanish doctor says they give the ventilators to younger people.
column8: The man in the video is not a doctor. Triage in Spain is not just based on age but the probability of survival.

column3: Viral WhatsApp message claims Netflix is ​giving free passes to their platform during this period of isolation.
column8: It is customary for a streaming service such as Netflix to give a free trial of 30 days, after which the subscriber is billed. The streaming giant, however, is not hosting any such bonanza. More so, the service is planning to actually reduce video quality owing to the internet spike in a bid to prevent downtime. It hence would be counterproductive to open the service to a host of more users. Also, the site in question was flagged by a security module as a “deceptive site”.

column3: Image of police punishing people in Indian state of Assam for violating the curfew.
column8: While there are reports which suggest that the police is taking action against people in India for violating the orders, this picture is from Pakistan and not Assam.

column3: Pakistan’s leading scholar Mufti Naeem suffers from coronavirus. A few days ago, he refused to close madrasas and mosques.
column8: According to Pakistani media outlets Mufti Naeem was admitted to the hospital due to heart disease.

column3: Indian Singer Kanika Kapoor met Prince Charles after which he tested positive for coronavirus.
column8: Contrary to the claim, the viral image is not recent but from 2015, when the singer attended the Elephant Family charity ‘Travels to my Elephants’, hosted by Prince Charles and Camilla, Duchess of Cornwall.

column3: Italian doctor couple disgnosed with coronavirus.
column8: The couple was spotted and clicked by an Associated Press (AP) photographer Emilio Morenatti nearly two weeks ago.

column3: An open letter from Bill Gates: the Microsoft founder believes there is a spiritual purpose behind the disease.
column8: Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation has denied publishing that letter. The sun, the media which ran a story about the story of Gates'' letter, had removed the story and apologized for the incident.

column3: A US railroad has carried the “COVID-19”
column8: The image was manipulated.

column3: The University of Barcelona will approve its students if classes are suspended for more than a month.
column8: The image shared was a screenshot of the university official webpage that was manipulated.

column3: “Food contribution” campaign using the UN logo.
column8: The UN has denied this information through its headquarters in Colombia.

column3: President of the National Assembly of Serbia Maja Gojkovic claimed that according to the Constitution, Parliament cannot session during the State of emergency.
column8: According to the Serbian Constitution, during the state of emergency, the National Assembly shall convene without any special call for assembly and it may not be dismissed.
column9: official webiste of the rulling party

column3: Photo of people in medical scrubs lying on the floor of an operating theatre shows some of the 200 Italian doctors who died of Covid-19 in one day (23 March 2020).
column8: Photo is a still from an episode of US TV drama, Grey's Anatomy. And there is no evidence to show that 200 Italian doctors died on 23 March 2020.

column3: The vaccine against Covid-19 is finally ready.
column8: There is no vaccine against COVID-19 at this point in time.

column3: Malaysia Dismiss Residents Outside the Home with Drones that Shoot Fireworks
column8: The events in the video are part of the action carried out by a Brazilian influencer, Lucas Albert. The video was uploaded on Instagram on July 14, 2019, before the Corona COVID-19 virus was first reported in Wuhan, China, in December 2019. Even in the original video, there was no Malay-speaking male voice asking people to disperse.

column3: Photo of Italian PM Giuseppe Conte who cried for regretting the late lockdown
column8: The photo is a photo of Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro who gave a speech during an evangelical service at the Planalto Palace on December 17, 2019.

column3: The UN is providing food aid to South American countries due to the coronavirus pandemic.
column8: The UN office at Colombia has warned that a WhatsApp hoax claiming the UN would be providing food aid is false. A version of the same hoax was debunked by the UN office at Paraguay.

column3: China got prepared to contain the virus and let the whole population got infected.
column8: An audio claimed that China’s strategy was to infect the whole population with COVID19. However, one of China’s main measures was to keep quarantined almost half of its population, according to New York Times estimates, in order to control and stop the spread of infections. The WHO praised the measure.

column3: Paraguay’s Ministry of Health is not following up people who are related to confirmed cases of coronavirus.
column8: An audio claimed that the Ministry of Health does not follow up people who have been related to confirmed cases of coronavirus. The Ministry does have a public plan that lays out that they have to keep a eye on those people. The plan states that their records should be kept and that they should be monitored. If a person show symptoms, they must be tested. If not, he has to remain quarantined.

column3: Ireland is in the first phase of a lockdown sequence.
column8: Ireland has introduced measures to restrict the spread of COVID-19 but it is not a lockdown and there is no evidence to suggest that the government is considering a lockdown. The Irish PM has said that Ireland is following the South Korea model of social distancing, social isoloation and contact tracing, and this does not include the locking down of the country.

column3: In March 25, French scientists succesfully tested a vaccine against COVID-19.
column8: Although the title said vaccines, the story was about a French research (published on March 17) on hydroxychloroquine, which is not a vaccine.

column3: Health authorities recommend shaving your beard during the COVID-19 crisis.
column8: Only people who need to use respirators should shave. That's because the beard can alter the positioning of the mask, which allows air to reach the mouth and the nose directly (thus, making the respirator itself useless)

column3: A publication by Pearls news says 15 Nigerian senators has been tested positive for COVID-19.
column8: No Nigerian senator has tested positive for coronavirus, not according to the NCDC or any credible news platform. The Nigerian Centre for Disease Control remains the number one source on all updates to confirmed COVID-19 cases in the country.

column3: A blog site claimed Kogi State Governor in Nigeria, Yahaya Bello, tested positive with COVID-19.
column8: There are no reports by the Nigerian Centre for Disease Control to corroborate the claim. Not to mention, Yahaya Bello, himself released a video debunking the claim. Moreover, the report format lacks credibility with no discernable details or source present.

column3: Image of TV reporter in hazmat suit is proof media is ‘fabricating’ panic.
column8: Reporter was using hazmat suit to illustrate a report about local production of suits.

column3: 232 children died from COVID-19 in Italy in just one day.
column8: Italian Ministry of Health didn't report any cases of deaths of people under 30 years old.

column3: An alarming text message signed “Claire Magne, a friend, nurse”.
column8: Hospitals of Montpellier and Toulouse denied this alarmist message.

column3: In Costa Rica, dead bodies are not returned to their families.
column8: There are procedures in place, but the bodies are returned.

column3: In Costa Rica, the Red Cross and Walmart are giving out emergency funds for COVID-19.
column8: It's a scam to steal personal data.

column3: Video shows Malaysian police sanction people who violated lockdown stipulation by hitting them on the foot sole.
column8: The video was filmed in Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan, not a recent shoot in Malasia. The Malaysian government has released a series measure towards the COVIS-19 on March 18. But hitting violater on the foot sole is not part of it.

column3: Gargling with hot water cures Coronavirus says a doctor from Mumbai’s COVID-19 hospital.
column8: Gargling with water does not cure or prevent coronavirus, and this is not the doctor from the Mumbai hospital but a Tiktok video with a pre-recorded video clip.

column3: A police commissioner from Mumbai has asked essential services to be available at certain hours.
column8: The Mumbai Police did not put out any such notification and all essential services are available in the city.

column3: False that the OMS grants food and medicine vouchers
column8: Neither the World Health Organization (OMS), the United Nations (UN) and the "Government" are giving out vouchers for food or medicine in support of the family economy due to the COVID-19 pandemic, as messages that share on social networks.

column3: Says that under order from Gov. Tony Evers, he and his eight children can’t legally have dinner together anymore.
column8: The key here is what Stroebel’s tweet didn’t say – that five of the children he referenced were adults living on their own. Evers’ order does indeed ban gatherings of immediate family members in different households.

column3: Says Nancy Pelosi’s coronavirus bill includes “tax credits for solar and wind energy … retirement plans for community newspaper employees … $300 million for PBS … climate change studies” and more.
column8: The House version of a coronavirus relief bill does include several requirements for airline companies that take federal assistance from the bill. The House bill also includes provisions related to community newspaper pension plans and a $300 million funding boost for the Corporation for Public Broadcasting.

column3: Gargling with warm water and salt or vinegar eliminates the virus [SARS-CoV-2].
column8: There is no evidence to suggest that gargling salt water or vinegar, or partaking in many other home remedies, fight SARS-CoV-2 infection. Upon entering the body, the virus attaches to and enters cells in the airway where it takes over the cells’ machinery, producing more viral particles that spread to other cells. Because the virus hides out in the body’s own cells, it can not be targeted without also killing healthy, uninfected cells. Therefore, fighting viral infections relies on the body’s immune response.

column3: [SARS-CoV-2] is spreading quickly from gas pumps. Shopping carts as well.
column8: People may become infected by the SARS-CoV-2 virus, which causes COVID-19, when they touch contaminated surfaces and transfer the virus to their eyes, nose, or mouth. However, it is not known how often this is likely to occur and there is no evidence that it is spreading quickly in this manner. Therefore, proper handwashing and cleaning surfaces with soap or other common disinfectants are effective ways to reduce the risk of contracting the virus from surfaces.

column3: Trump web ad usings misleading edits to create a false picture.
column8: These are actual quotes but in the video they are so truncated and mixed together that overall it leaves a misleading impression.

column3: A post says that, on March 22, 793 people died in Italy and including 232 kids.
column8: In that day, 651 people died in Italy due to the new coronavirus and there were no mention to children. None of the deaths were related to child infections.

column3: A post says that a vaccine for the new coronavirus will be available in a few days.
column8: The image that is shown on the post is a South Korean COVID-19 test from the laboratory Sugentech. There is not a vaccine available on the market yet.

column3: Facebook posts featuring a photo of ventilators in the US state of New York claim the devices are “stuck in a warehouse.”
column8: This is misleading; New York is stockpiling supplies because of the novel coronavirus pandemic, but emergency response staff say those in the photo were sent to hospitals within 24 hours of their receipt.

column3: A new law prohibits “leaving the home” after 3 pm in Spain.
column8: It was not an official document.

column3: On March 22nd Coronavirus ‘contagion rate’ decreased ‘for two consecutive days’.
column8: The numbers of cases of contagion in Spain went from an increase of 16.52% on Friday to an increase of 24.75% on Saturday and 14.6% on Sunday.

column3: Andalusia proposes that students must repeat their classes (not on march 26th).
column8: The image of the headline shared was manipulated from an actual media.

column3: Iceland tested its whole population.
column8: According to health authorities in Iceland, 3.5% of the population has been tested, and not 100% as claimed by the publications on Twitter.
column9: al jazeera on twitter and twitter users

column3: France found a vaccine against coronavirus.
column8: Screenshots show people applausing for medical workers, like every night in Spain and in France, not applausing for a vaccine. The picture of the "vaccine" is in fact a picture of a South Korean test kit. On March 24th, when we wrote this fact check, France had not found any vaccine.

column3: ONU to provide food voucher for coronavirus quarantine.
column8: ONUas already clarified that everything is a fraud.

column3: 23 new COVID-19 cases confirmed in Mombasa.
column8: The cases were not confirmed by Kenya's Ministry of Health.

column3: A photo showing the bodies of Italian COVID-19 victims on a street.
column8: The 2014 photo shows participants in an art project to remember victims of the Nazi Katzbac concentration camp in Frankfurt, Germany.

column3: Pakistani doctor, Usman Riaz speaks about coronavirus before his death.
column8: The man in the video is not Pakistani Dr Riaz but a UK resident named Mubashir Ahmed, who was admitted to a hospital after testing positive for COVID-19.

column3: Purported advisories urging residents to stay indoors while national air force helicopters spray disinfectant over homes to kill off the novel coronavirus, COVID-19, have been circulated online in Sri Lanka and the Philippines.
column8: But the claim is false; both the Sri Lankan and Philippine governments said their air forces were not involved in any such operations.

column3: Globe Telecom is giving every subscriber free mobile load worth P500 as help or donation amid the coronavirus crisis.
column8: In a message sent to Rappler, Globe said the free P500 load to each user is not a legitimate offer from them.

column3: Five person were healed in Morocco with chloroquine.
column8: The website mixed two distinct pieces of information to create this false claim.

column3: Mosques and synagogues are the only holy places to be opened during French confinement.
column8: According to a French legal decree published on March 23rd, mosques, churches and synagogues can be opened but meetings of more than 20 people are forbidden. Besides, authorities from the Jewish communities and from the Muslim communities decided to close some synagogues and mosques.
column9: facebook user in a video ; an extreme-right wing twitter account

column3: This photo shows nurses insulting French president Emmanuel Macron.
column8: The picture has been modified. The original photo was a message to French citizens who didn't respect the lockdown rules.

column3: No, you won’t be charged with a 135 euro fine if you’re driving with several other persons in your car during the lockdown.
column8: Several people are authorized in the same vehicle. It is not prohibited to use your car with passengers to go to the doctor or to the supermarket, for example.

column3: There is no ‘coronavirus’. The Chinese were secretly working on a biological agent that was supposed to make protesters docile and obedient.
column8: The claim that the coronavirus which causes COVID-19 does not exist is based on a work of horror fiction posted on Reddit. COVID-19 has infected individuals in more than 150 countries, most of which have laboratories that have independently confirmed the existence and non-man-made nature of the virus.

column3: The new hantavirus is a new deadly problem emerging in China. There is no cure for it.
column8: Hantavirus is not new. The is no special cure, the disease is treated as any other respiratory disease.

column3: According to a report by the WHO, coronavirus lives the longest in the cabbage layer. In the rest of the place the virus is staying for 9-12 hours, whereas in cabbage, this virus is staying for more than 30 hours. People of all cities are requested not to eat cabbage.
column8: WHO has not mentioned anything about cabbage being dangerous as coronavirus can stay longer on it than any other surface.

column3: The bodies of people infected with coronavirus are lying on the road of Italy. No one is carrying them due to the risk of infection.
column8: The Image is from Germany, where people lay down in a pedestrian zone as part of an art project in remembrance of 528 victims of the Katzbach Nazi concentration camp in Frankfurt.

column3: Coronavirus fear in Germany results in large crowds outside a supermarket. People pushing each other to get into store first to get necessary supplies.
column8: This video was uploaded on 30 Janaury 2011 on youtube. When people in huge number came for shopping at ALDI mall.

column3: Tea can cure coronavirus.
column8: Doctors and experts say that there is no scientific evidence to prove that tea can be used to cure coronavirus.

column3: New vaccine can help cure coronavirus in three hours.
column8: No vaccine has been found yet that can cure coronavirus. Moreover the image which is doing the rounds is that of a diagnosis kit and not vaccine.

column3: Hot water gargle can prevent coronavirus.
column8: Experts and doctors say that there is no evidence to support this claim. Dr Suranjit Chatterjee, Senior Consultant, Indraprastha Apollo Hospitals said that drinking hot water can be beneficial for a sore throat but it generally helps with fighting certain symptoms and is not a medical treatment.

column3: A video has been shared thousands of times in multiple posts on Facebook which claim it shows a woman who was detained by police in Australia after she tested positive for the novel coronavirus, COVID-19, and was filmed spitting at a supermarket in a Sydney suburb.
column8: The claim is misleading; the video has been created from two clips of separate incidents involving different women; police in Australia said the first clip shows a woman who was questioned and released after a disturbance at a store in a Sydney suburb; the Australian supermarket chain cited in the misleading posts said the second clip was not filmed in its stores.

column3: A screenshot of a purported news broadcast showing a lion in the street and reporting that Russia has deployed hundreds of lions to maintain order during the novel coronavirus lockdown has been shared tens of thousands of times on Facebook and Twitter.
column8: The claim is false; the photo used in the image was taken in Johannesburg, South Africa in 2016; Russia has also not announced any major coronavirus lockdown.

column3: Tens of thousands of people who are victims of the coronavirus have died in China, and this is proven by maps of Wuhan released online that show a massive burning of corpses.
column8: The maps are based on unreal data and do not prove that China is massively burning bodies in Wuhan.

column3: Hospitals in Madrid are removing artificial respirators from those admitted with coronaviruses older than 65 years for use by younger patients.
column8: It is not true. And until Tuesday, March 24, Madrid Health department had the capacity to increase ICU income due to coronaviruses with respirators for all.

column3: A purported news report has been shared on multiple Facebook pages which claims that Philippine President Rodrigo Duterte approved the release of P20,000 (USD $400) to all recipients of the Philippines’ Social Security System (SSS) to help them through the novel coronavirus pandemic.
column8: The claim is false; the SSS said the report was “fake news"; the website that published the claim is also not a reputable news source.

column3: A video allegedly showing Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau’s wife in a hospital bed urging people to stay home to avoid ending up seriously ill with the novel coronavirus has been shared thousands of times on Facebook and Twitter.
column8: The woman in the video is not Sophie Trudeau, but a British waitress who has been infected with COVID-19.

column3: “A tank” circulates through the streets of Tudela, Navarre, Spain, to combat COVID-19.
column8: It was an old image taken in another village.

column3: Stopping breath for ten seconds is a way to test if a person has coronavirus.
column8: In a video, a woman showed how to supposedly test if one has coronavirus by holding her breath for ten seconds. WHO expert denied it.

column3: Netflix is providing free access to the platform due to quarantine.
column8: A WhatsApp message with a link stated that the platform would provide free access due to the coronavirus quarantine. As Maldita.es pointed out, it's a hoax.

column3: Picture of Copacabana beach full with sunbathers, even though Rio is in quarantine due to COVID-19 (photo from March 22).
column8: The picture was not from 2020, but from 2009.

column3: Viral WhatsApp message advises against purchasing used clothing as they expose buyers to COVID-19.
column8: While health experts have not ascertained the exact length of time COVID-19 stays active on fabrics, the WHO suggests a low probability of infection via package delivery. This rationale holds as studies show environmental changes and time affect the activeness of COVID-19; all of which are present in shipping clothing from another country. Furthermore, the assertion is not feasible as most countries with index cases have placed forms of travel and trade restriction.

column3: Controversies surrounding chloroquine suggest health authorities approved it as a cure for COVID-19.
column8: Foremost health authorities, WHO, FDA and CDC and the likes have not approved Chloroquine as a treatment for COVID-19.

column3: Says N.Y. Gov. Andrew Cuomo “rejected buying recommended 16,000 ventilators in 2015 for the pandemic, for a pandemic, established death panels and lotteries instead. So, he had a chance to buy, in 2015, 16,000 ventilators at a very low price, and he turned it down.”
column8: A 2015 New York state report said that in the case of a “severe” pandemic, the state would be short about 16,000 ventilators during the peak week. But the report did not recommend buying 16,000 ventilators, and did not indicate whether the state was at a fiscal position to purchase them. The state did not plan to increase its ventilator stockpile because it anticipated that in the event of a severe crisis, there would be shortage of trained staff to operate them and demand would outweigh any emergency stockpile. The report said the state had to balance the likely ventilator shortage with the need for adequate funding for current and ongoing health care expenses.

column3: Wisconsin Gov. Tony Evers is “pushing firearm confiscation orders”.
column8: A Facebook post finding new life amid the coronavirus outbreak says Evers is pushing gun confiscation, but the linked article is from April 2019. At that time, Evers hadn’t proposed any such thing, and the article only details a call for red flag laws from the attorney general. So what was wrong in 2019 is now both wrong and ridiculous.

column3: Indian Army has set-up a 1000 bed quarantine facility in Rajasthan’s Barmer.
column8: The Indian Army clarified that no such facility has been set-up in Rajastahn's Barmer. Also, we found out that the pictures were old and unrelated.

column3: Justin Trudeau’s wife has released a video from hospital bed.
column8: The woman in the video is not Sophie Trudeau but Tara Jane Langston, a 39-year-old who was diagnosed with pneumonia at the Hillingdon Hospital in west London. She recorded this video for her work colleagues and the public, to make them aware about the seriousness of COVID-19.

column3: President of Italy crying because of coronavirus pandemic.
column8: Firstly, the man in the picture, Jair Bolsonaro, is not the President of Italy but that of Brazil. Further, the image is not recent and was taken at the thanksgiving speech at the Palacio do Planalto in December 2019.

column3: The man in the video is a science board member and says gincer and milk are the remedies of COVID-19.
column8: The man in the video is not a member; not even an MD. The advices he gives are not evidence-based.

column3: Hair drier can kill the coronavirusus in your nose, Iranian artist Golshifteh Farahani says.
column8: Golshifteh Farahani denied the allegation. There is no evidence that hairdrier can kill the viruses. It can harm the mucus layer in nose.

column3: Video shows looting in Mexico.
column8: The video dates back to 2017. There is no reported looting in Mexico currently.

column3: China granted the test kits to Turkey in return to Mustafa Kemal’s cholera vaccine aid to China in 1940.
column8: Turkey's help to China in 1938 can be seen in official documents; but the test kits were paid.

column3: CDC said that the coronavirus survived 17 days on the surface of a cruise ship.
column8: CDC found RNA 17 days after but this doesn't mean that the virus survived.

column3: A video of former Iraqi dictator Saddam Hussein has been shared repeatedly on Facebook, Twitter and Instagram alongside a claim it shows him stating the US threatened to spread the novel coronavirus, COVID-19, in Iraq during a meeting in the 1990s.
column8: The claim is false; the video's audio has been doctored; the original Associated Press archive footage does not include any reference to COVID-19.

column3: Photo showing crowd during illegal – due to quarantine -Way of the Cross prayers in Wejherowo.
column8: This image is from 2018.

column3: The french state gives more benefit to people who were unemployed before the COVID-19 than it does for people who are partially unenmployed due to the coronavirus.
column8: The French state helps more people who are partially unenmployed due to the COVID-19.

column3: Washington admits that it is the responsible for COVID19.
column8: Washington didn't admit its responsibility for COVID-19. according to research COVID-19 virus is highly unlikely to be humanly made. The video used in the claim is from the ministry of justice announcement that it was charging a Harvard professor who took funds from China.

column3: A vaccine against coronavirus was developed.
column8: In fact, the photo shows a test to detect antibodies to the virus in the body. This test is used along with others to diagnose coronavirus, not to treat it. The vaccine for COVID-19 has not yet been developed and Donald trump has not announced anything like this.

column3: George Soros is one of the people responsible for the new coronavirus, born in a laboratory.
column8: There is no scientific evidence that the new coronavirus was made in a laboratory. A study published in “Nature” says that the virus came from an animal that infected an human being.

column3: italian mimcks muslim prayers because of fear from COVID19.
column8: The original video is from a muslim protest in front of airports and public squares against Trump decisions to ban 7 muslim countries from entering america in 2017.

column3: Photo shows dozens of wooden coffins of people dead from coronavirus in Italy.
column8: Photo is of the coffins of African migrants who drowned off Italian island in 2013.

column3: South African mayor claimed that Interferon alpha-2b is a vaccine for the new coronavirus.
column8: Interferon alpha-2b has been used to treat some earlier strains of coronavirus, but it’s not a vaccine that would prevent people from getting COVID-19.
column9: mzwandile masina, mayor of the city of ekurhuleni, south africa

column3: You shouldn’t take Ibuprofen because it appears that this drug would enhance and accelerate the effects of Covid-19.
column8: According to EMA (the European Medicine Agency), there is no scientific evidence on this.

column3: Russia has released 500 lions to enforce the quarantine for Covid-19.
column8: There is no evidence that Russia has employed lions to enforce quarantine measures. Also, the picture comes from a South African movie.

column3: An Image is being shared on social media claiming; this italian doctor couple in the picture worked day and night and saved the lives of 134 patients, but on the eighth day, they caught coronavirus and died after an hour.
column8: The couple in the picture is not Italian but a couple from Spain. The photograph was taken at Barcelona Airport on March 12, 2020.

column3: Peeled Onions Can Suck Corona Virus
column8: The chain message is a modification of an old myth that developed in society that is not supported by scientific research.

column3: Videos of Passenger Plane from Italy to Ethiopia which are All Positive Corona
column8: The video is a video of a terrorist hostage-taking at the Blaise Diagne International Airport, Senegal, on November 28, 2019.

column3: Paraguayans should not go out “even to buy bread” because the incubation period is up and positive cases of coronavirus will raise.
column8: A WhatsApp message says that doctors warned people to not got out at all because the incubation period of coronavirus in Paraguay was at bay. The message was also shared in Spain and had no grounds to be true.

column3: Says the CDC now says that the coronavirus can survive on surfaces for up to 17 days.
column8: A CNBC story touted a misleading headline that said the CDC reported that the coronavirus survived on cruise ship cabins for up to 17 days. A recent CDC report found that traces of the virus were found on the ship for that long, not a live sample.

column3: “Donald Trump would receive $17 million for three hotels closed for four days under Republican bill! How in the hell is this right?!”
column8: The Senate-approved bill prohibits Trump family hotels from getting coronavirus aid from a $500 billion fund that would be set up to help businesses that incurred losses from the coronavirus.

column3: Vladimir Putin let lions loose in the streets of Russia to keep them indoors during COVID-19
column8: The image is from Johannesburg, South Africa, where a lion was released for a video shooting.

column3: “People´s scientist” found that coronavirus is a bioweapon mixing Sars and HIV.
column8: This "scientist" has no publications, academic records or any institutional support.

column3: Italy registered 4200 new recovering cases from coronavirus in 24h.
column8: According to the Italian Health ministry's daily reports, Italy recorded 408 new recovering cases on the period mentioned by the publication. Moreover, its most highest number of new recovering cases since the beginning of the outbreak is 1084 cases (not 4200).

column3: Tests results, theft, ban : three false reports about chloroquine
column8: Facebook messages claim that the former French Health Minister Agnès Buzyn chose to forbid chloroquine and that the efficiency of this treatment against COVID-19 was proved. It's incorrect.

column3: Will lockdown cause a shortage of banknotes in ATM ?
column8: Cash withdrawals had increased slightly before the start of lockdown but have declined sharply since. The Bank of France as well as bank union representatives say that ATM are full and that no shortage is to be feared.

column3: Coronavirus has gripped Italy with nobody willing to carry corpses off Italy’s streets.
column8: The photo was taken on March 24, 2014 in Frankfurt, Germany. People lay down on a pedestrian area to remember victims who lost their lives in a Nazi concentration camp.

column3: Italian police are being brutal on people not following lockdowns, India should follow.
column8: The police apprehended a man who was brandishing a gun in Sao Paolo, Brazil.

column3: Says “special military helicopters will spray pesticide against the Corona virus in the skies all over the country.”
column8: There is no evidence the United States military is using helicopters to spray pesticide in an effort to kill the coronavirus.

column3: “Putin has stated: Russian citizens (have) 2 options: Stay home for 15 days or in jail for 5 years.”
column8: Russian President Vladimir Putin has implemented some policies to cancel large gatherings and keep people at home during the coronavirus pandemic. But we could not find any evidence that he has threatened jail time for people who don’t comply.

column3: “Slices of lemon in a cup of hot water can save your life. The hot lemon can kill the proliferation of” the novel coronavirus.
column8: There is no scientific evidence that lemon can treat or prevent the coronavirus. Health officials have debunked the claim. The video comes from a man who promotes alternative health information on YouTube.

column3: Study suggests Malaria drug can treat coronavirus.
column8: Despite Trump stating that chloroquine had been approved for use to treat COVID-19, the FDA released a statement saying it had not approved the drug for use against COVID-19 and is still studying its effectiveness against the disease.

column3: Footage purportedly showing a looting spree in Mexico prompted by panic over the novel coronavirus was aired on multiple Facebook live streams and viewed by tens of thousands of people during the week of March 23, 2020. Posts sharing the streams claimed that the chaotic scene was happening in real-time.
column8: The claim is false; the streams showed old footage from a 2017 looting incident in Mexico that was being played on a loop.

column3: Photographs shared hundreds of times online purport to show the coffins of Italian victims of the novel coronavirus pandemic.
column8: The claim is false; the pictures date back to October 2013 when hundreds drowned in a boat tragedy in the Mediterranean.

column3: The Spanish Government will declare imminently the state of emergency and no one will be able to leave the house and supermarkets wil close.
column8: It is not true. There is no evidence that the Government is planning to enact a state of emergency, only the extension of the alarm state with the current restrictions.

column3: A lengthy text post has been shared hundreds of times on Facebook which purportedly contains advice on how to prevent infection from the novel coronavirus, COVID-19. The post claims the advice was issued by a UK hospital to its medical staff.
column8: The claim is false; the hospital named in the misleading Facebook posts denied issuing the guidelines; the posts also contained several false claims previously debunked by AFP Fact Check.

column3: Vox is going to donate the money they receive for representation in institutions to public health.
column8: The political party denied it.

column3: Netflix gives away free accounts during coronavirus quarantine.
column8: It was phising and the company recomended not to clic on the link that was spreading.

column3: Pablo Iglesias announces that social benefits are suspended for three months.
column8: The image of the headline shared was manipulated from an actual media.

column3: Governmental economic measures will allow “unemployed people to earn 100% of their wage, workers 70% and craftsmen 0%”
column8: In France, unemployed people can receive money from the state, and in general the amount of money represents 72% of the last wage (very few cases can receive 100% or more, there are exceptions). "Workers" is a very vague term. If it means people still working inspite of confinement, it's false: wages will be the same. If it means workers forced to be half unemployed, the government will give them up to 84% of their wage. "Craftsmen" don't have wage, but earn money for themselves. The government said it will help them too, case by case, thanks to a new national grant.

column3: This video, links the Family Bonus Payment established by the Government of Bolivia due to the COVID-19 crisis and electoral campaign proposal of Juntos.
column8: The video announcing the Family Bonus Payment links the political party “Juntos”. Nevertheless, the official page Juntos in facebook denies the creation of this video explaining that they suffered an “cyberattack”.

column3: The video that shows a group of the Bolivian army making the people respect the quarantine and to stay at home by using violence, is not from Punata but from Chimbobo.
column8: The team of Bolivia Verifica, confirms that the images were recorded in Chimboco zone, (municipality of Sacaba – Cochabamba), 55 km away from Punata.
column9: la razón el deber - facebook accounts

column3: Holding your breath can let you test whether you may have COVID-19.
column8: Holding your breath for 10 seconds is not a valid way to test if you may have COVID-19, and the World Health Organization recommends testing by qualified health professionals.

column3: Roche has developed a COVID-19 vaccine.
column8: A video claiming that the pharmaceutical company has developed a vaccine for COVID-19 contains false information.

column3: A photo showing Uganda’s first case of COVID-19.
column8: The photo of a man wearing a mask does not show Uganda's first COVID-19 case, but was actually taken at the John F Kennedy International Airport in February 2020.

column3: Russian President Vladimir Putin releases 800 tigers and 500 lions amid the coronavirus outbreak to keep people at home.
column8: The photos used were taken in 2016 and 2019 respectively, both in South Africa.

column3: Italian Prime Minister Giuseppe Conte was quoted in various posts and graphics on Facebook as saying they have “lost control” of the coronavirus pandemic that is greatly affecting Italy.
column8: No official statements or reports from credible news organizations carry this supposed quote by Conte. The graphics and screenshots also did not point to the source of the quote.

column3: A new vaccine that can cure COVID-19 patients in 3 hours is now ready.
column8: As of March 27, there is still no vaccine or drug approved by the World Health Organization (WHO) or any Food and Drug Administration (FDA) in the world to cure or prevent COVID-19. Moreover, the image used in the post is not a photo of vaccines from Roche Medical Company, but is a photo of rapid test kits from South Korean company Sugentech.

column3: Image attributed to Italian Prime Minister suggesting Italy has lost control.
column8: Image of Brazilian Prime Minister Bolsanaro crying at an event falsely shared as Italian President.

column3: A recipe for home-made alcohol: mix 3 parts of ethanol with 1 part of water.
column8: The ethanol sold in gas stations as fuel has toxic substances which should not to be used as disinfectant at home

column3: A vaccine that cures COVID-19 in three hours will be released next Sunday, according to Donald Trump. Roche has already produced millions of those vaccines.
column8: Vaccines do not cure diseases, they prevent diseases. Roche is starting clinical trials on a proprietary drug that might be efficient for treating COVID-19, but the tests will only start in April and no promise of "3 hour cure" has ever been made. Donald Trump did not say anything like it.

column3: There are a thousand open vacancies for nurses, doctors and other health professionals to work on a temporary hospital in São Paulo, which will be use to treat COVID-19 cases.
column8: There are 509 temporary jobs available at the Pacaembu temporary hospital.

column3: An audio message lists five ways people can prevent the novel coronavirus.
column8: There is no evidence that sipping water every 20 minutes or exposing your clothing to the sun can help prevent the coronavirus. Officials advise people to wash their hands, but not every 20 minutes, as the message claims. There’s also no evidence that consuming cold things makes you more susceptible to the virus. There’s no proof that the coronavirus can live for up to nine days on metallic surfaces. A preliminary study suggests it can remain viable on stainless steel for up to three days.

column3: Auto-hemotherapy cures COVID-19.
column8: WHO says there is still no cure for COVID-19; Brazilian Ministry of Health does not approve auto-hemotherapy.

column3: WHO confirms COVID-19 is airborne and remains in air for 8 hours.
column8: WHO explained that COVID-19 may be aerosol-borne and not airborne, that is it may linger in the air when healthcare workers are performing aerosol-generating procedures. Further, Infectious Disease Epidemiologist at the WHO, Dr Maria Van Kerkhove clarified that disease is spread through “liquid droplets through people’s noses or mouths when they sneeze or cough”.

column3: Favipiravir cures COVID-19.
column8: Favipiravir is still on trial both in Japan and Korea. The treatment benefits are not certain yet.

column3: Europe is rationing food due to the outbreak.
column8: There is no ration stamp practice in Europe in general. Some markets put purchise restrictions; but that does not mean ration stamp.

column3: An whole onion located indoor can absorb the viruses in the air.
column8: Bacteria can breed in onions in room temperature. Viruses only survive in certain kind of cells.

column3: A WhatsApp forward has gone viral which claimed that a vaccine for coronavirus has been discovered. The viral forward also claims that the treatment for coronavirus is mentioned in India’s Intermediate Zoology book.
column8: The viral forward reads, “It is not a new disease as it is already mentioned in the Intermediate zoology book along with its treatment. It happens sometimes that many great scientists and doctors do not focus on lesser-known books as they are mostly busy with famous books. Book name: Zoology, Writer: Dr. Ramesh Gupta, Page No. 1072.) Friends, this is not fake news so I request you to kindly share it maximum so all coronavirus patients are treated in time.” The virus being talked about in the viral claim is not the novel coronavirus(Covid-19) but SARS. WHO has clearly negated the discovery of any vaccine that can cure Covid-19. In an answer to the question, “Are there any medicines or therapies that can prevent or cure COVID-19?”, the WHO replies, “While some western, traditional or home remedies may provide comfort and alleviate symptoms of COVID-19, there is no evidence that current medicine can prevent or cure the disease.

column3: A WhatsApp forward is doing the rounds claiming that the COVID-19 vaccine is ready and as announced by US President Donald Trump, it will be launched next Sunday. It also claims that the vaccine discovered by the US scientists can cure a COVID-19 infected patient within 3 hours. With the WhatsApp forward, the alleged image of the vaccine is also being shared.
column8: The image being forwarded is an image of a COVID-19 test kit and not of any vaccine that can cure the virus. As per the viral forward, US President Donald Trump has announced that the vaccine will be launched next Sunday, we checked President Trump’s Twitter handle, Facebook Page and Instagram profile but we didn’t find any such announcement by the US president.

column3: Italy’s Prime Minister Giuseppe Conte broke down publicly due to the ongoing coronavirus pandemic.
column8: The image viral on social media is of Brazilian President Bolsonaro and not of Italy's PM Giuseppe Conte. The claim shared by several Social media users and media outlets is hence false.

column3: Coronavirus will be cured within 2 hours by drinking bitter gourd juice.
column8: Neither WHO nor the Indian Ministry of Health has mentioned any such remedy for coronavirus. The Press Information Bureau of India has also marked it fake.

column3: A Facebook post asserts the US developed a COVID-19 vaccine she plans to release this Sunday.
column8: Currently, there are still no definitive and institutionalised vaccines for COVID-19; nonetheless, research persists and holds potential solutions.

column3: Offers to buy special device, which will “clean” water before drinking.
column8: Tha claim is false; there is no evidence that this device is effective; in the US it's even considered dangerous.

column3: Belgium Health Minister has banned group sex due to coronavirus outbreak associated with orgy.
column8: This information is based on a satire article.

column3: A Twitter user claimed that Russia released 500 tigers to keep people inside during lockdown.
column8: While this particular image shared by the claim-source was generated from a meme maker website, the original image of the lion was taken in Johannesburg, South Africa in 2016, not recently as we have been led to believe by the publisher.

column3: Video made by Dr. Mario Pesaresi in which he recomends water steam to deactivite the coronavirus.
column8: There is no evidence of the impact of water steam in coronavirus. The WHO and CDC indicate there is no conclusive evidence to determine whether heat is impacting the virus.

column3: An image shows a Spanish scientist asking Cristiano Ronaldo and Messi to find the cure to Covid-19.
column8: The woman in the picture is not a scientist, but an ex-member of previouses Spanish governments and it was taken in April 2008. It was never related to the new coronavirus or to the football players.

column3: WHO confirmed COVID-19 as airborne.
column5: Fact-Checked by: Sure And Share Center MCOT
column8: WHO insisted that COVID-19 is not spread as airborne in everyday life.

column3: Second-hand clothes and blankets sold cheaply in African markets are infected with coronavirus.
column8: The photo is at least ten years old. China imports mostly new clothes to Africa, but WHO, Harvard Medical School and other experts advise it is safe to receive goods from COVID-19 affected areas.

column3: A statue of the Virgin Mary from Loreto will be carried by a plane over Italy to ask for the pandemic of Covid-19 to stop.
column8: The picture was taken in January and is related to a specific event that has nothing to do with COVID-19. The Loreto chatedral has denied that such an event will take place.

column3: False offer of free Internet during 60 days due to the quarantine.
column8: Please read the full article

column3: Russia has unleashed over 500 lions to ensure that people stay inside their homes amid the coronavirus outbreak.
column8: The image of a bulletin viral on social media has nothing to do with Russia or Russian President. The image is from South Africa’s Johannesburg, and the lion seen in the viral image was brought for film shooting by a production crew.

column3: Russia has allegedly unleashed over 500 lions in order to ensure that people stay inside their houses.
column8: The bulletin has been created using a template caled 'Break your own news'. Secondly, the image of the lion dates back to 2016 and was taken in South Africa’s Johannesburg

column3: A WhatsApp forward has gone viral which claimed that a vaccine for coronavirus has been discovered. The viral forward also claims that the treatment for coronavirus is mentioned in India’s Intermediate Zoology book. The viral forward reads, “It is not a new disease as it is already mentioned in the Intermediate zoology book along with its treatment. It happens sometimes that many great scientists and doctors do not focus on lesser-known books as they are mostly busy with famous books. Book name: Zoology, Writer: Dr. Ramesh Gupta, Page No. 1072.) Friends, this is not fake news so I request you to kindly share it maximum so all coronavirus patients are treated in time.”
column8: The virus being talked about in the viral claim is not the novel coronavirus(Covid-19) but SARS. WHO has clearly negated the discovery of any vaccine that can cure Covid-19. In an answer to the question, “Are there any medicines or therapies that can prevent or cure COVID-19?”, the WHO replies, “While some western, traditional or home remedies may provide comfort and alleviate symptoms of COVID-19, there is no evidence that current medicine can prevent or cure the disease.

column3: Inhaling Water Into The Nose Can Prevent Corona Transmission
column8: Numerous studies show that water alone is not enough to kill the Corona virus.

column3: Vladimir Putin Released 800 Tigers and Lions for Forced Residents to Stay at Home
column8: Photos of the lion have been circulating on the internet since April 2016, long before the Corona COVID-19 virus first appeared in Wuhan, China, in December 2019. The lion in the photo is named Columbus, released on the streets of Johannesburg, South Africa, for the purpose of filmmaking.

column3: WHO Call Ibuprofen Drugs Can Make Corona Live Longer
column8: WHO does not mention that the ibuprofen drug can make the Corona COVID-19 virus live longer. In fact, WHO does not recommend against using ibuprofen based on information available so far. The reason, WHO did not find reports about the negative effects of ibuprofen on COVID-19 patients, beyond the known side effects that limit their use in certain populations. The WHO also did not find any clinical or population-based data published on the claim.

column3: Picture of “baile funk” (a type of Brazilian popular party) in São Paulo during the coronavirus, despite restrictions of mass gatherings due to the COVID-19.
column8: The picture was taken in September 2019, thus before the COVID-19 was first detected

column3: Russian President Vladimir Putin released 800 lions and tigers across Russia to stop people from leaving home.
column8: The original photo was taken on April 11., 2016, in Johannesburg, South Africa, in a movie shooting locale.

column3: Science Minister Pedro Duque was hospitalized due to coronavirus in Denia
column8: Pedro Duque itself denied it in El Objetivo while de chaintext was viralizing

column3: DRC president, Felix Tshisekedi, has suspended the payment of rents and water and electricity bills because of coronavirus.
column8: AFP dug into governmental speeches and announcements since the outbreak of coronavirus, and there is no mention of suspension of bills. Plus, the team of the DRC's president denied to AFP having announced such economic measures.

column3: A photo showing nurses raising their middle fingers against the French government, with a caption against the French President
column8: The woman who took the picture explained to AFP having posted such photo to raise her finger to the coronavirus, not to the French government. Analysis of the medatada allowed AFP to confirm she was the one who took the picture.
column9: instagram users, like the ex football player vikash dhorasoo, facebook users

column3: Vladimir Putin, “released 500 lions to monitor the quarantine.”
column8: This is false. It is a meme that has already gotten out of control.

column3: One photograph of the meeting of the Bolivian health minister, Anibal Cruz with delegates, hints that they are hiding current figures of the infections with COVID-19 to the population
column8: The photo hints that in Bolivia are one thousand people infected with COVID-19. But in Bolivia are registred 61 one cases today (3/27/2020).

column3: President Giammattei said that the country has 10.000 COVID-19 test.
column8: Guatemala had received 1.000 test from WHO-PAHO and now has 622.

column3: Photo of the “crying president of Italy” with a caption arguing how Italy was not prepared to deal with the coronavirus outbreak despite having adequate health facilities.
column8: The world leader in the photo on these posts is not the president of Italy. He is Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro.

column3: Prime Minister Narendra Modi announced a 14 hour curfew as the virus lives for 12 hours on surfaces.
column8: Research studies show that The study found the new coronavirus can live in the air for several hours and on some surfaces for as long as 2 -3 days. These studies are not peer reviewed.

column3: Celebrities spreading misinformation about coronavirus and the Janata curfew in India.
column8: The celebrities shared posts that were already debunked about the 12 hour curfew on March 22 in India.

column3: Yves Levy, husband of the former french health minister Agnès Buzyn, inaugurated the P4 laboratory of Wuhan in China, where thethe coronavirus SARS-CoV-2 was created.
column8: The virus wasn't created in Wuhan's P4 laboratory.

column3: “Go to 2020census.gov and fill out this census form so you can get your stimulus check.”
column8: Your response to the U.S. Census won’t affect whether you get a federal stimulus check.

column3: A screenshot of a Nigerian television station showing a breakdown of “472 confirmed cases” has been shared on Facebook, Twitter, and WhatsApp alongside claims it shows novel coronavirus cases across the country.
column8: But the image is being shared out of context: It shows figures for Lassa fever, not coronavirus.

column3: A video has been viewed hundreds of thousands of times on Facebook, Twitter and YouTube alongside a claim that it shows a drone launching fireworks at people who breached a curfew in Malaysia during a nationwide coronavirus lockdown.
column8: The claim is false; the video's audio has been manipulated to include a man speaking in Malaysian; the original clip actually shows a prank that was staged by a Brazilian influencer in Brazil in July 2019.

column3: Polish telecommunications provider PLAY has installed 5G antennas during quarantine.
column8: The were installed before quarantine was introduced.

column3: Poison Spray for Corona from Malaysia and Singapore by Air?
column8: Indonesian Minister of Communication and Information Johnny G. Plate, Malaysian Army, and Head of Batam City Health Office Didi Kusmaryadi have denied the rumors.

column3: The Peruvian Social Security is offering monetary help to some people included in a list to endure the quarantine.
column8: The government is offering an excepcional monetary help for people in extreme poverty, but that message is a fraud, according the Social Security authorities.

column3: There are a thousand open vacancies for nurses, doctors and other health professionals to work on a temporary hospital in São Paulo, which will be use to treat COVID-19 cases.
column8: There are 509 temporary jobs available at the Pacaembu temporary hospital.

column3: Social media posts suggest Zimbabwean police flogged churches who gathered in defiance to warnings encouraging social distancing.
column8: The video is neither related to the coronavirus nor church activities. It is a November 2019 video of Zimbabwean police dispersing supporters of the main opposition political party.

column3: “Boil some orange peels wit cayenne pepper in it stand over the pot breathe in the steam so all that mucus can release from yo nasal… MUCUS is the problem its where THE VIRUS LIVES!!!”.
column8: Orange peels and cayenne are not proven to treat COVID-19, and neither is boiling them.

column3: The photo shows the funeral of Turkish deceased general Aytac Yalman due to COVID-19.
column8: The photo was taken in 2006 in someone's funeral who died of hemorrhagic fever.

column3: A recent video of Coronavirus patients at an airport in China and gauge how serious the situation is.
column8: The video is not of the coronavirus infected patients of China or Italy, but of the mock drill conducted at Blas Dian Airport in Decar, Senegal last year.

column3: A drug made from cow urine or pigeon membrane can cure coronavirus.
column8: No evidence found which can prove that the pigeon membrane can cure the coronavirus. WHO has not mention this too.

column3: Five helicopters will desinfect the Netherlands to extinguish the coronavirus. Citizens have to stay inside.
column8: Different versions of this message have been circulating all over the world since March 10th. The Dutch police force has confirmed no such measures have been or will be taken.

column3: Coronavirus is infectious in air for 8 hours and everyone must wear a face mask.
column8: Coronavirus may remain in the air 1-3 hours, and face masks are not required for everyone, just healthcare workers.

column3: An image has been shared thousands of times in multiple posts on Facebook alongside a claim that it shows a medicine created by US scientists that can cure the novel coronavirus, COVID-19.
column8: The claim is false; the photo in fact shows a COVID-19 test kit developed by a South Korean company; as of March 2020, international health experts have said there is no "cure" or vaccine for COVID-19.

column3: A photo has been shared hundreds of times in multiple Facebook, Twitter and Instagram posts alongside a claim that it shows Italy’s president crying over the novel coronavirus epidemic that has claimed thousands of lives in his country.
column8: The claim is false; the photo shows Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro getting emotional during a Thanksgiving speech in December 2019.

column3: A video shared thousands of times on Facebook claims to show police in Zimbabwe beating churchgoers because their place of worship refused to close to prevent the spread of COVID-19.
column8: The claims are false; the video was filmed before the virus outbreak. It shows opposition supporters being dispersed after gathering to hear their leader.

column3: A purported emergency notice from Australian authorities has been shared hundreds of times in multiple posts on Facebook and Twitter. It states people can receive free home visits from doctors during the novel coronavirus pandemic.
column8: The claim is false; Australian health authorities denied issuing the notice, adding the hoax had prompted “unnecessary phone calls” that had overwhelmed public health units.

column3: A viral WhatsApp voice note in Nigeria claims that the coronavirus could kill up to 45 million Nigerians.
column8: This is misleading, as data from the World Health Organization (WHO) and the Nigeria Centre for Disease Control (NCDC) shows. The message makes several other false claims, which we debunk here.

column3: Korean drama predicted the occurence of COVID19 in 2018..
column8: The korean series didn't talk about COVID-19 but used SARS as a reference in creating a highly lethal coronavirus that have very different death rates, symptoms and incubation period .

column3: US military brought the virus to Wuhan on October 2019.
column8: The US CDC director says that the flue has started in October in the US, and that some apparently flue-related deaths were in fact due to the COVID-19. He does not say that the COVID-19 has sarted in october in the US.
column9: spokesperson of the chinese foreign affairs ministry

column3: Polish telecommunications provider PLAY has installed 5G antennas during quarantine.
column8: The were installed before quarantine was introduced.

column3: Russian president using lions to ensure people stayed indoors in Russia.
column8: Lion roaming in Johannesburg street as part of a film production in 2016.

column3: Channel4’s Jon Snow is infected with coronavirus.
column8: Jon Snow was on a self-isolation after an Iran assignment in late February and has reported to work after 14day period, and continues to be part of the Channel4 News and to-date has not contracted COVID-19, verified from his Twitter account and verified News sourced.

column3: Initial Lack Of Evidence For Human-To-Human COVID-19 Transmission Unusual.
column8: We lined up the tweets from WHO and showed there was a progression from not know to the transmission being human-to-human

column3: Tom Hanks died, confessed admiration for Trump.
column8: Story published by clear death-hoax website.

column3: Helicopters Are Spraying Disinfectants To Try To Eradicate coronavirus.
column8: False information being spread on Facebook. Completely made up, but post is spreading across countries.

column3: A tent will be set up next to the Viamed de Calahorra hospital (La Rioja) to carry out rapid tests for coronavirus.
column8: No, a tent will not be enabled next to the Calahorra hospital for rapid coronavirus tests.

column3: The government of Spain is going to declare a state of emergency.
column8: There is no proof that Spain would enter a state of emergency starting March 23, when the viral audio was spread.

column3: A WhatsApp forward has gone viral which claimed that a vaccine for coronavirus has been discovered. The viral forward also claims that the treatment for coronavirus is mentioned in India’s Intermediate Zoology book.
column8: The viral forward reads, “It is not a new disease as it is already mentioned in the Intermediate zoology book along with its treatment. It happens sometimes that many great scientists and doctors do not focus on lesser-known books as they are mostly busy with famous books. Book name: Zoology, Writer: Dr. Ramesh Gupta, Page No. 1072.) Friends, this is not fake news so I request you to kindly share it maximum so all coronavirus patients are treated in time.” The virus being talked about in the viral claim is not the novel coronavirus(COVID-19) but SARS. WHO has clearly negated the discovery of any vaccine that can cure COVID-19. In an answer to the question, “Are there any medicines or therapies that can prevent or cure COVID-19?”, the WHO replies, “While some western, traditional or home remedies may provide comfort and alleviate symptoms of COVID-19, there is no evidence that current medicine can prevent or cure the disease.

column3: Riots in London due to the unavailability of food items. The United Kingdom will be locked down by tonight. Army soldiers take to the UK streets.
column8: The video is not related to coronavirus but with London riots that happened in 2011. The 2011 England riots, more widely known as the London Riots, were a series of riots between 6 and 11 August 2011, when thousands of people rioted in cities and towns across England, saw looting, arson, and mass deployment of police, and resulted in the deaths of five people.

column3: Aspirating boiling water vapor for five minutes desactivates the coronavirus.
column8: Doctors say it does not desactivate the virus. The WHO also says there is no vaccine yet.

column3: Lemon and bicarbonate kill the virus.
column8: Official sanitary authorities debunk that claim

column3: Photographs of the Army in Dublin city centre show that the country is about to go into lockdown.
column8: The photographs show the Army setting up mobile testing centres in Dublin city centre, not preparing for the country to go into lockdown

column3: A photo circulating on Facebook in Nigeria appears to show President Muhammadu Buhari shaking hands with the nation’s Code of Conduct Bureau Chairman Mohammed Isa while both men are wearing face masks — a seeming flouting of precautions during the novel coronavirus pandemic.
column8: The image was doctored using an old photo, taken long before the pandemic.

column3: The death of Kobe Bryant overshadowed the news that American drugmaker was hustling to make a vaccine for coronavirus, and 200 people died of COVID-19 in August 2019 in the USA.
column8: There was an article about American drugmakers working on a new vaccine to counter the rapidly spreading respiratory virus publishing on the American daily newspaper, USA Today, on January 24. But the feature didn't mention a death toll of 200 in August 2019.

column3: Worshipers were beaten by policemen because they gathered in a church.
column8: We found the same video published on Twitter on November 2019, so before the outbreak of coronavirus. The caption was : "Zimbabwe riot police attacked opposition party MDC Alliance supporters today who had gathered to hear leader, Nelson Chamisa, give his Hope of the Nation Address." Other pictures on Twitter and within AFP archives allow us to match the video with this anti riot police operation.

column3: A Chinese woman in Mombasa was attacked and killed after showing flu-like symptoms and refusing to go to hospital.
column8: The article uses an image from the 2013 Westgate terror attack in Kenya, and police in the area also had not received any information about the attack.

column3: 22 travellers in Uganda for the EU-Uganda Business Summit scheduled for early March had refused to go into quarantine.
column8: The 22 travellers had refused to go into quarantine and opted to travel back to their home countries, but they were not in Uganda for the conference as claimed.

column3: It is recommanded to disinfect everything you buy with bleach to prevent you from being infected with the coronavirus.
column8: It is not really recommanded. Experts say it is better to focus on washing your hands and to follow the official recommandations.

column3: Chroloquine could cure coronavirus
column8: There are not enough conclusive evidence to point out chloroquine as a cure treatment
