column3: Stocks of “medical masks” made in Woippy, in Moselle, by a company are being blocked for lack of “agreement of the government”, inspite of a shortage of masks in France.
column8: Facebook users did not answer to AFP. Their publications mention a place that does not exist. Woippy's mayor told AFP he does not know about a company that is making masks in his city.

column3: Quotes Joe Biden as saying “people who have never died before are now dying from coronavirus.”
column8: The quote was first misattributed to President Donald Trump. Joe Biden didn’t say it either.

column3: “19 Tigers fans got infected with COVID-19 in NY”
column8: Although it is true that members of the group “Libres y Lokos”, a bar of a Monterrey soccer team, made a trip to New York, in the United States, to witness the game of Tigres vs New York City FC, it is false that even the March 20, 2020, it has been confirmed that 19 people from the blue-blue bar have contracted the new coronavirus as indicated by an audio circulating on WhatsApp.

column3: People with type O blood are more resistant to COVID-19.
column8: "It circulates on social networks and in various media portals, a note that ensures that a study establishes that certain blood groups are more resistant (or even immune) to the COVID-19 virus. This information is DECEPTIVE. Although this clinical trial was carried out, this is a preliminary study published on the medRxiv portal, a free online archive and distribution server for complete (unpublished) manuscripts from the medical, clinical and health-related sciences."

column3: Says Russia unleashed more than 500 lions on its streets to ensure that people are staying indoors during this pandemic outbreak.
column8: Russian President Vladimir Putin hasn’t resorted to releasing lions in order to keep people inside during the COVID-19 pandemic.

column3: A purported warning from Australian hospitals has been shared thousands of times in multiple posts on Facebook that using petrol pumps can enable the spread of the novel coronavirus, COVID-19.
column8: The claim is false; Australia’s Department of Health said it did not issue the purported advisory; scientists say the virus is unlikely to survive on petrol pumps outside as sunlight and lack of moisture generally kill it; motorists are advised to regularly wash their hands to avoid infection.

column3: Biden campaign’s claim a top CDC official was ‘silenced’.
column8: Messonnier’s remarks on Feb. 25 may have caught the attention of Wall Street and caused angst in the White House. But we cannot find evidence of her being immediately silenced, as Klain claims in the video.

column3: Denmark passed from 200 new cases of Covid-19 in one day to only 26 cases.
column8: These numbers are not in line with the national authorities, it was never reported 200 or 26 news cases in one day in Denmark. On March 19, there were 75 new cases in the country.

column3: Coronavirus cases linked to 5G rollout.
column8: Overlaps in the map between 5G and cases can be explained by population density.

column3: Photo shows coffins from coronavirus outbreak in Italy.
column8: Old photo from African migrants who died from shipwreck in 2013.

column3: Elderly COVID-19 patients won’t have access to respirators
column8: Please click the link to read the full article

column3: Seeing the rise of novel coronavirus in India, the World Health Organization (WHO) has recommended the government of India to lockdown the country from April 15 to June 15.
column8: We reached out to one of the representatives in India, who rubbished the claim and clarified that WHO has not made any such recommendation.

column3: A video is doing the rounds in already flooded WhatsApp groups. It is being claimed that the lady shown in the video is the wife of Canada’s PM Justin Trudeau. In the viral video, a lady can be seen describing her improved condition because of medication and also warns to not take chances.
column8: The lady in the viral video is not Canadian PM Justin Trudeau’s wife Sophie Grégoire Trudeau but a British national namely Tara Jane Langston.

column3: The King of Spain has plagiarized his COVID-19 speech from a book.
column8: A picture shows a fragment of the King's speech and the image of a book as if the king had plagiarized his words from a writer.

column3: The schools in Bizkaia in Spain do not close until September.
column8: The Education ministry of The Basque Country denies it to Newtral.es.

column3: A video posted on Twitter shows a group of chinese people converting to islamism under the argument that islamics are imune to COVID-19.
column8: The claim is false. Islamic people are not imune to COVID-19.

column3: Doctors are giving out ‘rescue packs’ for people with pre-existing respiratory conditions.
column8: There is no evidence that doctors in Ireland are giving out packs containing steroids and antibiotics to people with pre-existing respiratory conditions, such as asthma or COPD. On the contrary, doctors have advised that such a move would not be safe, given the different needs that each patient would have.

column3: “If you are in Las Vegas and you get a knock on your door from NV Power, 2020 Census or CVD-19 testers, do not open your door. They are robbing people at gunpoint.”
column8: Las Vegas police said they have received no such reports. Similar rumors are being spread around the country.

column3: If people violate the quarantine measures in Ukraine, they will be imprisoned.
column8: According to the law on coronavirus in Ukraine, there is no such measure.

column3: Pets can transmit the new coronavirus.
column8: The is no proof that pets can transmit the new coronavirus, although the droplets with the virus can stay on pets and, then, get into the human organism.

column3: Pets can transmit the new coronavirus.
column8: The is no proof that pets can transmit the new coronavirus, although the droplets with the virus can stay on pets and, then, get into the human organism.

column3: Fill out 2020 US Census form to receive a economic stimulus payment.
column8: U.S. government relief payments for coronavirus relief will be determined by tax returns, not census information.

column3: Rinsing throat and nose with warm and salt water will save from getting the new coronavirus.
column8: Rinsing the throat and washing the nose with salty water may slightly alleviate the cold. However, it does not help with respiratory diseases, including COVID-19. The effectiveness of such treatment or prevention of the new coronavirus is not proven.

column3: A letter from the ministry of Education saying summer holidays will be postponed because of the coronavirus outbreak.
column8: Clues in the letter shows it is a fake (for instance, the signature) and Jean-Michel Blanquer, minister of Education, denied on Twitter having published such a letter. He also denied any change in the holidays' schedule.
column9: screenshot of the letter published on facebook

column3: Sophie Trudeau is sharing her COVID-19 experience.
column8: Video is of a woman from London and not Sophie Trudeau.

column3: A positive COVID-19 patient recently met Narendra Modi.
column8: A 2018 picture is being shared with a false narrative.

column3: A line of coffins suggesting they are from Italy currently.
column8: Old image of 2013 of migrants dying in a shipwreck shared as recent.

column3: Cow urine is helpful to fight coronavirus.
column8: No scientific evidence backs the use of cow urine to tackle viruses.

column3: The Colombian government has just made it official that all citizens will receive 350,000 pesos a week for staying home to prevent the proliferation” of the new coronavirus COVID-19.
column8: It is false that the Columbian government is giving 350,000 pesos to stay at home.

column3: Banglore Municipal body (BBMP) will be spraying medicine in the air to kill coronavirus.
column8: Municipal commissioner of the city has no such plans of spraying medicines to kill COVID-19.

column3: Sick COVID-19 patients at the airport runway in Senegal.
column8: Video is old and not from Italy. It actually shows mock drill carried out on 28 November 2019 at Blaise Diagne Airport in Dakar, the capital of Senegal. It has nothing to do with coronavirus.

column3: Image claims that death bodies from Italy kept in a room.
column8: The image is from a Cairo Mosque which was turned into a makeshift morgue in 2013.

column3: Consuming alcoholic beverages may help reduce the risk of infection by the novel coronavirus; COVID-19.
column8: Drinking alcohol does not protect you from coronavirus infection, according to WHO.

column3: Coronavirus will be cured after a 14 hours curfew.
column8: Novel coronavirus have differnt life spans on differnt objects however it can live upto 2 to 3 days.

column3: “Only India can resist CoronaVirus.”- Saudi Crown Prince Mohammad Bin Salman.
column8: Saudi Crown Prince Mohammad Bin Salman has not made any such statement.

column3: Bill Gates and Vatican have a plan to depopulate world with coronavirus vaccine.
column8: Video clip taken out of context from 2010 Gates TedTalk.

column3: Homeland Security mobilizing national guard to combat coronavirus.
column8: National Guard refuted claims.

column3: Joe Biden tested positive for coronavirus.
column8: Another news publication refuted the false claim.

column3: President Rodrigo Duterte said COVID-19, the disease caused by the novel coronavirus, is only transmitted through contact with other people.
column8: The novel coronavirus is known to spread mainly from person to person, but it can also spread through infected surfaces or objects.

column3: US President Donald Trump said in a White House briefing on Friday, March 20, that chloroquine and hydroxychloroquine, which are often used to treat malaria, have been approved by the Food and Drug Administration (FDA) for treatment of COVID-19.
column8: Chloroquine or hydroxychloroquine is FDA-approved for treating malaria, lupus, and rheumatoid arthritis, but not COVID-19. There is no official cure for the disease as of March 25.

column3: Says truck drivers are being turned away from fast-food restaurants during the COVID-19 pandemic.
column8: Truck drivers are having issues getting meals at some fast-food chains with shuttered dining rooms. Their rigs can’t fit in drive-thru lanes and they aren’t allowed to walk up and order at the window.

column3: This picture show dozens of coffins in Italy because of the coronavirus.
column8: This pictures has been taken in 2013, it has no links with the current pandemia.

column3: It is forbidden to be more than one in a car in France during the confinement.
column8: You have to follow some rules, but it is not always forbidden.

column3: 1720, 1919, 2020… Every hundred years, a pandemia “cleans” the Earth.
column8: Multiples pandemia occured outside of this timeframe.

column3: The French Education Minister has postponed the summer holidays because of the coronavirus oubreak.
column8: The minister said the measure was not considered for the moment.

column3: “Wisconsin is the only state where all Republicans voted against protecting its citizens.”
column8: Wisconsin is indeed the only one of the 50 states where all Republicans voted no. But it’s a bit of an exaggeration to describe that vote as “against protecting its citizens.”

column3: “Fish tank additive may treat coronavirus.”
column8: Fish-tank cleaners containing chloroquine cannot be substituted for prescription drugs used to treat malaria. The FDA says you should not take chloroquine unless it has been prescribed by a doctor and obtained from a legitimate source.

column3: Romania is introducing new law that will penalize breaking the quarantine with 15 years of imprisonment.
column8: 15 years of imprisonment is maximum length of punishment for those who knowingly spread the contagious disease and their action resulted in death of others. Breaking the quarantine will be punishable up to 3 years of imprisonment or fine.

column3: Italian doctor saying no one has died from coronavirus.
column8: The interviewed mentioned as a source is from late February when the coronavirus outbreak in Italy wasn't that significant. At the moment, this doctor has changed his position on coronavirus and casualties.

column3: A post claims that there are no cases of the new coronavirus in Russia.
column8: In the day that the post was published there were already 147 people infected with COVID-19, according to the national authorities.

column3: Using hot air from a hair dryer against sinuses can prevent and treat COVID19
column8: No evidence supports this theory. Directing hot air to sinuses will make it dry which cause tiny tears that may increase the risk of getting COVID-19.

column3: A runny nose is not a COVID-19’s symptom.
column5: Fact-Checked by: Sure And Share Center MCOT
column8: Even the fever and dry cough are the most symptom for COVID-19, runny nose also one of its. In Thailand, 25% of patients has runny nose.

column3: A photo showing hundreds of people in the Montparnasse train station in Paris, despite of confinement measures due to the novel coronavirus.
column8: The photo was taken on May 26, 2019.

column3: Spain is the European country where the coronavirus is more lethal.
column8: Spain is not the European country where the coronavirus is most lethal, it is Italy.

column3: Spaniards need to carry a work certificate or purchase receipts to justify to the Security Forces the reason why they have taken to the streets under the state of alarm.
column8: It is not mandatory, but it helps to facilitate police controls.

column3: Chloroquine cures COVID-19.
column8: Studies with chloroquine are ongoing and are not conclusive.

column3: A post has been shared tens of thousands of times on Facebook and Twitter which claims that a factory in the Australian city of Melbourne has been hoarding essential supplies including baby formula, toilet paper and hand sanitiser for export to China during the novel coronavirus pandemic.
column8: The claim is false; police said the accusation was "false". The company cited in the misleading posts also refuted the claim.

column3: Chloroquine was forbidden by a French government decree in January.
column8: The legal decree did not forbid chloroquine, but sets up a new requirement to be allowed to be given this medicine: people need to have a prescription. This change followed a recommendation of the national agence of medicine (ANSM), made on December 13, 2019, so before the outbreak of coronavirus.
column9: online article with a screenshot of a legal decree

column3: A post giving a nurse’s advice not to be infected by coronavirus. The nurse is called Claire Magne and works at hospitals in Toulouse, or in Marseille, depending on publications.
column8: Quoted hospitals in the publications both denied to AFP having a Claire Magne working for them.

column3: An audio circulating on WhatsApp says that the way to end the COVID-19 pandemic is “creating herd immunity groups.” Supposedly, it is a group of people who, thanks to their “positive thoughts and diet” manage to “alkalize their body”, and prevent the virus from spreading.
column8: Immunity is not achieved through food or the mind.

column3: Deputy of the Movement to Socialism (MAS) in Bolivia, Juana Quispe Ari: USA created the anthrax disease.
column8: Actual medicine Information of the disease explain why this is not true.

column8: Bolivia Verfica contacted the deputy of Movement of Socialism (MAS), Franklin Flores, who denied that the audio is from Bolivia. He also explained that when it (The state of Bolivia) comes to emergency, no law projects are carried out.

column3: Ugandan landlords have been asked by the government to stop collecting rent as citizens stay home to fight COVID-19.
column8: A letter allegedly from State House Uganda directing landlords in the country to stop collecting rent as Ugandans stay home to fight COVID-19 is not authentic.

column3: An article claiming that a Kenyan had died from COVID-19 on 20 March.
column8: An article claiming that a Kenyan had died from COVID-19 on 20 March is false.

column8: A Facebook post with an image claiming to show the victims of COVID-19 in Italy uses a photo of the coffins of African immigrants who drowned off the coast near Lampedusa in 2013.

column3: Persons with blood type A are more prone to coronavirus.
column8: There is no scientific evidence to show that people with blood type A are more likely to get ‘Covid-19’.

column3: An image of coffins in Italy.
column8: The image was taken in 2013.

column3: The spokesman of Chinese Foreign Ministry Zhao Lijian: American CDC admitted that COVID-19 patients were misdiagnosed as flu. US Army is responsible for the outbreak in Wuhan.
column8: China's Foreign Ministry spokesman Zhao Lijian tweeted and commanded.

column3: University of Vienna declares Ibuprofen makes the COVID-19 disease worse.
column8: University of Vienna denied the research. The relation between ibuprofen intake and COVID-19 is still under investigaion.

column3: Dr. Yavuz Dizdar’s multiple allegations around the COVID-19.
column8: Dr. Dizdar is an oncologist, not an expert in the field. The allegations are based on the interpretation, not scientific evidence.

column3: An audio clip suggests that the WHO has advised a lockdown.
column8: A source in WHO confirmed that the organisation has not put out any such information as heard in the viral audio clip.

column3: The Ethiopian Airlines flight from Italy this evening to Addis Ababa airport. Most of the passengers are infected with the virus, and there is no strength except in God.
column8: The visuals actually pertain to a mock rescue drill that took place at Blaise Diagne Airport near the town of Diass, Senegal. The incident dates back to 28 November 2019 and was a simple simulation aimed at evaluating the capacity to respond to various crises that may arise during airport operations.

column3: Saddam Hussein in 90s talking about coronavirus to his cabinet and army that America has threatened him to spread this virus if he doesn’t follow their command.
column8: The viral video is a doctored version of the original video shared by Associated Press in 2015. The audios of both the videos are different not only in terms of their content but voice as well. In the original AP video, Saddam Hussein does not mention the word ‘virus’ or ‘coronavirus.’

column3: Curfew in Janta, India will help break the chain of transmission.
column8: The World Health Organisation has maintained that it is not certain how long the virus that causes COVID-19 survives on surfaces, but it seems to behave like other coronaviruses.

column3: Hospitals are advising people to wear gloves at petrol pumps.
column8: The hospital named in the message confirmed that it did not issue this advice, and health authorities, including the Chief Medical Officer, said that the public is not being advised to do this.

column3: Gargling With Warm Salt Water Can Save From coronavirus.
column8: Post claiming gargling with warm salt water can save from coronavirus is fake as per health organizations and experts.

column3: The original form of the Corona COVID-19 virus after being enlarged 2,600 times
column8: The small creature in the photo is a weevil, a beetle that comes from the Curculionoidea family.

column3: The video of the American Army that Distributes Corona to China
column8: The man in the first video is a train passenger in Belgium who is drunk. While the man in the second video is a company manager in Hong Kong who intentionally made a parody video. The narrative that contains the conspiracy theory "the American army is the spreader of the Corona COVID-19 virus to China" comes from one Chinese official who has not been able to prove the truth.

column3: Gargling with warm water and salt or vinegar can kill coronavirus.
column8: An image was shared on WhatsApp claiming that gargling with warm water and salt or vinegar can kill COVID-19. There is no evidence that asserts the claims. The WHO reminds that there is still no medicine or household remedy to treat coronavirus.

column3: Donald Trump tried to buy a vaccine developed in Germany.
column8: In an audio a woman said that Trump tried to buy a vaccine that was developed in Germany. However, the german CureVac laboratory denied the allegations on March 16.

column3: A WhatsApp message resembling an Nigerian CDC circular says Nigeria has not placed a travel ban or provided quarantine measures for travellers from countries with coronavirus cases.
column8: As at when the message was received, Nigeria was yet to establish travel restrictions; it has since so imposed said restrictions on 13 high-risk countries. Also, contrary to the claim, there are and have always been quarantine measures for migrants into the country.

column3: University of Vienna declares Ibuprofen makes the COVID-19 disease worse.
column8: University of Vienna denied the research. The relation between ibuprofen intake and COVID-19 is still under investigaion.

column8: El Pais' has not published the article and Renfe denies that they are considering apply an ERTE.

column8: These remarks were made on January 31, not 9 days ago.

column8: Minsitry of Defense said there is not going to be such action.

column3: Speech from spanish King Felipe VI about coronavirus was a plagiarism from book “Palmeras en la nieve” or “Las Palmeras”
column8: It is not king's speech about coronavirus, but from years ago about Catalonien. This speech was afterwards included in the book "Las Palmeras". Ther is no plagiarism.

column3: A WhatsApp forward is doing the rounds which claims that Prime Minister Narendra Modi called for a 14-hour long ‘Janta Curfew’ on 22 March from 7 am to 9 pm because the lifespan of the coronavirus at one place is only 12 hours and if we all follow the Janta Curfew religiously then the chain will be broken
column8: There is no clear information on the lifespan of the novel coronavirus. However, various study reports have suggested a similar lifespan as that of other coronaviruses. PM Modi’s motive behind calling for a ‘Janta Curfew’ was just to curb the spreading of novel coronavirus and the Government has not claimed that the Janta Curfew is called to kill the virus hence the claim turned out to ‘Misleading’ in our fact-check.

column3: Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister YS Jagan Reddy has claimed that ‘Paracetamol’ is the only medication for coronavirus.
column8: It is evident from our findings and Dr. Pandey’s testimony that Paracetamol can help with the coronavirus symptoms but it cannot entirely cure coronavirus. We also found that Paracetamol is not the only medication that can help with coronavirus symptoms as there are many medications.

column3: The United States of America threatened Iraq with coronavirus in 1990.

column3: The symptoms of the first nine days when one catches COVID-19.
column8: COVID-19 patients don't have the exact same symptoms. The most common symptoms are fever, tiredness, and dry cough. Some patients may have aches and pains, nasal congestion, runny nose, sore throat or diarrhea.

A the the other hands, sources are all-Moscow related and alt-right, conspiracy theories and antisemitism approaches

column8: Studies have shown some early promise, but it's not entirely solid to say the treatments work against coronavirus.

column3: According to Art. 116, a “state of emergency” will be implemented in Mexico that will limit the free movement of people to combat the #COVID-19 epidemic.
column8: This is FALSE, the mentioned article is in the Spanish Constitution, not in the Mexican. Article 116 of the Spanish Constitution speaks of the state of alarm. And to avoid leaving you in doubt, constitutional 116 (the one in Mexico) talks about the division of powers, not "states of emergency."

column3: Biden claims that Trump eliminated the White House pandemic office.
column8: One can see the dueling narratives here, neither entirely incorrect. The office — as set up by Obama — was folded into another office. Thus, one could claim the office was eliminated. But the staff slots did not disappear and at least initially the key mission of team remained a priority. So one can also claim nothing changed and thus Biden’s criticism is overstated.

column3: WHO offering free data for coronavirus info.
column8: Links in post lead to external website, potentially with harmful malware. Post is false, clickbait.

column8: The authorities have officially denied this fact.

column3: Romania is introducing new law that will penalize breaking the quarantine with 15 years of imprisonment.
column8: 15 years of imprisonment is maximum length of punishment for those who knowingly spread the contagious disease and their action resulted in death of others. Breaking the quarantine will be punishable up to 3 years of imprisonment or fine.

column8: The claim is false; the countries have issued public guidance amid the pandemic, but there has been no official communication on rent payments and government officials dismissed the reports.

column8: The decision was taken before the COVID-19 crisis began.

column3: Says “there is no” COVID-19 virus.
column8: The coronavirus is real and infecting thousands of people around the world. As of March 19, COVID-19 had infected more than 191,000 people around the world and resulted in 7,807 deaths.

column3: The federal government is “preparing to mobilize the national guard,” “dispatch them across the US with military” and “announce a nationwide 1 week quarantine for all citizens.”
column8: There is no evidence that the federal government is set to announce a lockdown. White House officials have repeatedly said it’s not something they’re considering at this time.

column3: For coronavirus cases “in the U.S. 38% of those hospitalized are under 35.”
column8: The CDC reported that between mid-February and mid-March, 20% of the hospitalizations for coronavirus were for patients age 20-44 and 18% were age 45-54.

column3: Korean series My Secret Terrius predicted the outbreak in advance.

column3: Sitting in the sunlight will help cure coronavirus.
column8: The answer to this statement, according to doctors, is more than just true or false. Professor Ramanan Laxminarayan, Director of Centre for Disease Dynamics, Economics and Policy (CDDEP) said that, “We do not know how heat will affect this coronavirus as of yet. Usually, respiratory pathogens disappear in the summer and in the heat, but we have seen many cases in tropical countries too.”

column3: China recognizes Palestinian doctor as discoverer of Corona COVID-19 virus vaccine

Even the doctor who claimed to be the inventor of the vaccine, Manar Saadi Al-Sheenawi, was not found in the Google search engine. In addition, until now, the WHO has not announced the discovery of any vaccine that can treat COVID-19.

column3: Drinking water every 15 minutes helps to avoid the contagion of cononavirus.
column8: It is false that drinking water every 15 minutes helps to avoid Covid-19 by "cleaning" your throat.

column8: It is still unknown whether weather and temperature will affect the spread of COVID-19. According to the United States Center for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC), it is currently unknown whether the spread of COVID-19 is reduced in hot seasons.

column8: It is still unknown whether weather and temperature will affect the spread of COVID-19. According to the United States Center for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC), it is currently unknown whether the spread of COVID-19 is reduced in hot seasons.

column3: Allegations, that garlic and cold shower helps to avoid COVID19.

column3: Martial law is imminent in United States.

column3: WHO director overstated COVID-19 fatality rate as more than flu.

column3: Remedy recipe: (1) boil tea with Bitter melon. (2) Lemon juice with salt or Chinese Mesona
column8: There is no evidence that the recipe can prevent or cure COVID-19.

column3: Video shows how American soldiers spread coronavirus during 7th CISM Military World Game in Wuhan.
column8: The video happened in Bruxelles on march. It is not happened in Wuhan or Taipei.

column3: In this video Putin said: “Powerful of the world, I am aware of his diabolical plans to reduce the population”.
column8: The captions were changed to make people believe that the Russian president said things he did not say at the time. The video was recorded at an event commemorating World War II.

column3: Spaniards are violating quarantine rules.
column8: The video was recorded in October 2019 days before the exhumation of the remains of the dictator Francisco Franco.

column3: The recommendations against coronavirus in the viral WhatsApp audio were made by the owner of Swiss Medical (private health insurence company).
column8: A report by the Conicet Sensory Research Laboratory indicates that, although it is limited, there is evidence that the audio does not belong to the businessman. The company denied that the audio was recorded by the president of the company.

column3: The WHO recommended that all countries go into quarantine to combat COVID-19.
column8: In networks and the media, it has been stated that the World Health Organization, WHO, "recommended that all countries declare themselves in quarantine to combat COVID-19". However, the WHO itself denied it.

column3: A video shows the Russian leader Vladimir Putin, giving a speech with captions that make him believe he is rebuking world leaders.
column8: A video is being moved on Facebook and Twitter in which Vladimir Putin, the President of Russia, is seen giving a speech in front of a crowd. The video is accompanied by Spanish subtitles that make it appear that you are criticizing the leaders of other countries for their recent actions. Some social network users even shared the video as if this were Putin's response to the handling that other countries have given to the coronavirus outbreak.

column3: The coronavirus was created in a biological laboratory in Wuhan.
column8: There is no evidence that 'the coronavirus comes from a biological laboratory in Wuhan,' as claimed by Mexican youtuber Alexander Backman.

column3: Polish charity organisation WOSP has withdrawn and donation to coronavirus fight in Poland.
column8: There was no decision of backing down whatsoever. WOSP couldn't possibly donate the money it collected during public gathering as there was clearly stated goal for that gathering that can't be changed afterwards. WOSP is involved in many activities supporting coronavirus fight.

column3: You no longer need to have contact with someone to get the coronavirus.
column8: Please click the link to read the full article

column3: Donald Trump said about coronavirus, “People are dying who have never died before.”
column8: Ernest Hemingway said it.

column3: IDH Hospital, main center in Sri Lanka for treating COVID-19 patients, is in shortage of number of assentials.
column8: We contacted both doctors and health officials and confirmed that there is no shortage of goods at the hospital as of yet and the messages were fabricated.

column3: You should leave your shoes outside, as they carry the virus.
column8: Official sources say this is not true.

column3: These images show coffins of COVID-19 victims in Italy.
column8: Images in question were actually taken in 2013.

column3: Chinese claim that the virus was created in 2015 in US.
column8: There's no evidence that supports this claim.

column3: Ibuprofen aggravates patients with the new coronavirus.
column8: There is no scientific evidence that conclusively proves ibuprofen aggravates coronavirus patients.

column3: 5G technology caused the coronavirus.
column8: The claim is false, not backed by scientific research, and many dates given to back up the theory are wrong or misleading.

column3: A row of coffins in Italy. Claims that this is how Bergamo in Italy deals with the dead from the virus.
column8: The photo was taken in 2013, amidst the migration crisis.

column3: Video showing police beating people in China, linked with the outbreak.
column8: The video shows police beating people in Hongkong. The video was shot on the last day of August 2019.

column3: Breathing air from a hair dryer or a sauna can prevent or cure COVID-19
column8: This is false; an expert in coronaviruses said these methods would not be effective, while a cell biologist said there is no evidence the virus can be treated via heat.

column3: A purported advisory has been shared repeatedly in multiple Facebook, Twitter and WhatsApp posts that claims a disinfectant will be sprayed into the air overnight in India in an effort to kill the novel coronavirus, COVID-19. The posts urge residents to remain indoors during the spraying.
column8: The claim is false; Indian authorities said the advisory was "fake" and that no such measure had been announced.

column3: In France, Mulhouse’s rink has been converted into a morgue.
column8: Mulhouse city hall and a hockey club, which is used to practising on this rink, had denied the claim.

column3: People who replied to a government text with texts saying they won’t respect confinement measures are now facing justice.
column8: The Nanterre Court denied having received any instruction to prosecute senders of these messages, and the messages present many inconsistencies.

column3: The RDC government canceled every future exams for pupils, because of coronavirus.
column8: The minister of Education, Willy Bakonga, denied this claim to AFP.

column3: Netflix is offering free access to anyone in Brazil during the coronavirus crisis.
column8: Netflix is not offering free services during the pandemic. The URL used is not a Netflix domain.

column3: Petrobras (Brazil’s largest oil company) is closing its refineries from March 24th onwards.
column8: The alledged press release did not come from Petrobras. Refinaries are not going to be shut down for now.

column3: A man claims his dog was vaccinated for coronavirus, thus the SARS-Cov-2 is not really a new virus.
column8: Canine coronavirus (CCov) and the novel coronavirus are not the same virus.

column3: Uber will suspend operations for 10 days in Brazil due to the pandemic.
column8: The alledged announcement did not come from Uber, and the company will not stop working during the crisis.

column3: Popular Cardiologist Devi Shetty talking about symptoms of COVID-19.
column8: The person in question is a different doctor and not the famous cardiologist.

column3: India asked for restriction of movement.
column8: The notification is from Malaysia and not India.

column3: India spraying pesticides at night to prevent COVID-19.
column8: Officials stated that no pesticides were being sprayed.

column3: Image claims to show dozens of coffins containing Italians who have died from COVID-19.
column8: The photo actually shows the caskets of African migrants who died in a 2013 shipwreck off the coast of Italy.

column3: Claim that an American soldier was intentionally spreading the novel coronavirus in Wuhan during the seventh CISM Military World Games in October 2019 with a video clip of a man purportedly smearing saliva on the handrail on a train.
column8: The video is authentic but it was taken in Brussels, Belgium, on March 10, 2020. The man is not an American. According to media reports, the man was arrested by the police on the same day.

column3: List of first COVID-19 patients in Guatemala with their personal information.
column8: The list was authentic (as confirmed later on by the Ministry of Health) but we explained that to share private information is not only risky for those in the list but illegal.

column3: As the US government moved to approve a $2 trillion stimulus package to address the impact of the novel coronavirus outbreak, a short block of text outlining Canada’s alleged response to the outbreak flourished on social media.
column8: The claims about school closings and economic support are misleading; no province has officially closed schools through the end of the year, only individuals directly impacted by COVID-19 are eligible for financial aid, and mortgage relief is granted by banks on a case by case basis.

column3: The Social Security System (SSS) in the Philippines “approved financial aid worth P20,000 for every member,” to assist those affected by the novel coronavirus pandemic.
column8: The SSS has not announced such financial aid for every member. On its official Facebook page, the SSS denied the claim, saying it was "fake news."
column9: websites dohnotice.ml, randomnames.club, gmanetworkupdates.ml, and sssupdates.ml

column3: “China is to blame because the culture where people eat bats and snakes and dogs and things like that, these viruses are transmitted from the animal to the people and that’s why China has been the source of a lot of these viruses like SARS, like MERS, the Swine Flu and now the coronavirus.”
column8: Experts said Cornyn's assertion that Chinese culture is at fault is inaccurate, as the threat of viral transmission from animal to human is not unique to China, and the risk of this kind of spillover is growing globally as humans come into closer contact with animals.

column3: Five Helicopters will spray disinfectants into the air to eradicate the coronaviruses.
column8: Similar rumors have circulated in multiple languages in many countries, including South Africa, India, USA. The version circulating in Taiwan connected to America. New York City Emergency Management Department has tweeted that the rumor is false.

column3: Says Donald Trump tweeted, “I ordered the Treasury secretary to send checks to Americans! First however, we will go through your social media history from the last 4 years and search for any post with #NotMyPresident in it. I wouldn’t think of offending you with a check if I’m not your president! #MAGA”
column8: Americans could receive a $1,000 check as part of an economic stimulus package that isn’t yet finalized. Donald Trump didn’t tweet that he would vet who gets the checks based on whether they support him.

column3: Says President Donald Trump said, “People are dying who have never died before.”
column8: We searched a number of databases and found no evidence that Trump, on March 18, said, “People are dying who have never died before.”

column3: The coronavirus “snuck up on us,” adding that it is “a very unforeseen thing.”
column8: Members of the Trump administration have been sounding the alarm for months. Public health experts have been warning for years about the threat of a pandemic.

column3: 2019 coronavirus can live for “up to 3 hours in the air, up to 4 hours on copper, up to 24 hours on cardboard up to 3 days on plastic and stainless steel.”
column8: Preliminary research indicates that COVID-19 can live for up to three hours in the air, four hours on copper, 24 hours on cardboard and three days on plastic and stainless steel.

column3: Chennai municipal corporation has asked all vegetable and fruit markets to shut down.
column8: No such order was issued. All vegetable and fruit markets are open in Chennai.

column3: This poem describes people applying social distancing during a plauge outbreak from the 19th century.
column8: The poem has been written by an American woman on her blog on the 16th of March.

column3: This text critically observes the behavior of the religious communities in Macedonia towards the Government’s recommendations to reduce the risk of spreading the coronavirus by limiting contacts and movement.
column8: The religious communities do not respect Goverment's recomendations. Last Friday, both the Islamic Religious Community and the Macedonian Orthodox Church did not take any steps to close the doors of religious buildings for the mass gathering of their believers.

column3: A sensationalist headline, mislieading readers: “Disturbing video: A proof that only today there are 349 dead in Italy, stay at home.”
column8: This text operates with outdated data.The figures published in the text are from 14 March. The article was published on 16 March at 11.12 pm, which means that at the time of publication on the Internet, the data from 15 March were available, i.e. 1,809 dead and 24,747 infected in total.

column3: Giant hornets migrated to Europe due to the outbreak of coronavirus.
column8: The authors of the article stole older material on hornets and climate change and wrote headline about coronavirus

column3: There is a Russian medicine that could be use against Sars-Cov-2.
column8: It is not the case.

column3: This picture showing lots of coffins was taken in Bergamo in 2020.
column8: The picture has been taken in Lampedusa in 2013.

column3: New coronavirus is being spread via Coca-Cola.
column8: No evidence shows the virus transmission via food. Coca-Cola products are inspected.

column3: New coronavirus can survive 9 days on the road; you should keep your shoes out, a doctor from Milan says.
column8: No Milanese doctor says that. No evidence shows the exact survival time of the virus on the road.

column3: Worst affected countries by coronavirus are along the same latitude.
column8: 1. The fact that large countries cannot be represented by a single latitude is conveniently ignored. 2. Further, all of the aforementioned cities and countries are not situated along Latitude 40 degrees.

column3: Clorox Already Knew About coronavirus And coronavirus Isn’t New Virus.
column8: The post claiming that the new coronavirus was known beforehand as Clorox label shows that it kills human coronavirus’ is misleading.

column3: Indonesian President Joko Widodo locked down 10 cities
column8: the Indonesian President Joko Widodo has not yet chosen the option to quarantine or lockdwon as a way to deal with the Corona COVID-19 virus pandemic.

column3: The People In This Video Are Falling Because Of Infection With Corona Virus
column8: The people in the three videos fainted due to other causes, such as epilepsy and fatigue. Two of the four videos also did not occur in Jakarta, but in Bali and Singapore.

column3: Novel The Eye of Darkness Predicts Corona as Biological Weapon from China
column8: There is only one similarity about the virus in this novel with the Corona COVID-19 virus, namely the name Wuhan, where the Corona COVID-19 virus was first reported in Wuhan, China. The rest, regarding the incubation period, death rates, and so on, is very different from the pandemic that is happening now.

column3: If we want to protect ourselves from the coronavirus, we must back away from all the climate change efforts we’ve been making.
column8: Some preliminary scientific publications report that SARS-CoV-2 may be less prevalent or less contagious in warm and humid climates. However global warming does not occur at a pace or magnitude that would prevent further SARS-CoV-2 propagation. In addition, scientists emphasize that virus propagation primarily depends on other factors such as existing immunity and there is currently no way to reliably predict the spread of COVID-19 on a warmer Earth.

column3: China has successfully tested an anti-coronavirus serum made in Egypt and presented in Beijing by the Egyptian Minister of Health.
column8: It's false. Neither Egypt has delivered a COVID-19 serum to China, nor has any treatment been released against those infected with the virus in either country.

column3: The spread of COVID-19 can be prevented with a “home-made vaccine” based on fruits and other ingredients.
column8: This is a hoax for citizens to open a potentially dangerous attachment.

column3: A hospital in Murcia in Spain has made a citizen appeal to make surgical masks.
column8: That has not happened.

column3: A video of a fire erupting inside a vehicle has been viewed hundreds of times on Facebook, Twitter and on messaging app Line in March 2020 alongside a claim it shows an explosion that was sparked by an alcohol-based disinfectant used during the novel coronavirus pandemic.
column8: The claim is false; the video has circulated in media reports about a car explosion in Saudi Arabia since at least 2015, almost five years before the novel coronavirus, COVID-19, was first detected in the Chinese city of Wuhan in December 2019.

column3: A claim that all fruit and vegetable markets in the Indian city of Chennai and across the state of Tamil Nadu have been ordered to close in an effort to curb the spread of the novel coronavirus has been shared in multiple posts on Facebook, WhatsApp and Twitter.
column8: The claim is false; Chennai’s municipal authority called the social media posts “fake”, and Tamil Nadu’s chief minister said that stores selling “essential items” such as groceries are allowed to operate as normal despite a nationwide lockdown.

column3: 5G Technology Believed To Have Caused coronavirus
column8: The claim is false, not backed by scientific research, and many dates given to back up the theory are wrong or misleading.

column3: “Ministry of Health ITALY released a small video, HOW the virus spreads!!!… BEST VIDEO. Please see ..how innocently it spread. SOAP is the remedy CLEAN/ WASH ur Hands always”
column8: The viral video is not released by the health ministry of Italy in the wake of coronavirus but it is long-existing on YouTube, we reached the conclusion that the viral claim is ‘Misleading’.

column3: The viral video claims to show the visuals of china police personnel trying to control the patients allegedly suffering from the pandemic.
column8: The viral video has nothing to do with the coronavirus outbreak and is related to police storming the metro in the wake of Hong Kong protests.

column3: Coronavirus can be cured by sniffing clove and camphor and by drinking water, the virus will go to the stomach and the acid in the stomach will kill the virus.
column8: Dr. Mohammad Imran, an Ayurveda doctor, said, “It is merely a rumor which has gone viral on social media .There is no scientific evidence which backs the claim that sniffing clove and camphor can cure coronavirus. However, natural camphor and clove does have certain health benefits as it can cure fungus and bacteria”.

column3: As coronavirus outbreak surges, PM Narendra Modi has decided to facilitate fellow countrymen with free masks under the ‘Swacch Bharat’ scheme.
column8: The government has not announced any such scheme under which it is aimed to provide free masks. The viral webpage may be a part of the decade-old phishing technique or it may be an attempt to collect the data. However, the intent behind creating this webpage is not yet clear but it is crystal clear that the webpage doesn’t belong to Indian govt and might be a venture of some fraudulent organization.

column3: Chinese intelligence officer terms the Novel coronavirus as a biological weapon invented by China.
column8: The viral post also claims that the damage caused by the pandemic is being normalized by the Chinese officials. The website which has published the alleged testimony of the said Chinese intelligence officer has published the report with the headline, “CORONA UNMASKED: Chinese Intelligence Officer Reveals True Magnitude of China’s Fake “Coronavirus” Crisis – 包含中文字符版本”. The story published by the Reddit community No Sleep is just a horror story and does not have anything to do with reality. the community itself terms it as a storytelling platform and not a true story publisher.

column3: Helicopters are going to spread ‘medicines’ againts the coronavirus.
column8: Defense ministry denied it.

column3: France has suspended payment of rent and taxes for citizens due to coronavirus crisis.
column8: The measures announced by President Emmanuel Macron are for SMEs in difficulty and include both payment deferrals and cancellations.

column3: La Paz, Gregorio Marañon or 12 de octubre hospitals are closing because the are over capacity.
column8: Madrid government denied it.

column3: The exams to access university in Valencia region will be delayed to August 10, 11 and 12.
column8: The Valencian Government debunks the hoax on its official social medio accounts.

column3: The Army is requisitioning coronavirus protection material in Catalonia.
column8: The Defense ministry denies the claim.
column9: the president of the chamber of commerce of catalunia presidente de la cámara de comercio de barcelona, joan canadell

column3: La Paz, Gregorio Marañon or 12 de octubre hospitals are closing because the are over capacity.
column8: Madrid government denied it.

column3: France will pay rent, light and gas during quarantine for its citizens.
column8: France is only paying for small company's that are not earning enough.

column3: Helicopters are going to spread ‘medicines’ againts the coronavirus.
column8: Defense ministry denied it.

column3: Peru has just nationalized hospitals and clinics.
column8: Peruvian government gave a temporary order for centralizing all the medical resources under the Ministry of Health authority during the emergency, but it's does not include the property of clinics and private services.
column9: gustavo petro, former mayor of bogotá

column3: People with A-blood type are more prone to get coronavirus.
column8: Study is not peer-reviewed and should not be published as established information

column3: Egyptian doctor has invented a fluid to treat coronavirus.
column8: WHO hasn´t informed about any cure or treatment specific to COVID-19.

column3: Maracaibo in Venezuela is the safest city to avoid coronavirus because it´s too hot, said Unicef.
column8: Unicef communicates it hasn´t publish that kind of information.

column3: COVID-19 is no worse than other outbreaks that have occurred in “every election year,” suggesting that the new coronavirus is being “hyped” to hurt President Donald Trump.
column8: Most of the dates cited to defend those conclusions about previous outbreaks are misleading or incorrect.

column3: Australian researchers have found that bananas can help prevent infection of COVID-19.
column8: We found the post to be False. There is no proof that banana can boost one’s immune system and prevent the disease caused by coronavirus. At present there are no medicines to cure COVID-19.

column3: Kitchen foods plus morning sunshine can prevent and cure coronavirus.
column8: At present there is no evidence to prove that eating kitchen foods like onion, garlic and lemondoes prevent or cure COVID-19 and the same is not recommended by WHO.

column3: Man contracts COVID-19 by eating mutton.
column8: It's a fake news card and the news channel has denied publishing any such news.

column3: A video shows Chinese police crackdown on suspected COVID-19 patients.
column8: We found the video to be False because this is an old video A from Hong Kong showing riot police storm a metro station to crack down on political protesters in the city.

column3: Image of coffins from Italy showing carnage due to recent COVID-19 outbreak.
column8: The image is 7 years old and is of the dead bodies of African immigrants who died while entering Italy.

column3: Clean your throat with salt water or vinegar to cure coronavirus.
column8: Experts confirmed this is a false claim.

column3: Spanish minister of agriculture called out football players for earning too much and showing lack of solidarity.
column8: The minister never made the statement attributed to her.

column3: A train carrying vaccines with the inscription COVID-19.
column8: Content seems to be digitally edited, and there is no inscription on that location on such trains.

column3: Evidence Shows The WHO Director-General Overstated COVID-19 Fatality Rate
column8: All evidence says the WHO director-general was on point. This is a ultra-conservative false spin on what the director-general said, getting many facts and medical numbers wrong.

column3: Trump Is Promising To Send Americans Checks – Only After Checking People’s Social Media History.
column8: This is a false tweet, though there have been real suggestions to have a stimulus package.

column3: Tom Hanks was arrested, with others, for pedophilia.
column8: Claim was called out by several outlets as a conspiracy theory, though Hanks and his wife did test positive for coronavirus.

column3: Claim that the coronavirus was created and patented in a French institute (Institut Pasteur).
column8: The video author refers to a patent filed in 2004 but this patent concerns another type of coronavirus. Moreover, filing a patent for a virus does not mean that it was created.

column3: Rodrigo Maia, president of the lower house of the Congress in Brazil, voted a law that forbids the president to close borders.
column8: The law doesn't turn difficult to close borders, because it is about migrants rights. And Maia didn't vote "yes" for it.

column3: “coronavirus victims are buried in the morning this Wednesday in Italy. Rest in peace”.
column8: The image was taken in 2013 by Tullio M. Puglia, for Getty Images. The coffins were used for the bodies of african refugees that died on a shipwreck near Lampedusa, south Italy.

column3: Goats in Ajmer, Rajasthan were found to be COVID-19 positive.
column8: The video is old and unrelated to COVID-19.

column3: Indian cricketer Sachin Tendulkar asked for meat shops to be banned in lieu of COVID-19.
column8: Claim was falsely attributed to the cricketer.

column3: COVID-19 passengers being disembarked at Senegal airport.
column8: Video was of a mock drill for dealing with hostage like situations.

column3: The COVID-19 has been invented by a big French public medical institute (Institut Pasteur).
column8: Big confusion between the 2003 coronavirus and the COVID-19.
column9: viral video of an unknown man

column3: Helicopters of the Argentine Air Force will spray disinfectant against the coronavirus.
column8: The alleged measure was denied by the Argentine Ministry of Defense. The same message circulates, and was denied, in different countries.

column3: Christine Lagarde said: “The elderly live too long and that is a risk to the global economy”.
column8: There are no written or audiovisual records of the former IMF director saying the statements attributed to her. In addition, the European Central Bank -inquired by Maldita- assured that Lagarde had not said that phrase. Part of the phrase attributed to the president of the European Central Bank (ECB) comes from a 2012 report by the International Monetary Fund (IMF) in whose presentation Lagarde was not present.

column3: Cali in Colombia is going to be quarantined, that is to say that for 14 days all commerce, supermarkets, shopping malls will be closed, no one can enter or leave by land or by plane.
column8: At the time of this publication, there had been no quarantine or trade closure in the Valle del Cauca capital, as a viral audio claimed.

column3: A photo shows coffins of people who died because of coronavirus in Italy – it shows that the virus is dangerous and you should stay inside.
column8: The photo is old and shows coffins of migrants who drowned at a boat accident at Lampedusa in 2013. But the appeal to stay inside to avoid infection with coronavirus is correct.

column3: Jobcenters (for unemployed people) close from today on in Germany.
column8: The jobcenters are not completely closed, they offer personal contact in emergency cases.

column3: Stopping breathing for 10 seconds will help you detect the coronavirus.
column8: It won't help you in detecting coronavirus.

column3: In Ecuador, Maritza Frías, former director of the Teófilo Dávila Hospital in Machala, and Mauro Calle, former manager of this health center, concealed official figures of those infected.
column8: Please click the link to read the full article

column3: Coronavirus phase 4 involves war code.
column8: Please click the link to read the full article

column3: “I’ve always known this is a real, this is a pandemic. I’ve felt it was a pandemic long before it was called a pandemic.”
column8: In January, Trump said there were no worries about a pandemic. In late February, he said the virus was “very much under control.” Trump did activate federal measures to contain the spread in late January.

column3: “People are going door to door in Colorado Springs stating they are COVID testing so they can rob people!!!!”
column8: Colorado Springs police said they’ve received no reports of robbers pretending to offer coronavirus testing.

column3: “U.S. deaths since 1/22 (2020): COVID-19: 27, flu, 4,700; abortion: 118,000.”
column8: The post’s numbers are inaccurate, but abortions do far outnumber deaths from COVID-19 and flu. The COVID-19 number is likely too low, and the flu number is too high. The number of abortions is roughly accurate.

column3: Says it was “unquestionably” not within his “legal authority” to postpone Illinois’ primary election by changing the date or shifting to vote-by-mail.
column8: It’s difficult to know for sure that Pritzker could not have done anything to delay the March 17 election. But experts told us the governor spoke correctly in describing the limits of his powers under existing law.

column3: Novel coronavirus can be eliminated by drinking lots of water and gargling with warm water mixed with salt or vinegar.
column8: At present, there is no study or evidence to support the claim.

column3: Trump use of data for deaths from swine flu and seasonal flu.
column8: Trump is comparing apples and oranges. The figures he cites for the swine flu and seasonal influenza are after-the-fact estimates that try to account for all excess deaths that could be, in some way, attributed to a flu infection. Studies indicate that the official lab counts may be missing as many as 9 in 10 deaths.

column3: Having a beard increase your chances of getting coronavirus.
column8: The CDC never told anyone to shave their beards, a 2017 graphic circulating the web from the CDC was put out to show the effectiveness of masks with facial hair. The work-place graphic is unrelated to the current coronavirus.

column3: Sweden refused to fight the coronavirus.
column8: Sweden has not abandoned the fight against coronavirus, although it has taken less stringent measures than other countries. Some of the statements in the checked article are completely made up.

column3: Taking a hot bath, breathing in hot steam or using a hand dryer to blow hot air up the nose are effective ways to prevent Covid-19, according to a lecturer in health sciences faculty at Ghanaian university.
column8: No evidence for claims, which go counter to WHO recommendations.

column3: An image shows a train transporting the Covid-19 virus.
column8: The dark wagons on the image are the ones used to transport oil and they have to obey the 4 letters and 6 digits rules. That’s not what happens with the word “COVID-19” that appears in the image. Also, the name of the virus is Sars-Cov-2 and not COVID-19 (that’s the name of the disease). If the train was transporting the virus it would mention “Sars-Cov-2” and not “COVID-19”.

column3: The UNHCR said ‘migrants and illegals’ in malaysia were resisting COVID-19 testing.
column8: The claim is false; UNHCR officials in Malaysia said the alleged statement is fake and condemned the erroneous claim for stoking “unnecessary fear and distrust”.

column3: A message shared on WhatsApp and Facebook claims that 15 coronavirus cases were linked to Burnaby’s Metrotown mall, in the western Canadian province of British Columbia.
column8: This is false; provincial health officials and the mall administrator told AFP that no cases are connected to the mall to date.

column3: This video shows a brawl this week which took place in a supermarket in Aubervilliers, in France, because of coronavirus.
column8: This scene actually took place in May 2019, according to a police source.

column3: This photo shows French nurses holding a sign to denounce police violence.
column8: It's a photomontage.

column3: Facebook post claiming that French animal shelters “are overwhelmed by the abandonment of dogs and cats due to the coronavirus”.
column8: SPA president told AFP the claim was false. However, he fears a saturation of shelters, closed to the public because of containment measures.

column3: Video shows Chinese police crackdown on coronavirus patients.
column8: The video actually dates back to August 2019 when anti-government protests were happening in Hong Kong. The visuals pertain to an incident of police crackdown at Prince Edward station in Kowloon where the police personnel and riot police arrived after reports of a tussle between pro-government and anti-government protesters.

column3: It is advisable to leave outside the shoes used on the street to prevent coronavirus.
column8: It is an unnecessary preventive measure because it is excessive.

column3: There are sanitary technicians who are going to inspect houses and seize cash.
column8: It is false that technicians and police agents have "free entry" in the homes

column3: A graphic has been shared in multiple posts on Facebook alongside a claim it contains a quote from Philippine Vice President Leni Robredo that bats are the “enemy” in the novel coronavirus pandemic. The graphic is attributed to Inquirer.net, a Philippine media outlet.
column8: The claim is false; the graphic has been doctored from an earlier Inquirer.net post in which Robredo was quoted about confusion surrounding the government’s response to the coronavirus outbreak.

column3: A flyer said to offer official advice about the novel coronavirus from a Veterans Affairs (VA) healthcare system in the US state of Oregon is being shared on Facebook.
column8: The flyer is fake, it was not issued by the Roseburg VA and health experts told AFP the advice it contains is misleading.

column3: A photo of a room lined with coffins has been shared thousands of times in multiple Facebook posts that claim it shows Italian nationals killed during the novel coronavirus pandemic in 2020.
column8: The claim is false; the photo actually shows coffins for a group of dead migrants at an Italian airport in October 2013 after their boat sank off the coast of Italy.

column3: A “Spanish biological researcher” saying “You give the footballer €1 million euros a month & a biological researcher €1,800 per month, and you are now looking for a Coronavirus treatment. Go to Cristiano Ronaldo or Messi & they will get you a cure.” A quote published with a photo of this so-called “spanish biological researcher”.
column8: The woman on the photograph is not a spanish biologist researcher, but Isabel Garcia Tejerina, an ex Spanish minister. The photo was taken during an interview, in 2018, long before the outbreak of coronavirus. There is no clue of this Spanish biologist researcher, whose name is never given in the publications.

column3: Jeanine Áñez, actual president of Bolivia, have COVID-19.

column8: Americans could receive a check for $1,000 or more as part of an economic stimulus package amid the coronavirus. A Facebook post about weekly $700 checks is a hoax.

Some doctors have also mentioned that breath test cannot help in finding out if the person is infected with coronavirus.

The news was also denied by HRT, Gol, Haber, Pogled, Flash and Hayat, while the Sport and Magazine plus portals deleted their articles.

column3: Medical University in Vienna has published a study regarding ibuprofen and coronavirus.
column8: There was no such study, Medical University of Vienna denied it and rated is as fake news. Relation between ibuprofen treatment and worsening conditions of patients with COVID-19 is still researched but unproven at the moment.

column8: Fibrosis has many other symptons and it is harder to diagnose than holding your breath for 10 seconds.

column3: WHO approves anti-Malarial drug Chloroquine for COVID-19.
column8: Fact Crescendo found the details mentioned in the news published by Economic Times to be False. WHO has not declared, approved or recommended anti-malarial drug Chloroquine as a treatment medicine for COVID-19.

column8: No such evidence for curing COVID-19 with green chiretta is recommended by WHO or Thailand CDC.

column3: Traditional Cures And Self-Checks For coronavirus.
column8: Our fact check reveals that there is no scientific evidence to prove that drinking water washes down COVID-19 and gargling with warm water & salt or vinegar eliminates the coronavirus. Similarly the self-check breath test for coronavirus is absolutely baseless.

column3: Video of Police in China taking into control suspected COVID-19 patients in the country.

column3: After husband tested positive for coronavirus, wife fled from Bangalore to Agra in India.
column8: The woman went to her parents place in Agra on 9 March, while her husband was confirmed positive for coronavirus on 12 March. Also, she didn’t enter Bangalore city. Karnataka government has also clarified that the woman didn’t flee to her parents’ place.

column3: 5000 million Rupees fund allocated by Telangana CM KCR for coronavirus prevention is entirely funded by Central Government.
column8: No, the entire fund is not given by the Central Government.

column8: In the video, American President Donald Trump hasn’t said that Roche Medical Company will launch the vaccine for COVID-19. He announced FDA’s approval of a coronavirus ‘test’ developed by a company ‘Roche’ to increase and accelerate the country’s capacity to test for the virus.

column3: 2000 people died of COVID-19 in one day (on March 15) in France.

column3: Brazilian singer Preta Gil was singing in a carnival “bloco” while infected with coronavirus.

column3: A mixture of vinegar and fabric softener is a better desinfectant than alcohol.
column8: Even when vinegar and quaternary ammonium included in some fabric softeners do have some antibacterial properties, its mixture is not more effective than alcohol in innactivating viruses and killing bacteria. This mixture is not included in the official reccomendations to fight COVID-19.

column8: Normal military movements ; nothing to do with the covid.

column3: Ibuprofen enhances the coronavirus.
column8: The World Health Organization assured that there is no proven evidence that the use of ibuprofen can aggravate the health of patients with this virus. Initially, he recommended the use of acetaminophen (paracetamol) to treat symptoms, but later clarified that he was "not aware of reports of any negative effects" of ibuprofen.

column3: This viral image of people lying on the street is related to coronavirus.
column8: The image was taken in Germany during an event commemorating the victims of the Nazi concentration camp in Katzbach.

column3: Gargling with warm water and salt removes the coronavirus.

column3: “Sunlight actually can kill the [novel coronavirus].”

column8: The video has nothing to do with the coronavirus pandemic. It was shot last year in September during Hong Kong's ongoing pro-democracy protest.

column3: Flu vaccine increases coronavirus risk 36%, says military study.
column8: More research is needed to provide a conclusive answer to the question of whether the flu shot increases the risk of non-influenza viral respiratory infections. It is important to keep in mind that while the flu vaccine cannot prevent COVID-19, it still provides several indirect benefits. For example, it reduces cases of flu and flu complications that require hospitalization, in turn reducing the burden on the healthcare system, which has become strained during the COVID-19 pandemic.

column3: A man is touching a push-cart with his tongue to spread the virus outside Lidl in Lithuania.

column3: A graphic has been shared in multiple posts on Facebook alongside a claim it contains a quote from Philippine Vice President Leni Robredo that bats are the “enemy” in the novel coronavirus pandemic. The graphic is attributed to Inquirer.net, a Philippine media outlet.
column8: The claim is false; the graphic has been doctored from an earlier Inquirer.net post in which Robredo was quoted about confusion surrounding the government’s response to the coronavirus outbreak.

column3: The indian government distributing free face masks.

column3: The Australian Prime minister is about to announce a national lockdown.

column8: Migal Galilee Research Institute, in Israel, is currently one of many labs trying to develop a vaccine agaisnt COVID-19. They claim their vaccine might be ready for tests in 8-10 weeks.

column3: President Donald Trump “will evoke (sic) what is called the Stafford act” and “order a two week mandatory quarantine for the nation.”

column3: Says Anthony Fauci’s statement that the coronavirus death rate is 10 times that of the seasonal flu is “a claim without any scientific basis.”
column8: It’s not yet known what the death rate from the current coronavirus, COVID-19, will be. But early data indicate it is more than 10 times higher than the death rate for the flu.
