column3: No coronavirus in Nigeria yet, according to pastor.
column8: The Nigeria Centre for Disease Control reported the country’s first case of coronavirus on 27 February – more than two weeks before pastor's video was posted on YouTube. A second case was confirmed on 9 March.

column3: Cristiano Ronaldo is going to transform his hotels into hospitals.
column8: It’s not true that the Portuguese football player is doing this. Observador spoke with sources close to the Hotels and the player and found out that it was false.

column3: Having a patent on a virus means we have created the virus.
column8: Other fact-checkers before us showed that this and that patent were not related to this coronavirus, but we realized that much of the claims are coming from a misunderstanding of what the word "patent" means in 2020, and especially in life sciences.

column3: This video shows Italian People greetings and clapping for China during the Covid-19 emergency.
column8: The video has been edited by adding the Chinese National anthem and a voice saying "Thank you China". However, the video is not related at all to China. On the contrary, people clapping in the video are supporting Italian healthcare personel during an organized flash mob.

column3: The word “coronavirus” used on various sanitary products suggest that the outbreak of COVID-19 is a planned operation.
column8: Term coronavirus describes a group of viruses known to man for decades.

column3: Gargling warm water with salt and-or vinegar kills SARS-CoV-2.
column8: No proof that salt and/or vinegar can kill the coronavirus.

column3: Clinics in the Philippines are turning away people with COVID-19 symptoms, because of a advisory from the department of health.
column8: The claim is false; the Philippine Department of Health denied issuing the advisory.

column3: Red soap and white handkerchiefs are good against the coronavirus.
column8: But the recommended practices are misleading; health experts told AFP there is no scientific basis for many of the claims, which include using red-coloured soap and white handkerchiefs, as well as obtaining specific light bulbs.

column3: Israel allegedly developed a COVID-19 vaccine
column8: The claim is misleading; the image used to illustrate a vial of the new drug is originally a stock picture while the MIGAL Research Institute in Israel, despite having a head start, continues to work on a vaccine for COVID-19.

column3: A video viewed tens of thousands of times on Facebook and YouTube purports to show billionaire businessman Jack Ma praising China’s response to the outbreak of the novel coronavirus, COVID-19.
column8: But the video has been doctored; the original video shows Jack Ma at a meeting of former Alibaba employees in 2018, at least one year before COVID-19 was first detected in the Chinese city of Wuhan; the voiceover in the clip has been taken from another clip which shows a different man speaking.

column3: A photo showing two military vehicles transported by a truck on the highway, near Paris, to be used for the French population’s confinement.
column8: The vehicle transporter and the army told AFP that it was a routine trip, unrelated to the COVID-19.

column3: Research made by scientists from the University of Queensland in Australia has proven that bananas improve your immune system and help prevent COVID-19.
column8: The University of Queensland dismissed the claim as false. In an email to Rappler, the university’s communication team said: “The video is fake and we would strongly discourage people from sharing this information. We would suggest you share your concerns with the social media platforms.”

column3: Cristiano Ronaldo transformed some of his hotels into hospitals to fight COVID-19.
column8: Cristiano Ronaldo refuted those claims.

column3: A large crowd in Paris protested against the lockdown.
column8: It was an anti-Government demonstration conducted by yellow-vest activities. As the protest took place on March 14, the French government had not implemented the national lockdown.

column3: The spread of the new coronavirus was planned by the Rockefellers years ago.
column8: Scenarios are widely used as analytical methods in simulations. Scenario, which elaborates on the pandemic threat, has nothing to do with the global conspiracy. It is about futurology and possible crisis response management.

column3: The World Health Organization offered the testing kits that they have available and to give it to us now. We refused them. We did not want to buy them.”
column8: The WHO never offered to sell test kits to the United States. The CDC opted to develop its own coronavirus test and did not use the WHO’s protocol for the test.

column3: Says Donald Trump “cut funding to the CDC,” “fired the Pandemic Response Team,” “refused WHO tests” and “wasted two weeks calling this outbreak a ‘Democrat hoax.’”
column8: Trump did attempt to cut the CDC’s funding, but Congress prevented it from happening. While officials in charge of the U.S. response to pandemics did leave in 2018, it’s unclear if they were “fired.” The U.S. was not on a list of countries receiving COVID-19 tests from the WHO. But the U.S. doesn’t usually rely on the agency for diagnostic tests, and the testing delay was due mainly to an error with the CDC’s protocol. While Trump has called the Democratic response to the coronavirus a “hoax,” he has not used the term to describe the virus itself.

column3: The claim that there is a cure from the new coronavirus. The name of the drug is decametoxine.
column8: There is no proof that the drug in question can be used in the treatment of coronavirus-infected.

column3: Pandemics happen every 100 years.
column8: Global pandemics do not occur every 100 years as God's or nature's scourge. The authors of this fake have selected only those pandemics, which fit into their explanation.

column3: The quarantine will last until the end of May in Ukraine.
column8: The fact that drinking alcohol can protect from new coronavirus has no clinical support.

column3: “COVID-19 started because we eat animals.”
column8: Scientists think COVID-19 originated in bats and then jumped to another animal host, possibly pangolins, before spreading to humans. As of now, there is no evidence that eating meat is the source of the coronavirus outbreak.

column3: “George Soros owns the WuXi PHARMA LAB located in Wuhan, China where COVID-19 was developed and conveniently Broke Out.”
column8: George Soros has invested in WuXi in the past, but he does not own it. Research shows the genetic makeup of COVID-19 precludes it from being man-made.

column3: Says coronavirus is just “the damn flu.”
column8: Coronavirus and the flu do have similarities in spread and symptoms, but there are huge differences in the death rate and ability to treat coronavirus.

column3: “So Oscar Health, the company tapped by Trump to profit from covid tests, is a Kushner company. Imagine that, profits over national safety.”
column8: Oscar Health does have ties to the Kushner family through Jared Kushner and more directly through Jared’s brother, Joshua Kushner. Oscar Health created a website for finding coronavirus testing locations. The project was launched on the same day that Trump announced a similar partnership with Google.

column3: Says businesses will give you free baby formula during the coronavirus outbreak.
column8: Several formula producers have released statements saying the rumor is a hoax.

column3: Study from Queensland Australia says that banana a day prevents COVID19 because of vitB6.
column8: The university mentioned in the claim refuted this claim. there is no scientific research till now says that banana or vitB6 prevent COVID-19 infection.

column3: Cristiano Ronaldo turned his hotels into hospitals.
column8: The claim is false.

column3: A meme posted offers mixed advice — some true, some false — about coronavirus protection.
column8: The claims in this meme are muddled.

column3: Left-wing Spanish politicians Irene Montero and Pablo Iglesias have private sanitarian services waiting in front of their homes.
column8: Madrid's Health Department, the emergency medical service and PODEMOS say it is false.

column3: A message chain claim that a message from Stanford hospital gives advice to frink water every 15 mintes in order to prevent COVID-19.
column8: A statement from the Stanford hospital distanced themselves from the fake message.

column3: Cristiano Ronaldo decided to turn his hotels into free hospital.
column8: Cristiano Ronaldo has never decide to turn his hotels in to free hospitals.

column3: Four young people have been hospitalised with coronavirus which has been exacerbated by the use of ibuprofen.
column8: The message, which was widely shared, had no basis in fact. It did not match the description of any patients in the hospital in question, and it misrepresented the dangers of ibuprofen

column3: “Bill Gates told us about the coronavirus in 2015.”
column8: In the 2015 TED talk featured in the video, he never actually uses the word coronavirus, nor does he mention COVID-19. But his comments do sound prescient. He talks about an epidemic and we’re now in the midst of a pandemic. People could be infected with COVID-19 and not show symptoms for days, if at all. And it’s mainly spread between people in close contact through respiratory droplets when someone coughs or sneezes.

column3: COVID-19 is large in size, where the cell diameter is 400-500 micrometers. For this reason, any mask can prevent its entry.
column8: The cell diameter is around 120 nanometers. The surgical mask can protect the wearer from sprays and large-particle droplets, but not against infection with coronavirus. People are recommended to wear a mask if taking care of a person with suspected COVID-19 infection.

column3: A video showing a man infected with coronavirus and touching pieces of bread in a supermarket in Europe.
column8: It's a set up video, published by a humouristic American Facebook page, called "The Philly offensive". The author of this page explained having filmed this scene, explaining he hates when people touch bread in supermarkets, but without mentioning coronavirus.

column3: Helicopter of the armed forces disinfects the streets at night.
column8: There is not such mesure of disinfectation.

column3: Graphics with information about COVID-19 containing Unicef branding and inaccurate information.
column8: A series of infographics with Unicef branding making claims about COVID-19 are not from the UN agency.

column3: A situation update allegedly from Kenya’s Citizen TV stating the number of COVID-19 cases.
column8: A post is with an update about COVID-19 in Kenya containing a screenshot of a Facebook post by Citizen TV is fake.

column3: A meme shared on Facebook and Twitter claims to show an image of fully stocked shelves of toilet paper, purportedly during the 2009 H1N1 outbreak, above another of barren shelves during the ongoing COVID-19 pandemic.
column8: The post is misleading; the image of the stocked shelves is a screenshot from US news footage shot this year, not in 2009.

column3: A video viewed more than 2.4 million times on Facebook urges people to inhale steam to “kill” the novel coronavirus.
column8: But experts say that doing so will not treat or cure the viral infection, and could in fact be harmful.

column3: A video has been viewed thousands of times in multiple posts on Facebook, Twitter and YouTube which claim it shows Chinese police arresting people infected with the novel coronavirus, COVID-19.
column8: The claim is false; the video shows police arresting pro-democracy protesters at a subway station in Hong Kong in August 2019.

column3: Chinese Intelligence Officer Reveals coronavirus is a Bioweapon.
column8: The story originated from a reddit thread which discusses horror stories inspired by true events.

column3: Indian Daily Reports That Wife Of A Positive Patient Ran Away, did not comply with the authorities and tested positive.
column8: The Indian daily misreported as the woman had not yet tested positive and she did not flee so as to not be tested.

column3: Audio claiming India would be put under a complete lockdown.
column8: The government rubbished claims of there being such a lockdown.

column3: Nostradamus predicted the coronavirus pandemic.
column8: The text used as proof is not found on Nostradamus' writings.

column3: Cristiano Ronaldo transformed his hotels into hospitals for COVID-19 patients.
column8: Cristiano Ronaldo did not say this and is not planning to do this.

column3: A ship from China is anchored in Santa Marta, in Colombia.
column8: The Yuan Shun Hai ship is not anchored in Santa Marta is anchored and does not come from China.

column3: Holding your breath for 10 seconds will tell you if you have COVID-19.
column8: This is not an approved method for testing.

column3: There are 30 cases of COVID-19 in Barranquilla, but the government is hiding them.
column8: At the time of publishing there were no confirmed cases.

column3: State of emergency begins on Tuesday, the 17th, according to article 116 of the Constitution
column8: The text is from Spain.

column3: Gargles with hot water and salt can prevent COVID-19.
column8: There is no scientific basis for this claim.

column3: China has successfully developes a vaccine ready to combat coronavirus.
column8: China announed the vaccine began clinical trial, not that it was developed successfully.

column3: A video shows an Italian doctor who says that nobody died only from coronavirus in Italy, that it’s not more dangerous than a flu.
column8: The video is from February when there were only 11 deaths by coronavirus in Italy. It is not possible to say whether people with prior diseases die only because of the virus. But studies show that also healthy people died so far.

column3: Cristiano Ronaldo will turn his hotels into hospitals.
column8: Information was published without verification and was denied afterwards.

column3: Lombardia, Italy, ask to Cuba, China and Venezuela to send doctors.
column8: Gallera really said that but the next day he explained venezuelan doctors weren´t related to Maduro but to Piccola Venezia, a local italian-venezuela NGO. China send doctors with no relations with him and was Cuba, and not him, which offers to help a week before his speech.
column9: said by giulio gallera, posted by many media and twitter users, specially related to maduro

column3: COVID-19 arrived in the US by train.
column8: The photo has been manipulated.

column3: “Italy has decided not to treat their elderly for this virus.”
column8: Italy, second only to China in the number of COVID-19 cases, hasn’t decided to stop treating elderly COVID-19 patients. But the elderly are a lower priority because they are less likely to survive, and hospitals are overwhelmed with coronavirus cases.

column3: Says that “over a 45-minute period that we had the press conference” on the coronavirus on March 13, 2020, the stock market set “an all-time record.”
column8: The Dow had a record-high point increase on the day Trump declared a national emergency in response to coronavirus, with the surge accelerating during his late-afternoon news conference. But that followed a record point decrease the previous day. And it was followed by a sharp drop by the opening of the next trading day, which saw continued declines before closing.

column3: Drink water a lot and gargling with warm water & salt or vinegar to eliminate the virus.
column5: Fact-Checked by: Sure And Share Center MCOT
column8: Whenever the virus get into your body, it infects to a cell, not just fall on a throat. Water can't clean the virus from an infected cell, and normally can't get to a respitory system where the virus stay.

column3: A Cuban vaccine cured 1.500 people infected with the new coronavirus.
column8: There is still no vaccine available in the market, according to Health Authorities. Experts estimate that it will take about 18 months to develop and test a vaccine that can be used with safety in human beings.

column3: A post says that if warm water with salt prevent the new coronavirus infection, killing it in the throat.
column8: There is no scientific evidence to support this theory. Several experts had already explained that there’s no connection between the act of drinking water and the virus.

column3: The Simpsons had already predicted the coronavirus pandemic.
column8: It’s not true, because the images that are shown to illustrate this were manipulated and are not in accordance with the original images of the series.

column3: Claim that football star Cristiano Ronaldo has converted his hotel chain into coronavirus hospitals.
column8: Please click the link to read the full article

column3: The novel coronavirus is not new.
column8: This is false; coronaviruses affecting cattle or canines differ from the new virus strain affecting humans, for which no vaccine exists.

column3: Ugandan president announces the postponement of elections.
column8: The claim is false; an electoral commission official issued a flat denial, labelling the claim “nonsensical”.

column3: This is a video purporting to show how the coronavirus is transmitted betwen people
column8: The claim is false; the video was produced by a regional hospital trust within the UK’s public healthcare system, the National Health Service (NHS), in May 2010 about how infections spread in hospitals.

column3: In France, a picture showing policemen spraying tear gas on nurses and a text criticizing Macron’s treatment towards health employees.
column8: The picture is said to have been taken "yesterday", ie during the massive demonstrations in favor of the public health services, that took place in France, from March 2019. The picture was taken in 2010, before Macron was even president.

column3: Cristiano Ronaldo will convert his hotels into coronavirus hospitals.
column8: A spokesperson for the hotels said the claim was “inaccurate”; Ronaldo has also not mentioned any such plan on his social media platforms.

column3: In Spain dozens of people faced beatings and shoves with the police because they prevented them from going to a mass to pray against COVID-19.
column8: The video has nothing to do with the coronavirus, nor with the state of alert decreed in Spain. In fact, when the video was originally released on October 14 last year, there were still no reports of COVID-19 existing in the world.

column3: European and South American flights cause chaos at Mexico Airport, due to coronavirus.
column8: The video was recorded in December and is not related to COVID-19.

column3: China benefited financially from new coronavirus
column8: Contrary to what the piece of misinformation suggests, the country's stock exchanges have suffered from the pandemic: two of its most important indices - the CSI 300, which brings together the largest companies in the Shanghai and Shenzhen stock exchanges, and the compound Shanghai - have fallen 8% and 0.94% since the beginning of the year. In addition, the coronavirus outbreak caused a reduction in economic activity in China, with a sharp drop in industrial production and retail sales and an increase in the unemployment rate in the first two months of 2020.

column3: Catalonia universities give all course credits to its students after clases being suspended.
column8: Education ministry in Catalonia denied it.

column3: Spanish home office has not issued a statement announcing the complete closure of Madrid, the Basque Country and La Rioja.
column8: Home office denied the autentity of the document.

column3: Felipe Gonzalez, ex-Prime minister of Spain, says that the Spanish coalition government cannot face the covid crisis.
column8: The Twitter account is a parody.

column3: The current coronavirus has been “manufactured” in Wuhan.
column8: There is no scientifice reason to belive that.The international scientific community condemns conspiracy theories and recalls that the current coronavirus originated in wildlife.

column3: There are one hundred children infected with COVID-19 in the main hospital in Lima.
column8: Authorities denied the information of one hundred children infectec with the virus in that hospital, the main public facility for the treatment of children in Lima.

column3: An American soldier has been paid to spread Sars-Cov-2 in Europe.
column8: The man is the sheriff's deputy Rick Grimes, the main caracter of The Walking Dead and the picture is a tumbnail of the 1st episode of The Walking Dead.

column3: Turkish President Erdoğan said that curfew is to declare due to COVID-19.
column8: The clipping of the Hurriyet newspaper is manipulated. President Erdoğan's speech did not cover such a measure.

column3: Two COVID-19 patients were executed in North Korea.
column8: Content belongs to a parody account. There is no declared COVID-19 case in North Korea.

column3: Italian airforce’s airshow to motivate the public under quarantine.
column8: The video is shared in 2019, september, before the outbreak. The plains do not belong to Italian army.

column3: Ireland is going to go into a full lockdown.
column8: Despite two messages which were widely shared on WhatsApp, the country did not go into a full military lockdown with the army patrolling the streets. Shops have not been restricted in their opening hours and public transport has not been cancelled.

column3: A Facebook post shared tens of thousands of times purportedly shows a rail freight tanker with “COVID-19” stamped on one side.
column8: The image has circulated globally but it is false, the tanker operating company said. And Railinc, a corporation that manages an industry-wide database, said there is no such mark as “COVID.”

column3: A graphic has been shared thousands of times on Facebook which claims that gargling warm water with salt or vinegar can eliminate the novel coronavirus, COVID-19.
column8: The claim is false; international health authorities and experts do not list gargling as an effective remedy or prevention method for COVID-19.

column3: Gargling salt with water “eliminates” the 2019 novel coronavirus.
column8: Local and international health authorities have said there is not enough study that proves gargling water with salt eliminates the novel coronavirus. To date, there is still no known cure for it.

column3: Former senator Antonio Trillanes IV allegedly posted a tweet saying that President Rodrigo Duterte is to blame for the calamities the country has been facing, including the novel coronavirus pandemic.
column8: The tweet came from an account posing as Trillanes. Using his official Twitter account, the former senator explained how the username of the account is different from the one he’s using.

column3: Astrologers had predicted the appearance of a coronavirus in 2020.
column8: Horoscopes and astro forecasts have no scientific basis.

column3: A graphic has been shared thousands of times on Facebook which claims that gargling warm water with salt or vinegar can eliminate the novel coronavirus, COVID-19.
column8: The claim is false; international health authorities and experts do not list gargling as an effective remedy or prevention method for COVID-19.

column3: Report that Cristiano Ronaldo will convert his hotels into coronavirus hospitals.
column8: A spokesperson for the hotels said the claim was “inaccurate”; Ronaldo has also not mentioned any such plan on his social media platforms.

column3: 37.000 US soldiers are entering the EU while everybody is busy with the coronavirus, the soldiers are immune.
column8: The Nato exercise Defender Europe 20 is no secret exercise, there are only 29.000 US soldiers and media reported about it for months. Further, it was stopped because of the coronavirus outbreak - soldiers are not immune.

column3: The University hospital in Vienna found out that Ibuprofen speeds up the spreading of the coronavirus.
column8: The voice message tells an untrue story and it is not clear whether Ibuprofen can have a negative effect. There is no proof so far that if affects COVID-19 patients

column3: A Facebook post suggests that drinking lots of water and gargling with warm water and salt or vinegar eliminates the coronavirus.
column8: The claim has not been corroborated by any health institution. The WHO says there is currently no specific treatment, drug or vaccine for the COVID-19, although some home remedies may provide comfort and alleviate symptoms.

column3: Quotes by Finnish national health authorities between 20th of January and 3rd of March taken out of context.
column8: Currently, an image with the title "THL and coronavirus in the news" is being circulated in social media, gathering comments from the National Institute for Health and Welfare on coronavirus from January to March. The statements quoted by THL experts are quoted but appear to be largely inaccurate when removed from context. The list as a whole is deliberately misleading. Its purpose is to undermine the credibility of the responsible authority, THL, without providing it with verified information.

column3: Corporations invented the coronavirus.
column8: there is no evidence to support this claim.

column3: Curfew Issued For Bossier City Due To coronavirus.
column8: The article itself says it's a joke and a prank.

column3: CEO Resignations Are Linked To Global Conspiracy.
column8: Some CEOs have stepped down since coronavirus outbreak, but there's not evidence to suggest it's all linked to a global power issue.

column3: Coronavirus found in crab legs.
column8: Image did not actually come out of real broadcast with typos, and came from an app that let people make their own stories.

column3: Military on streets of Philadelphia preparing to invoke martial law and bring citizens to FEMA camps.
column8: Lt. Col. Keith Hickox, the state public affairs officer said the information was false.

column3: Article overstates threat of coronavirus.
column8: The claims in the article are backed by science.

column3: Drinking lots of water and gargling with warm water and salt or vinegar eliminates the novel coronavirus. Spread the information as you can save someone with this information.
column8: According to GMA news report, saline gargles or gargling with water and salt will provide no protection against or cure for the 2019 novel coronavirus acute respiratory disease (2019-nCoV ARD). The report also carried a statement by the Dr. Eric Domingo “I think this is a home remedy that has been followed for many, many generations and I don’t think there’s going to be any harm in doing it. Saline gargle has always been advocated to improve mostly symptoms of sore throat...I don’t think there is any evidence that it will kill a virus,” Domingo said.

column3: Eating salt on the onion will eliminate the coronavirus.
column8: According to the World Health Organization , eating onions increases the immune system . But it has nothing to do with the treatment of coronovirus. In the investigation we found that no cure for this virus has yet been discovered.

column3: Viral image with differences between a cold, the flu and COVID-19.
column8: The symptoms are not accurate.

column3: Singapore checks the Saliva of Indonesian arrivals at Changi Airport
column8: The COVID-19 swab test is only intended for tourists who have symptoms such as fever or other respiratory ailments.

column3: A Twitter post claimed Christiano Ronaldo is transforming his string of hotels to hospitals; to aid in the fight against COVID-19.
column8: A spokesperson from the hotel denied the claim. Moreover, there is no such statement present on any of the footballer’s media accounts.

column3: Advice about coronavirus prevention and remedies, allegedly from Stanford Hospital.
column8: Almost every advice listed in the original and widely spread Facebook messages was false. Facebook did not label these messages as misinformation (neither in English nor in Dutch).

column3: Staff of Gold Coast Hospital in Australia has gifted a volleyball to Tom Hanks in quarantine.
column8: The image has been morphed to claim that Tom Hanks was gifted a volleyball.

column3: An infographic has been shared thousands of times in multiple Facebook posts which claim it shows a nine-day timeline of the symptoms of the novel coronavirus, COVID-19.
column8: This infographic is misleading; it was not distributed by an official health authority and health experts say COVID-19 symptoms vary in duration and severity.

column3: Evo Morales (ex-mandatary of Bolivia) has COVID-19.
column8: Morales continue his normal activities. Moreover, on march twelve he posted in his Twitter account. Also, other followers of the political party Movement to Socialism (MAS) did not refer about the health condition of the ex mandatary.

column3: A post shared more than 165,000 times on Facebook includes a video of a woman turning a baby wipe into a face mask to “protect against coronavirus.”
column8: The company that sells the wipes says they should not be used in this way, and health experts also recommend caution.

column3: Eleven coronavirus patients visited malls and hotels in Metro Manila that are part of a “confidential list.”
column8: The DOH has dismissed the message as fake. The malls and hotels in question have also not posted any advisories regarding possible infection.

column3: A vaccine for the 2019 novel coronavirus has been found and there will be no more deaths due to the coronavirus.
column8: As of Friday morning, March 20, there is no vaccine or cure for the disease caused by the 2019 novel coronavirus and there have been 217,510 cases and 9,020 deaths, across 157 countries.

column3: “It’s actually the safest time to fly.”
column8: Older Americans and those with chronic conditions are advised to reconsider all travel plans to avoid COVID-19. The State Department is advising all citizens to reconsider travel abroad.

column3: Drinking “water a lot and gargling with warm water & salt or vinegar eliminates” the coronavirus.
column8: Neither drinking a lot of water, nor gargling with warm water and salt or vinegar, has been identified as working against the coronavirus.

column3: In South Florida “all children and adults must remain in their homes” due to coronavirus.
column8: We looked at announcements from several major local governments in south Florida and found no complete lockdown announcements. Gov. Ron DeSantis closed bars and nightclubs statewide.

column3: “President Trump, COVID-19 coronavirus: U.S. cases 1,329; U.S. deaths, 38; panic level: mass hysteria. President Obama, H1N1 virus: U.S. cases, 60.8 million; U.S. deaths, 12,469; panic level: totally chill. Do you all see how the media can manipulate your life.”
column8: Numbers that suggest H1N1 was worse than COVID-19 are misleading. It’s too early to calculate how deadly the coronavirus will be, but there are signs it’s much worse.

column3: Says the New York Times exposed the “real reason behind coronavirus hype: Crash the market to harm Trump’s re-election chances.”
column8: There's no evidence the coronavirus was manufactured. The New York Times story referenced was an analysis of how current events may influence the election.

column3: A photo claimed that military vehicles are combating COVID-19 in Palermo, Italy.
column8: Sicilian media wrote that military was indeed driving through Palermo, but vehicles were comng back from a military exercise and had nothing to do with the virus as at the time there were a handful of confirmed COVID-19 cases in Sicily.

column3: Spanish Ministry of Interior is closing-off Madrid.
column8: The ministry of Interior has denied releasing that statement.

column3: Drinking hot beverages prevents coronavirus infection.
column8: Fluid intake has nothing to do with the infection process.

column3: Audio from WhatsApp that says there are a doctor and two nurses hospitalized on the ICU in Terrassa (Barcelona)
column8: The hospitals in Terrassa deny this situation.

column3: Film ‘coronavirus’ predicted the current pandemic
column8: That's not the cover of the movie. The original name of the film in Korean is "Gamgi" (Cold), "Flu" in English, and it is translated into Spanish as "Virus".

column3: A viral message listing false and unrelated statements about coronavirus has falsely been attributed to the United Nations International Children’s Emergency Fund (UNICEF).
column8: No such advisory has been released by UNICEF. Nor much is known about novel coronavirus as it is a newly found coronavirus.

column3: Israel has manufactured the coronavirus (COVID-19) vaccine
column8: According to Isreal, work at The Biological Institute is going on and it may take time. 50 of the most senior researchers and scientists are working hard to prepare a vaccine. The Image which is being circulated along with the claim is a reference image, available on shutterstock.

column3: They are not looking for volunteers to be infected with SARS-CoV-2 in British laboratories for 4,000 euros.
column8: Headlines shared on networks do not specify that they will inject other coronavirus strains, 0C43 and 229E.

column3: Zhong Nanshan: shower may cause coronavirus infection according to cases in Hong Kong and Diamond Princess.
column8: Zhong said "sewer", but it was translated as shower in Chinese in one wechat account. Then Taiwanese media misunderstood as "shower" and interviewed Taiwanese officials and experts to command it.

column3: The Minister of Defense of Japan posted a tweet to thank Taiwan for donating 500,000 face masks.
column8: It is a fake tweet.

column3: Asterix comics in 1981 mentioned coronavirus, French people knew the outbreak in advance.
column8: Coronaviruses had been known for a while and are not only referring to COVID-19. 1981 Asterix comic books did not mention coronavirus. The issue from 2017 did refer to coronavirus, but it has nothing to do with the current outbreak.

column3: A Turkish citizen in Yozgat ate yogurt and soap together to get rid of the virus.
column8: The news first published in an parody site. There is no such a guy in Yozgat nor the doctors mentioned.

column3: Central government has announced blanket holiday for schools/colleges in 4 states in India.
column8: Please click the link to read the full article

column3: The health service in Ireland is asking people to stockpile food.
column8: The claim was untrue. The health service is not urging people to stockpile food - in fact, the opposite is true - and the supply chains in Ireland remain robust

column3: Ireland is going into a ‘Status Red’ lockdown with the military patrolling the streets.
column8: The claim was untrue. Ireland has not gone into lockdown

column3: COVID-19 Breeds Rapidly In Toilet Paper.
column8: Post claiming COVID-19 breeds rapidly in toilet paper is fake. The post is taken from an unauthentic website.

column3: Indian Ministry of Health and Family Welfare as issued an office memorandum declaring compulsory holiday in four Indian states.
column8: Ministry of Health India has denied any such notification.

column3: The claim that a scientific paper published in Nature in 2015, shows that the new virus was developed in labs.
column8: On the contrary, the authors state that viruses similar to SARS have been detected in populations of bats.

column3: image showing italian doctors exhausted and sleeping.

column8: NY Mayor Bill de Blasio tweeted it was a false alarm.

column3: Claim that notes from an “uncle” who “graduated with a master’s degree” and worked at Shenzhen Hospital is advice on COVID-19 symptoms and treatment.
column8: Based on the evidence, AAP FactCheck found the post to contain a mixture of true and false claims. A runny nose, sputum, dry cough and pneumonia can be symptoms of COVID-19 however not everyone infected with the disease will have them. Disease expert Prof Collingnon says temperatures around 26 to 27 degrees C won’t kill the virus however UV light from the sun can be effective in drying out the virus. Understanding of how long COVID-19 survives on surfaces is limited, with the WHO referring to previous studies of other viruses to estimate a range of a few hours to a few days. Drinking warm water, avoiding iced drinks and gargling warm salt water are not treatments or preventions, according to Prof Cunningham, however staying hydrated is important and gargling may relieve sore throats. The timeline for progression of COVID-19 symptoms is partly accurate but not everyone will experience all of these symptoms or in that order. Prof Cunningham also said it was not accurate to say infection will happen first in the throat, as the delicate tissues behind the nose are more likely starting points.

column3: Ancient herbal drink is an efffective remedy for the novel coronavirus.
column8: Experts advise against using herbal remedies to treat coronavirus

column3: False COVID-19 hotline number shared in Canada.
column8: 811 is not an official public health hotline in Ontario, and the provincial ministry of health is not organizing home visits, a spokeswoman told AFP.

column3: Israel has no cases of the coronavirus because it developed a cure.
column8: Official World Health Organization (WHO) data and Israeli media reports state at least 298 people have been confirmed to have contracted the disease as of March 16; Israel has implemented travel restrictions and closed businesses in response to the spread of COVID-19. Various countries have been working develop a vaccine for COVID-19 and WHO guidance currently states there is no "cure" for the virus to date.

column3: Claim that COVID-19 has been around for a long time, with a photo of an animal vaccine labeled “coronavirus”.
column8: The coronavirus affecting these animals is different from the virus that appeared a few months ago in China, for which there is no vaccine.

column3: A photo showing full vegan supermarkets’ shelves, next to empty ones, with a caption saying “even at a time of coronavirus, no one wants to eat vegan”.
column8: The photo had been circulating on the Internet for two years and a half.

column3: After the closure of schools in France, president Emmanuel Macron announced classes next summer to catch up.
column8: Emmanuel Macron has not made such announces. It was published from a fake account.
column9: fake twitter account of emmanuel macron

column3: Cuba developed a coronavirus vaccine.
column8: Cuban medication has been used for treating COVID-19 in China, but it is not a vaccine and the substance has been discovered elsewhere.
column9: olho aberto pr and other media

column3: Holding your breath without coughing will tell you if you have COVID-19
column8: False, having difficulty breathing is a feature of any respiratory illness and not a sign of coronavirus.

column3: Books Predicted The coronavirus Before it happened.
column8: One book does have a close enough accurate representation, the second is a work of fiction.

column3: India Announced Holidays for 4 States.
column8: No such letter was issued by the government.

column3: Israel and USA have come up with a vaccine.
column8: Israel has found a vaccine with properties similar to COVID-19, San Diego had developed an algorithm.

column3: Viral video suggests the two cases of coronavirus in Ghana tested negative.
column8: The video is not new. It was part of a news item published by Citi TV on February 6, 2020, when two suspected cases tested negative.

column3: Viral post suggests Dettol sanitizer can kill coronavirus.
column8: Dettol has been tested on, and found to kill coronaviruses such as Middle East Respiratory Syndrome (MERS) and Severe Acute Respiratory Syndrome (SARS). However, the manufacturer of Dettol, Reckitt Benckiser Group plc(RB), says it has not yet tested its products on the novel coronavirus and could not confirm whether Dettol is effective against the new coronavirus strain.

column3: A misleading chart being spread on Facebook, erroneously dubbing the new coronavirus the “least deadly virus.”
column8: The chart cites old data about coronavirus cases and deaths, and it contains an error that makes COVID-19 look less fatal than the 2009 H1N1 “swine flu” outbreak.

column3: An image on Facebook claimed that hundreds of infected people are hidden in Lithuanian hospitals, and were taken to crematoriums.
column8: The original message was published by a prank generating Facebook account and repackaged to look as if it was real.

column3: Says Tom Hanks has a volleyball to keep him company while he’s quarantined.
column8: The image of Tom Hanks apparently holding a Wilson volleyball during his COVID-19 quarantine comes from a satirical Australian website.

column3: Of the Trump administration’s European travel restrictions that exempt the U.K.: “Well, you can just get into the Chunnel, and you’ll be in the U.K.”
column8: It isn’t that easy to get around the restrictions by taking a train linking England and France.

column3: A video has been viewed hundreds of thousands of times on Facebook, Twitter and YouTube alongside a claim it shows a shaman curing a novel coronavirus patient in Malaysia.
column8: The claim is false; the video has circulated online in posts about a hospital in Indonesia since at least October 2018, more than one year before COVID-19 was first detected in the Chinese city of Wuhan.

column3: A fake quote of Vice President Leni Robredo suggesting to “inhale cough back” to prevent the spread of the 2019 novel coronavirus.
column8: The Vice President did not say what was attributed to her in the graphic. News5 said the graphic was edited using their template.

column3: Says if you donate blood, “they HAVE to test you” for coronavirus.
column8: Blood donors don’t get a coronavirus test if they donate blood.

column3: “During the 2009 swine flu outbreak, Biden made reckless comments unsupported by science & the experts. The Obama Admin had to clean up his mess & apologize for his ineptitude.”
column8: During the 2009 swine flu outbreak, Biden said he would advise his family against traveling in confined places and said when one person sneezes “it goes all the way through an aircraft.” Scientists say that’s not how germs spread. Biden’s comments were met with backlash and his spokesperson issued a clarification.

column3: Donald Trump claims Joe Biden “was in charge of the H1N1 Swine Flu epidemic which killed thousands of people. The response was one of the worst on record. Our response is one of the best, with fast action of border closings & a 78% Approval Rating, the highest on record. His was lowest!”
column8: Joe Biden was not in charge of the Obama administration’s H1N1 response. Trump overstated public confidence in his administration’s response to the coronavirus and downplayed confidence in the Obama administration’s response to H1N1.

column3: Says Nancy Pelosi was “caught trying to include abortion funding in bill to combat coronavirus.”
column8: The U.S. House passed a measure that provides federal funds to people affected by the coronavirus. The bill covers reimbursement laboratory costs for COVID-19 testing. Some raised concerns that language was needed to specifically ensure abortion services weren’t eligible to receive funds. The language was amended by Democrats to limit reimbursements to COVID-19 expenses.

column3: “‘The Simpsons’ predicted Tom Hanks getting coronavirus in 2007.”
column8: In the closing credits of “The Simpson Movie,” Hanks says: "This is Tom Hanks, saying, if you see me in person, leave me be." The movie is about an environmental crisis. There’s no reference to any kind of outbreak.

column3: “The CDC can detain anyone with a fever — indefinitely. … Vaccination (is) a way people could get out of detention.”
column8: In the United States, people can’t be quarantined for just having a fever; they have to be shown to have been exposed to one of a specific set of diseases. Most quarantines are done voluntarily, not by force of the government. And vaccination is not a ticket out of quarantine. Most quarantine decisions are up to states and localities, rather than the CDC.

column3: Says COVID-19 came to the United States in 2019.
column8: The first confirmed COVID-19 case in the United States was reported on Jan. 20, 2020. The patient was a man who had recently returned to Washington state from Wuhan, China.

column3: The new coronavirus dies when a temperature around is 26-27 degrees Celsius.
column8: The virus doesn't die when the temperature is around 27-28 degrees Celsius.

column8: Saint Luke's Hospital hasn't released any such advisory.

column8: An original photo shows a sign that informs of a road maintanance project. Whereas the fake one claimed that a city is being cut off.

column8: A statement from the Stanford hospital distanced themselves from the fake message.

column3: Most affected countries by COVID-19 are along the same 40-degree North latitude.
column8: 40-degree North latitude passes through some of the countries most affected by COVID-19 but does not pass through half of the locations given in the post. Also, it does not touch Wuhan (Hubei Province – where around 60% of all the positive cases are reported), which is at around 30-degree North latitude.

column3: 3,500 italians potentially infected with the novel coronavirus arrived in Brazil in a cruiseship
column8: The photo that has been shared with the misinformation piece is from the Costa Fascinosa cruise, and the company responsible for the vessel reported that all of its passengers in Brazil are from South America. The ship left Italy on November 17, 2019, has passed through France and Spain and has been on the Brazilian coast since December 2, two months before Italy confirmed its first coronavirus case.

column3: The Brazilian government released additional money for beneficiaries of Bolsa Família, a national conditional cash transfer programme.
column8: The Ministry of Citizenship, responsible for the program, denied on its social networks that there will be such a release and stated that it only announced the inclusion of 1.2 million families in Bolsa Família. In addition, messages circulating on WhatsApp with this misinformation (see here) bring links to fake websites.

column3: Argentine President Alberto Fernández said that coronavirus dies at 26 degrees celsius.

According to the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC), it is not yet known whether climate and temperature affect the spread of COVID-19. There is still no scientific consensus on the impact of room temperature on this particular virus.

column8: Health insurance companies said they will waive costs for coronavirus tests, not treatment. A shortage in diagnostic supplies means that testing is limited.

column8: MSNBC panelists compared former President George W. Bush’s response to Hurricane Katrina to President Donald Trump’s response to the coronavirus outbreak, and speculated it could hurt his popularity.

column3: Airports and train stations in Lithuania are being closed down.

column3: COVID-19 is cured with hot water and baking soda.
column8: Mortality statistics indicate that seasonal flu is at least 60 times less deadly than COVID-19 (based on current data). Hot water and soda have no proven effects to help combat the novel coronavirus.

column3: Claim that disease outbreaks and pandemics correspond with election years.
column8: Based on the evidence, AAP FactCheck found no correlation between election years and virus outbreaks. The outbreaks of SARS, Bird Flu and COVID-19 do not line up with the dates claimed in the post. In the case of Zika virus, the disease has had multiple outbreaks since 2014 in parts of Oceania and in Brazil. Bird Flu, MERS and Ebola have not been reported in Australia and have not been a significant feature of local political discussion or debate. Considering overseas elections, such as US presidential elections, there is also no consistent pattern of outbreaks occurring in election years.

column3: Photo purportedly showing Tom Hanks holding a volleyball, claiming the hospital staff in Australia gave it to him as a tribute and to cheer him up while in quarantine.
column8: The image has been doctored using a 2015 photograph of Hanks and a stock photo of a hospital ward; the doctored photo emerged on a satirical website.

column3: Infographic claiming that the coronavirus pandemic fits a pattern of viral outbreaks that occur every 100 years.
column8: The infographic contains inaccurate information about historical viral outbreaks and ignores other epidemics that do not fit the assumed pattern; health experts told AFP that while certain viruses are seasonal in nature, there is no basis for the claim that viral outbreaks occur once every century.

column3: Photos showing empty shelves at supermarkets.
column8: The photos have circulated online since 2015.

The World Health Organization does not recommend any medication, including antibiotics, as a prevention or treatment of COVID-19. Meanwhile, the AYUSH Minister AYUSH Minister Mr. Padnaik also said that they never claimed that arsenic album 30 can cure corona virus.

column3: Seven ambulance workers infected with coronavirus in Catalonia.
column8: Health ministry of Catalonia explained that there are no ambulance workers infected.

column8: A video claiming to show a coronavirus being extracted for a man’s upper lip is of a botfly larva.

column8: Ugandan authorities did not deport 19 passengers on a KLM flight from Amsterdam to Entebbe. The passengers did not show 'severe' flu-like symptoms.

column8: Restrictions on the entry of migrants from China have been done earlier by the government, namely on February 5, 2020. In addition to stopping flights to and from China, the government has also temporarily suspended the issuance of Visa and Arrival Visas for Chinese citizens.

column8: The post was not from UNICEF. UNICEF has denied this information circulating in a number of countries, including in Indonesia.

column3: Cow Urine and Feces Can Treat Corona Virus 2019
column8: Until now, there has been no health organization that states that there are drugs or vaccines to prevent and treat COVID-19.

column3: Coronavirus dies at a temperature above 26 – 27 degrees Celcius as per UNICEF.
column8: The viral message on novel coronavirus is NOT issued by UNICEF.

column3: Indian yogu guru Baba Ramdev has been infected with coronavirus.
column8: An old picture of Ramdev from the year 2011 is being shared with a false caption. The picture was taken in Dehradun after the yoga guru broke his nine-day fast. He had been on a hunger strike demanding tougher a law against corruption and seeking the return of black money stashed abroad.

column3: Quito is the second city with the highest probability of infection.

column8: Anti- Malaria drug Chloroquine is not an authorized medicine to cure coronavirus. There is no scientific evidence to prove that Chloroquine can be used to cure COVID-19.

column3: No more deaths from COVID-19 as Israel scientists have discovered a vaccine for COVID-19.
column8: Various vaccines proposed by Israel scientists and other researchers across the world are under development and are yet to be cleared for production and distribution. Israel’s MIGAL Research Institute is also in the process of producing a vaccine for COVID-19. According to WHO, as on 11 March 2020, there is no vaccine for COVID-19.

The image of a supermarket shelf full of vegan foods while the shelves either side remain empty has nothing to do with the COVID-19 coronavirus outbreak. It was originally taken in 2017 in the United States when Hurricane Harvey hit the southern state of Texas.

column3: Chart compares COVID-19 with other longstanding diseases.

But there is no indication that hospitals are preparing, covertly, for an outbreak of that magnitude, as this headline suggests.

column8: COVID-19 spreads in Indonesia because there are Indonesian citizens who have contact with foreign citizens who have previously been exposed to the Corona 2019 virus. So far, research results show that pigs only carry one virus that can be transmitted to humans, namely the H1N1 virus that causes swine flu.

column3: Every election year has a disease; coronavirus has a contagion factor of 2; coronavirus has a cure rate of 99.7% for those under 50 it infects.
column8: Every year in the U.S. is an election year, if taking into account midterm elections as well as presidential elections, and contrary to the claim, not every election year has had a disease outbreak, as implied in the claim. In addition, the transmissibility of the coronavirus, represented by the “basic reproduction number”, is still under study. Currently, the basic reproduction numbers reported for the virus causing COVID-19 range between around 2 to more than 6.

column3: The coronavirus outbreak is not actually caused by a virus, but by 5G technology.
column8: There is no causal link between COVID-19 and 5G technology. The cause of the disease has been definitively identified in scientific studies as a novel coronavirus. 5G technology uses low-energy radio waves, which do not damage DNA or cells unlike ionizing radiation.

column3: Shanghai Government Officially Recommends Vitamin C for COVID-19.
column8: Intravenous high-dose vitamin C has been used to treat patients with COVID-19 in certain Chinese hospitals, but it has not been recommended by the Shanghai government as claimed. The OMNS article also cherry-picks the treatment’s potential benefits from two reports, leaving out the potential side effects, including nausea and kidney stones, and failing to mention contraindications for pregnant women and individuals with cancer and other medical conditions.
column9: andrew w. saul, orthomolecular medicine news service

column3: Claim that photos show dogs being killed in China as part of efforts to combat COVID-19.
column8: Based on the evidence, AAP FactCheck found the post to be partly false. While there are media reports concerning pets being killed in China because of fears over the spread of COVID-19, they remain unverified and have been denied by authorities. The photos accompanying the Facebook post are unrelated to COVID-19. It is true that World Health Organization’s advice is there is no evidence that companion animals/pets can be infected with COVID-19 despite a single case in Hong Kong of a dog testing “weak positive”.

column3: “The Obama administration made a decision on testing that turned out to be very detrimental to what we’re doing” on the coronavirus.
column8: The “decision” Trump is talking about had its roots in a 2004 law, when George W. Bush was president. The FDA’s policy pre-dated the Obama administration.

column3: The Obama administration “didn’t do anything about” swine flu.
column8: The Obama administration responded with two emergency declarations, triggering billions in spending and other public health responses.

column3: “With regard to the cost, let me be very clear: HHS has designated the coronavirus test as an essential health benefit. That means, by definition, it’s covered in the private health insurance of every American, as well as covered by Medicare and Medicaid.”
column8: Pence’s claim over simplifies what is involved in making this coverage assurance because a large swath of private health insurance falls beyond these categories. His statement fails to acknowledge the need for action at the state level and from the private sector.

column3: Trump’s effort to blame Obama for sluggish coronavirus testing.
column8: Trump is looking for scapegoats to excuse his administration’s sluggish efforts to expand testing. But he cannot blame Obama. There was no “Obama rule,” just draft guidance that never took effect and was withdrawn before Trump took office.

column3: The media group Globo published a photo of the dead of the Lampedusa shipwreck as if it were victims of COVID-19.

G1, a site that belongs to Globo, even denied a piece of misinformation that circulated in March and attributed the same image of coffins to the pandemic.

column3: A post says that a “poll finds 38% of Americans Say They Will Not Drink Corona Beer Because of Virus.”
column8: The poll was conducted by a PR firm. The firm did not release full details about the poll.

column3: “Every election year has a disease” … SARS in 2004; avian flu in 2008; swine flu in 2010; MERS in 2012; Ebola in 2014 and 2018; Zika in 2016 and the coronavirus in 2020.
column8: Most of these diseases were discovered and spread before the election years and were minimally mentioned during campaigns. SARS, avian flu and MERS had virtually no effect on the U.S. during election years.

column3: COVID-19 is just a big flu.
column8: It is far too soon to make such assumptions. Statistics of the first months of the pandemia show that it is not just a genuine virus.

column3: ”America has been vaccinating cattle for coronavirus for years, yet the news tells you it’s new and gunna kill you all so go buy mask.”
column8: The vaccine for cattle won’t help humans, and won’t protect against this new form of coronavirus.

column3: Post says “the blood test for coronavirus costs $3,200.”
column8: The CDC isn’t charging for coronavirus testing but patients could be stuck with associated costs, such as a trip to the emergency room. In Florida, a man who worried he was infected initially faced a $3,270 bill even though he never received a coronavirus test.

column3: Post says starting in March if you travel outside of the United States you won’t be allowed back in the country “due to high risk of the coronavirus.”
column8: As of March 6, there is currently no mandate that states Americans are barred from returning to the U.S. from anywhere overseas.

column3: “Akira’ is a 1988 movie about an apocalyptic event taking place months before Tokyo 2020 Olympics, showing the (World Health Organization) advising Japan to postpone the Olympics because of a pandemic risk”.
column8: The movie does not feature a pandemic of any sort. The WHO is never mentioned in the movie.

column3: A video has been viewed thousands of times on Facebook and Twitter alongside a claim that it shows bodies being removed from a hospital in Iran during the novel coronavirus pandemic.
column8: The claim is false; the video has circulated in reports since at least August 2019 about a funeral procession for pilgrims who died during the annual Islamic pilgrimage to Saudi Arabia's Grand Mosque.

column3: A video showing chaos in a shop, claiming that people are panicking after a first confirmed case of coronavirus in Lithuania.
column8: The video was made in May 2018 in Romania, during a sale at a supermarket.

column3: Doctors in Japan advise people to drink water every 15 minutes to prevent an infection.
column8: WHO says drinking water does not prevent novel coronavirus.

column3: Vitamin helps against CoV.
column8: Health experts told AFP there is insufficient science to definitively say vitamin D can protect from the viral epidemic.

column3: Elections years in the United States coincide with major disease outbreaks.
column8: Several years of discovery or the associated spread of a disease do not match election years, national and international health organizations said.

column3: Cambodian Prime Minister has CoV.
column8: 2017 photo of the PM, treated for something else.

column3: Beef meat is the best vaccine against CoV.
column8: No study shows this.

column3: Tips against coronavirus like holding your breath and drinking water.
column8: These tips don't prevent infection with coronavirus.

column3: A Twitter page claimed shaving of facial hair ensures safety from COVID-19, further attributing the message to the CDC.
column8: Results from our research show that the message from Today.ng's article is a misappropriation of a 2017 NOISH publication; a notification directed at workers using respirators in carrying out their tasks. It has nothing to do with preventing the spread of coronavirus.

column3: Video of a roof full of bats claim to be the source of coronavirus.
column8: Recorded in Florida en 2011, not China.

column3: Coronavirus patients in China are being caught by officials on a highway.
column8: The video in the post is the video of a ‘Mock drill’. The China SWAT team in the video is ‘practising’ to deal with coronavirus patients.

column3: A monkey is been infected with coronavirus in this photo.
column8: The photo is a capture of a video taken at least two months before the first symtoms of COVID-19.

column3: Lectures have been suspended at the University of Sevilla due to coronavirus.
column8: The University has made a statement saying that the document that has been shared is false.

column3: A new case of coronavirus in Sacedón (Guadalajara, Mexico).
column8: Please click the link to read the full article

column3: An article of El Pais says there is a possible case of coronavirus at the hospital Gregorio Marañón, in Spain.
column8: El País hasn't published that article and the typography doesnt't match.

column3: An aritcle of El Pais says ther is a case of coronavirus at the School of Architects of Madrid.
column8: El País hasn't published that article.

column3: First case of coronavirus in Alcalá de Henares (Madrid).
column8: One screenshot shows a false article done with an app that lets you create these fake contents and the other one shows an article that HAS NOT been published by El Mundo newspaper.

column3: A brothel with 86 customers put in quarantine after a prostitute tested positive in coronavirus.
column8: It was a "satirical" content.

column3: Sevilla’s university has suspended classes because of coronavirus (February 27th)
column8: The institution denied it on its Twitter account.

column3: Doctor Gerardo Dovakin found a vaccine agains coronavirus.
column8: He is actually an actor, not a doctor.

column3: Honduras’s first confirmed case has traveled to Taiwan earlier, which means there is a severe community transmission in Taiwan.
column8: As to Feb. 27., 2020, Honduras had zero confirmed case of COVID-19. A Taiwanese traveler had once suspected infection, but she has tested negative afterward.

column3: Taiwan has severe community transmission. Many people died.
column8: As to Feb. 27, there is no evidence indicating the Taiwan government has hidden real COVID-19 figures or information. The Taiwan Central Epidemic Command Center (CECC) has a daily press conference to update the latest confirmed case number and has been considered reasonably transparent.

column3: The outbreak in Taiwan is out of control. President Tsai ordered to burn a corpse in front of the presidential office.
column8: It's a picture of a self-immolation incident in 2015 in front of the presidential office.

column3: Iranian clerics wearing masks after outbreak.
column8: The photo is old-dated and manipulated. It was taken in the funeral of Kasem Sulemani.

column3: Drinking water every 10 minutes can send the virus into stomach and kill it.
column8: Digestive system can not stop the respiratory system's work and the course of infection.

column3: WHO Has Issued Advisory Against Buying Of Holi Colors From coronavirus-Hit China.
column8: WHO hasn’t issued advisory against buying of Holi colors from coronavirus-hit China. The viral post is fake.

column3: Health authorities say shaving beard protect form CoV.
column8: It's a 2017 graphic regarding how to wear tight fitting masks for professionals.

column3: Airport in Karachi suspends all international arrivals during coronavirus epidemic.
column8: Pakistan's civil aviation authority confirmed international arrivals weren't cancelled at the time; photo corresponds with one that has circulated about flight suspended at the airport in march 2019

column3: Holding your breath can test for COVID-19.
column8: WHO and other health experts said there is no evidence to support this claim.

column3: Chloroquine cures CoV.
column8: Chloroquine showed signs on CoV according to a Chinese publication but it s not considered as a cure.

column3: This video of a person infected with coronavirus being detained by the police is not real, it´s a drill.
column8: This video of a person infected with coronavirus being detained by the police is not real, it´s a drill. It was shot last February 21 at Henan Tongbai by the police and the emergency response team.

column3: A case of coronavirus in the Argentine province of Santiago del Estero was confirmed
column8: There are no confirmed cases of coronavirus in Argentina at this date.

column3: A case of coronavirus in the Argentine province of Chaco was confirmed
column8: There are no confirmed cases of coronavirus in Argentina at this date.

column3: Argentinian doctor discovered a vaccine against coronavirus in Spain
column8: Is false that an argentinian doctor discovered a vaccine against coronavirus in Spain. The men shown in a photo attached with the message is an actor. The World Health Organization informed that "there is no vaccine and no specific antiviral medicine to prevent or treat".

column3: The WHO says the coronavirus might be spread via food.
column8: The WHO has no hints so far that infections with coronavirus via food are possible.

column3: Coronavirus is not reproducing in warm places.
column8: Other coronaviruses has started to die over 56°C but there are no studies about Covid-2019.

column3: Bleach or chlorine are useful to clean to avoid coronavirus.
column8: WHO confirms bleach and other desinfects might work to kill the virus.

column3: Iran’s deputy Health Minister: This year we have had 13,200 flu cases which caused the death of 108 people. Our population is a fourth of the US’s. Last year they had 28 million flu cases which resulted in 16k deaths. Yet nobody is restricting travel.
column8: Flu’s death rate in the US is less than 0.1% and moreover deputy minister’s comparison of flu and COVID-19 is misleading.

column3: The cover of a Tintin book titled “Tintin in Wuhan” that shows the character standing in an old Chinese market wearing special suits, while people are wearing masks.
column8: This is a doctored image that is made of frames from two different Tintin books.

column3: French far right leader Marine Le Pen says that the EU didn’t do anything against the outbreak
column8: The EU has activated the civil protection mechanism, launched aid program, mobilizes funds for research and called for more international cooperation and coordination.

column3: Lysol Products Can Kill Novel coronavirus.
column8: While Lysol products are advertised to kill 99.9% of bacteria and viruses, including coronavirus, the company is referring to previous strains of the virus. There is no known cure for the novel (or new) coronavirus strain.

column3: Italian Red Cross gives the recipe for making amuchina (hand sanitizer) at home.
column8: Italian Red Cross has never shared any receipe. The receipe shared isn't the real one and could be useful only to disinfect vegetables.

column3: A post say “hair weave and lace fronts manufactured in China may contain the coronavirus.”
column8: The U.S. Food and Drug Administration has found no evidence that the virus is spreading via imports.

column3: “coronavirus: Florida man arrested for robbery using cough as a weapon.”
column8: This screenshot of “breaking news” is originally from a satirical news site. If you look closely, you’ll see a news generator watermark in the top right corner, meaning the image was created.

column3: Says the CDC recommends men shave their beards to protect against coronavirus.
column8: A 2017 CDC infographic shows how facial hair could interfere with respirator masks. The graphic is unrelated to coronavirus protection and the CDC has not recommended people should shave their beards to ward off the virus.

column3: China took advantage of the coronavirus crisis to buy back stocks of its technology companies belonging to foreign investors.
column8: This is the story in full : Previously, stocks of technology companies, belonged to Europeans and Americans foreign investors. Due to the situation in Wuhan, Juan began to decline, but the Central Bank did nothing to support Juan. And when the price fell, below the allowable limit, XI JINPING gave the order, at one point, to buy ALL the shares of Europeans and Americans. Not only has China made $ 20 billion, but these days it has returned the shares of its companies to China. The story is completely fabricated and there is no evidence for it. In fact, the story was published back in 2014 - but it was not the Chinese but the Russian president at the time, and the emergency was not because of the corona but because of the crime. The media only changed the name of the country, the president, the currency and the reason for the emergency and re-published the story.
column9: local online media published it, then local member on parliament said it on tv, then other media picked up the story

column3: Russian CDC admitted that COVID-19 is human-made.
column8: The original document from the Russian health ministry only mentions that COVID-19 is a recombinant virus. It doesn't suggest the COVID-19 is a human-made virus.

column3: Many corposes floated in the river in Tainan, Southern city in Taiwan.
column8: They are stage photos from Korean movies "Deranged" and "Train To Busan".

column8: Legislator Kao denied making such a comment. There are several factual inaccuracies in the claim.

column3: My son, who works as a public servant in the Central government, got one box of face mask while the public is restricted to two per week.
column8: All public officials of the central government whose duty are not related to disease control are not allowed to apply for official face masks.

column3: Singapore government said the confirmed case no. 12 is a prostitute. As a result, many of her clients are under quarantine.
column8: According to the Singapore health ministry, case no. 12 showed symptoms during the family trip in Singapore. The department hasn't released the occupation of case no. 12.

column3: Multiple allegations around how coronavirus was produced by China.
column8: The alleged connection between tha spies is fictional. No scientific evidence shows the virus is produced as a bioweapon.

column3: A post say “hair weave and lace fronts manufactured in China may contain the coronavirus.”
column8: The U.S. Food and Drug Administration has found no evidence that the virus is spreading via imports.

column3: An information about a man allegedly selling medical masks for 80 denars on a bus owned by the Skopje Public Transportation Enterprise.

According to the status, the photo was taken in the town of Craiova, Romania, and not in Skopje, North Macedonia.

column3: Video showing Chinese officials detaining infected citizen, who refused to be checked.
column8: The video does not show a real event, but an exercise.

column3: A text post with instructions from “a Lithuanian doctor”, giving advice to potentially infected with coronavirus
column8: Text post is a false one since instructions to stay at home if infected were not given out by any authorities, some of the "facts" about the disease were straight up made up.

column3: Vaccine for COVID-19 has been found.
column8: Chinese ambrassador to Russia announced that they are making progress. No vaccine for COVID-19 yet.

column3: Said the mortality rate for the flu is “right around” that of the new coronavirus: “It’s right around 2%.”
column8: The mortality rate for the flu is considered by most experts to be about 0.1%. Estimates for the mortality rate for coronavirus are currently around 2%, but this number could change depending on how cases are diagnosed.

column3: The Chinese accept Islam en masse (20 millions).
column8: Video was published with misleading header. After our fact-check some authors changed descriptions for their videos but this hoax is still circulating on WhatsApp.

column3: A “Letter” from an uncle in Wuhan claims COVID-19 can be cured with hot water.
column8: There is no evidence hot water can cure COVID-19, other facts stated in the said letter are not accurate as well.

column3: CDC issued facial hair recommendation for novel coronavirus prevention.
column8: Graphic is more than two years old and is unrelated to current outbreak.

column3: There is a confirmed case of coronavirus in a Bogotá hospital.
column8: The case was never treated under the suspicion it was coronavirus.

column3: You can maintain the alkaline state of the body to avoid contagion.

column3: Is it useful to close borders to stop the outbreak?
column8: French medical experts say closing borders in order to prevent infected people from entering in France is ineffective. Likewise, health tests before entering the country have little effect.

column3: Hair Weaves And Lace Front Wigs Made In China Likely To Contain coronavirus.
column8: There is very little chance of coronavirus spreading this way, and there have not been any reported cases of this happening.

column3: Letters and packages sent from China can be a way of infection.
column8: Viruses can live for some time in objects like door knobs. WHO has declares COVID19 can't live very long in envelopes and boxes.

column3: Face masks are a good protection system against coronavirus.
column8: Masks are not a good way of protection unless your are a health professional or your are in contact with somebody infected.

column3: The new coronavirus was registered in 2004.
column8: It was another type of coronavirus that was registered in 2004, not the one that caused the current outbreak.

column3: School has been suspended in Catalonia until March 2.
column8: It's not a real statement by the Catalonian education department.

column3: New cases of coronavirus in Madrid linked to two universities and a club.
column8: Images of articles published by El Mundo related to coronavirus were manipulated.

column3: Photos of Muslims in Italy allegedly praying outside because of the novel coronavirus.
column8: The photos have been published long before the COVID-19 outbreak.

column3: Indian Government and World Health Organization advised people to not purchase colours from China for Holi.
column8: No such advisory was shared by the government or the Ministry.

column3: There is a crowd waiting to greet the Colombians living in Wuhan who are being flown to Bogotá.
column8: The images are from 2018, when crowds gathered to meet the Colombian National Football Team after the World Cup in Russia.

column3: In Poland, people who are not insured have to pay for medical test for coronavirus, so if they can’t afford it, they will spread it.
column8: He included a document from hospital which named the price for voluntary coronavirus test, for those who are not suspected of having coronavirus (they haven't been to affected areas nor they have medical signs of disease). Anyone who IS suspected of having coronavirus, will have medical examination free of charge, no matter if he's insured or not.

column3: China needs coronavirus SWAT (special weapons and tactics) police team to arrest this drop dead virus victim.
column8: Video shows a mock drill by Tongbai police practicing to take down coronavirus infected patients in case they are uncooperative.

column3: The claim that the book The Eyes of Darkness predict the spread of coronavirus in 1981.
column8: The book is a work of fiction that mentions a biological weapon called Wuhan-400 (Originally Gorki-400) that has no similarities to the COVID-19. The other page, is from a totally different book “End of Days” by American psychic Sylvia Browne.

column3: The name coronavirus on disinfecting spray can reaffirms that the virus was known before the outbreak and might be planned.
column8: Coronaviruses have been known for decades. SARS and MERS were caused by coronaviruses. The companies (Lysol, Clorox,etc) have stated that their products have demonstrated effectiveness against viruses “similar” to COVID-19.

column3: Coronavirus is bioweapon leaked from Wuhan lab.
column8: Already disproved similar claims. Scientists in Wuhan insisted no link between virus and labs.

column3: Bats that hide under Wuhan rooftops caused the COVID-19 outbreak.
column8: The video was recorded in the US in 2011.

column3: Video of a road traffic control in China to detect people infected with coronavirus.
column8: The video was filmed in China, but it's a simulation, not a real incident.

column3: Coronavirus patients are being “cremated alive” in China.
column8: The Chinese government has ordered the swift cremation of patients who die after contracting the coronavirus. But there is no evidence they are being cremated alive.

column3: Evidence indicates COVID-19 virus escaped a Chinese lab that was researching it, thus causing the outbreak.
column8: Overall, Mosher’s argument is based on unfounded speculation and scientific inaccuracies. Multiple scientific studies have indicated that the virus has a natural origin, not the result of human engineering.
column9: steven w. mosher, new york post

column3: It is a weird and unusual year. An ice tunami occurred on Xingkai Lake in Heilongjiang.
column8: The video of the ice tsunami was filmed at River Yenisey in Dudinka, Russia, in June 2019. Not in China.

column3: An armored vehicle was so full of corpses so that it slipped off a trailer.

column8: The DPP councilor Wang Shijian has denied making such a statement. As to Feb. 25., 2020, Taiwan has 31 confirmed cases, one death toll

column3: A 1981 book predicted the coronavirus outbreak.
column8: The book does talk about a virus called Wuhan-400, but it's not the same as COVID-19.

column3: The link between COVID-19 and 5G is being hidden.
column8: The link is not being hidden because it doesn't exist.

column8: No Sars-Cov-2 cases at that time.
