column3: “The coronavirus is the common cold, folks.”
column8: The 2019 coronavirus is a new virus that had not been previously identified.

column3: Taiwanese manufacturing is awesome. One machine can produce 2.5 million face masks per day.
column8: According to the Taiwanese Economy Ministry, each production line of face mask produces around 100,000 masks per day. The claimed video is miscaptioned as well.

column3: Video shows the suspected infected people in eastern Turkey, Van.
column8: Video is not new. There is no proved COVID-19 case in Turkey by now.

column3: Author Dean Koontz foresaw the outbreak in his book.
column8: There is nothing common between the fictional virus in the book and current COVID-19 rather than Wuhan.

column3: Video says President Donald Trump spawned the “Wuhan super virus outbreak under code name ‘zyphr.’”
column8: There’s no evidence that President Trump had anything to do with the creation of the coronavirus.

column3: Sensationalist article claiming Nostradamus predicted the coronavirus.
column8: The predictions of Nostradamus are not correctly translated, and even if Nostradamus truly predicted a “plague”, the title of the original article says that it is taking place in a seaside town. The coronavirus originated in the city of Wuhan in China, which is not a seaside town, which can be confirmed by a simple Google search.

column3: Multiple allegations on how to protect oneself from CoV.
column8: Many of the practices detailed in the post are misleading and inaccurate.

column3: Cov infects chickens in Pakistan.
column8: Authorities say it's related to another disease.

column3: Infected taxi driver demands money from his government otherwise he’ll infect others.
column8: Story originated from a parody account, no driver is threatneing to spread covid-19 across Nigeria.

column3: Coronavirus arrived in Sarajevo, Bosnia and Herzegovina.
column8: Since the allegation that the corona virus arrived in Sarajevo is presented in the title as fact and that there are no confirmations in the text of the articles, all the articles are rated as misinformation and clickbait.

column3: Chinese official detainted a CoV case.
column8: It was an exercise.

column3: Pigs are burried alive due to coronavirus.
column8: The video is not recent and has nothing to do with coronavirus.

column3: Post says “People Of Color May Be Immune To The Coronavirus Because Of Melanin.”
column8: Melanin is a natural pigment that gives color to skin and eyes. It does not make you any less susceptible to coronavirus.

column3: A video showing an anti-China protest amid the COVID-19 outbreak in Italy.
column8: The video show a march in Rome to commemorate the 40th anniversary of the assassination of Valerio Verbano, an Italian left-wing activist murdered in 1980.

column3: A Facebook status from 2012 talked about the spread of coronavirus in 2020.
column8: The facebook status was updated on 27 Jan 2020.

column3: Years ago, there was a hand sanitizer active against Sars-Cov-2.
column8: The hand sanitizer is active against coronavirus in general. There is no specific sanitizer against Sars-Cov-2. Pagella Politica contacted the manufacturing company.

column3: TV news said: Ketamine can cure COVID-19.
column8: There is no evidence that Ketamine can prevent or treat COVID-19.

column3: Many corpses from South Taiwan were sent to Taichung to burn. Taiwan has serious communuity infection.
column8: The number of cremation in Taiwan hasn't increased significantly since the COVID-19 outbreak.

column3: A book by D.Koontz (The Eyes of Darkness) predicted COVID-19 in 1981.
column8: The first edition of the book mentioned that the virus was invented by the Russians, rather then the Chinese. Moreover, real and imaginary viruses have almost nothing in common.

column3: Chinese people convert to islam because of cov.
column8: Video is from May 2019.

column3: Radio host Rush Limbaugh compres novel coronavirus to ‘common cold’.
column8: Novel coronavirus is more deadly from the viruses that can cause a cold, according to experts.

column3: Cov case in Uttar Pradesh district.
column8: Authorities denied.

column3: Shoppers in China storm supermarket after cov outbreak.
column8: The video has circulated in media reports since at least October 2019, two months before the viral outbreak was first reported.

column3: A Chinese SWAT Team takes down a coronavirus suspect
column8: A mock drill video was shared as China committing atrocites on its patients.

column3: A Chinese man has been lynched because he pretended to have coronavirus.
column8: The man was Philippine and not Chinese. He was lynched because other people thought that he could potentially start spreading coronavirus Sars-Cov-2 in their city.

column3: “The Simpsons” predicted the coronavirus.
column8: An image from the show was altered to read “corona virus”.

column3: Is It Really That Mosques Across China Reopened After Corona Virus Plague?
column8: a video of worship activities in the Dongguan Mosque, China. However, no news was found that the mosque was ever closed or reopened.

column3: Chinese businessman Guo Wengui’s multiple allegations on coronavirus outbreak.
column8: - The outbreak was not a disaster in the mid of December. - The disease did not spread in US quickly after 18th of Feb. - Death rate is being updated day by day; not always same. - Wuhan's hospital capacity rise doesn't show the real number of infected. - Isolation centers in Wuhan are not concentration camps.

column3: The drug “arbidol” can help from the new coronavirus.
column8: The drug "arbidol" (other name - Umifenovir) is not proved to be a cure from coronavirus.

column3: This is a snow artwork from Wuhan.
column8: It's in another city, Shandong.

column3: This map shows high sulphur dioxide in Wuhan now due to burning of corpses.
column8: Those are only forecasts based on past emissions.

column3: Chinese people flee to Vietnam due to cov.
column8: The video is from november 2019.

column3: Video showing racist reactions towards Asian people.
column8: Those are actors.

column3: WHO considers canceling Mecca’s pilgrimage.
column8: WHO did not and could not take such a measure.

column3: These charts claim to show the difference among COVID-19, flu, common cold.
column8: Charts include inaccurate information about symptoms. They claim people suffering from the novel coronavirus do not develop some symptoms seen in flu or common cold patients, such as a runny or stuffy nose, a sore throat, vomiting, diarrhea and muscle pain, among others -- most of which can actually be seen among COVID-19 patients as well.

column3: A suspicious case of coronavirus in Militay Hospital in Maracay from a army member who claimed have visited China in December.

column8: A post claiming that four individuals in Zanzibar died from COVID-19 after handling a diseased chicken is false. The post contains images of a diseased chicken that circulated in other countries claiming to show symptoms of COVID-19.

column8: Dean Koontz, not Sylvia Browne, wrote about “Wuhan-400”.

column8: Post claiming China seeks court’s approval to kill 20000 coronavirus patients is fake.

column3: This coronavirus-infected patient reached to Dr. Vinod Kumar but he wasn’t given the treatment. He was later referred to Bhagalpur. It further states that one should avoid meat and fish for 3 months and wear mask to protect yourself from coronavirus.
column8: The post claiming that coronavirus infected patient reached Bihar and is not given treatment is fake. Health authorities dismiss the hoax report. Further, WHO has also not recommended to avoid fish and meat. It recommended thoroughly cooking meat and eggs. Wearing mask is, however, advisable.

column3: Video says “the coronavirus was invented and patented in the USA and then planted in China.”
column8: There is no evidence the coronavirus was “invented.”

column3: India has developed treatment for coronavirus.
column8: The headline of the viral article is misleading. So far, India has not claimed any such discovery.

column3: Rainbow shimmers behind cov disinfectant truck in China.

column3: Those are corpses on the street in Wuhan.

column3: Social media posts claim Chloroquine, an antimalarial drug can cure COVID-19.
column8: No health authorities have certified chloroquine as a cure for coronavirus. WHO, the foremost authority on the subject, according to the Director-General of the body, Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus, says while the organisation is currently conducting a number of drug trials, it does not expect a result before three weeks. column3: Coronavirus contains “HIV insertions”.
column8: This claim is based on a study which compared extremely short protein sequences between the 2019 novel coronavirus and HIV, a practice likely to give false positives. The study’s authors also overlooked checking for potential similarities between 2019-nCoV and other organisms. As it turned out, these short protein sequences were similar to many other organisms, not just HIV, thereby refuting the claim that 2019-nCoV contains DNA from the HIV virus.

NSW Health confirmed to AAP FactCheck there is no such organisation as the “Department of Diseasology Parramatta” and there have been no “positive readings” at train stations.

column3: A Chinese woman from Wuhan arrived in France with suspected symptoms of coronavirus.
column8: The Chinese embassy in France confirmed the presence of this Chinese woman in France and said that she gave reassuring news. According to French authorities, investigations are underway, but this suspicious case has never been officially reported.

column3: “So let me get this straight about this virus. It’s “new” yet it was lab created and patented in 2015 (in development since 03’).
column8: All of the posts link to patents that are related to two different viruses in the coronavirus family. There is no patent related to the new virus

column3: A new case of novel coronavirus was registered in Saudi Arabia. A nurse from India was diagnosed with the sepcific strain of the virus.
column8: "Acording to Dr. Tarik Al Azraqi, head of the commitee for infectious diseases in Saudi Arabia, the nurse was diagnosed and received treatment for MERS not 2019-nCoV."
column9: original post was from the "athens news agency-macedonian press agency"

column3: A Chinese person, who was taken from Kansai airport (in Osaka, Japan) to a hospital, has run away before they could be tested.
column8: According to the Kansai Airport Quarantine Station, this information is absolutely false.

column3: Coronavirus may have spread due to the consumption of bat soup, according to scientists.
column8: There is no evidence to support the claim that the consumption of bat soup is connected to the transmisson of the 2019-nCoV. One recent study indicates that the new virus does share genetic information with other kinds of coroviruses that infect bats, but it is still unclear which animals may have transmitted the virus to humans. Analysing a genetic database, researchers concluded that Chinese snakes are the most likely reservoir for the new pathogen, but the hypothesis has yet to be tested experimentally.

column3: Doctors said the entire Wuhan populaiton will die of the novel coronavirus.
column8: Authorities never said that and US CDC said most people will recover on their own.

column3: WhatsApp text that says, among other things, that the Chinese created the virus and that the main cities in China did not suffer from the pandemic.
column8: The cities of Shanghai and Beijing registered cases of COVID-19 and even adopted restrictive measures against the coronavirus. The Chinese economy has indeed felt the economic effects of the outbreak, differently from what the piece of disinformation states. The country's main stock exchange indices, CSI 300 and compound Shanghai, fell 8.7% and 6.4% only in March, respectively.

column3: A chain message circulated on Tuesday, January 14, warning people to avoid going to Shangri-La Plaza, a mall in Mandaluyong City, because of a supposed case of Severe Acute Respiratory Syndrome (SARS) reported in one of the mall’s medical clinics.
column8: The Department of Health (DOH) and Healthway Medical both issued advisories denying the claim in the chain message.

column3: Stores and supermarkets in Veracruz, Mexico will close due to coronavirus. Local government asks to buy supplies.
column8: Authorities ask not to make panic purchases. As of March 18, stores have not said they will close.

column3: The peak of the virus will be in two weeks. Normally, during those two weeks all the infections will occur, then there will be two weeks of calm and then two weeks where it goes down.
column8: The chance of getting SARS-CoV-2 only comes down to the next two weeks. What lasts two weeks or less is the incubation period.

column3: The coronavirus was created in a lab and patented.
column8: The patents circulating are linked to other coronaviruses and a patent for a virus does not mean it's man made.

column3: Saline solution can kill coronavirus.
column8: Doctor and WHO deny this claim.
column9: multiple posts an weibo, twitter and fb

column3: A post claims that you have to wear a disposable mask with the blue side out if you are sick and white side out if you are not.
column8: The only way to wear a mask is with blue face out, experts say to AFP.

column3: “There’s magically already a vaccine available.”
column8: Anthony S. Fauci, a top official at the National Institutes of Health (NIH), told Bloomberg Law that a potential vaccine "could move into early-stage human testing in the next three months."

column3: Warning: the virus is spreading in Italy (January 22).
column8: This news is not confirmed by any national or local newspaper nor by the Italian government.

column3: Russian scientists have a cure for fighting the new Chinese virus.
column8: There has been no new information on Triazavirin drug testing or its results. By the date of publication of this analysis, Triazavirin had not been confirmed as a cure for the new corona virus. Because the title of Sputnik's article claims that the Russian drug Triazavirin for COVID-19 is "ready", although the article does not contain this claim, the article receives clickbait and misinformation ratings.
column9: sputnik, and then other media outlets in the balkan region

column3: Coronavirus outbreak linked to eating bats.
column8: Bats are known natural reservoirs for coronaviruses. However, many other animals, such as civet cats and snakes, can also carry these viruses. There is currently not enough evidence to conclude that the 2019 coronavirus outbreak resulted from people eating bats in Wuhan, China.
column9: emma parker, writer at the daily star (and many others)

column3: There is a first case in Venezuela in the Bolivar state.
column8: The Association of Doctors in the State of Bolivar has publicly denied the information.
column9: americo de grazia, albertonews (tw) + whatsapp chain

column3: “[The coronavirus is] “new” yet it was lab-created and patented in 2015”.
column8: The post references the Wuhan coronavirus, but the patent filed is clearly stated to be for the SARS coronavirus, which caused the 2003 outbreak. Neither the SARS nor Wuhan coronavirus is lab-created; evidence points to an animal reservoir as the source of infection.
column9: chris kirckof and jordan sather on facebook and twitter
